Feat.Name: Extra Channel
Feat.Description: You can channel divine energy more often.
Feat.Benefit: You can channel energy two additional times per day.
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Ki
Feat.Description: You can use your ki pool more times per day than most.
Feat.Benefit: Your ki pool increases by 2.
Feat.Prereq: Ki pool class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Lay On Hands
Feat.Description: You can use your lay on hands ability more often.
Feat.Benefit: You can use your lay on hands ability two additional times per day.
Feat.Prereq: Lay on hands class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Mercy
Feat.Description: Your lay on hands ability adds an additional mercy.
Feat.Benefit: Select one additional mercy for which you qualify. When you use lay on hands to heal damage to one target, it also receives the additional effects of this mercy.
Feat.Prereq: Lay on hands class feature, mercy class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Performance
Feat.Description: You can use your bardic performance ability more often than normal.
Feat.Benefit: You can use bardic performance for 6 additional rounds per day.
Feat.Prereq: Bardic performance class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Rage
Feat.Description: You can use your rage ability more than normal.
Feat.Benefit: You can rage for 6 additional rounds per day.
Feat.Prereq: Rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Bombs
Feat.Description: You can throw more bombs per day.
Feat.Benefit: You can throw two additional bombs per day.
Feat.Prereq: Bomb class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Discovery
Feat.Description: You have made a new alchemical discovery.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional discovery. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this discovery.
Feat.Prereq: Discovery class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Rage Power
Feat.Description: You have unlocked a new ability to use while raging.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional rage power. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this rage power.
Feat.Prereq: Rage power class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Rogue Talent
Feat.Description: Through constant practice, you have learned how to perform a special trick.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional rogue talent. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this rogue talent.
Feat.Prereq: Rogue talent class feature.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Focus
Feat.Description: Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you have already selected Weapon Focus. You are a master at your chosen weapon.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus stacks with other bonuses on attack rolls, including those from Weapon Focus.
Feat.Prereq: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, 8th-level fighter.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Specialization
Feat.Description: Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you possess the Weapon Specialization feat. Your attacks with the chosen weapon are more devastating than normal.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus to damage stacks with other damage roll bonuses, including any you gain from Weapon Specialization.
Feat.Prereq: Proficiency with selected weapon, Greater Weapon Focus with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, Weapon Specialization with selected weapon, 12th-level fighter.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Greater Weapon Focus, Weapon Focus, Weapon Specialization

Feat.Name: Boon Companion
Feat.Description: Your bond with your animal companion or familiar is unusually close.
Feat.Benefit: The abilities of your animal companion or familiar are calculated as though your class were 4 levels higher, to a maximum effective druid level equal to your character level. If you have more than one animal companion or familiar, choose one to receive th
Feat.Prereq: Animal companion or familiar class feature.

Feat.Name: Meta Word Mastery
Feat.Description: You have uncovered a new word of power.
Feat.Benefit: Add one effect word from your class's word list to your list of words known. This is in addition to the number of words normally gained at each level in your class. You may instead add two words from your class's word list to your list of words known, but
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 1st, ability to cast wordspells, see Special.

Feat.Name: Acrobatic
Feat.Description: You are skilled at leaping, jumping, and flying.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Acrobatics and Fly skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Acrobatic Steps
Feat.Description: You can easily move over and through obstacles.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you move, you may move through up to 15 feet of difficult terrain each round as if it were normal terrain. The effects of this feat stack with those provided by Nimble Moves (allowing you to move normally through a total of 20 feet of difficult t
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Nimble Moves.

Feat.Name: Agile Maneuvers
Feat.Description: You've learned to use your quickness in place of brute force when performing combat maneuvers.
Feat.Benefit: You add your Dexterity bonus to your base attack bonus and size bonus when determining your Combat Maneuver Bonus (see Chapter 8) instead of your Strength bonus.

Feat.Name: Alertness
Feat.Description: You often notice things that others might miss.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on Perception and Sense Motive skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Alignment Channel
Feat.Description: Choose chaos, evil, good, or law. You can channel divine energy to affect outsiders that possess this subtype.
Feat.Benefit: Instead of its normal effect, you can choose to have your ability to channel energy heal or harm outsiders of the chosen alignment subtype. You must make this choice each time you channel energy. If you choose to heal or harm creatures of the chosen align
Feat.Prereq: Ability to channel energy.

Feat.Name: Animal Affinity
Feat.Description: You are skilled at working with animals and mounts.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Handle Animal and Ride skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Arcane Armor Mastery
Feat.Description: You have mastered the ability to cast spells while wearing armor.
Feat.Benefit: As a swift action, reduce the arcane spell failure chance due to the armor you are wearing by 20% for any spells you cast this round. This bonus replaces, and does not stack with, the bonus granted by Arcane Armor Training.
Feat.Prereq: Arcane Armor Training, Medium Armor Proficiency, caster level 7th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Arcane Armor Training, Medium Armor Proficiency

Feat.Name: Arcane Armor Training
Feat.Description: You have learned how to cast spells while wearing armor.
Feat.Benefit: As a swift action, reduce the arcane spell failure chance due to the armor you are wearing by 10% for any spells you cast this round.
Feat.Prereq: Light Armor Proficiency, caster level 3rd.

Feat.Name: Arcane Strike
Feat.Description: You draw upon your arcane power to enhance your weapons with magical energy.
Feat.Benefit: As a swift action, you can imbue your weapons with a fraction of your power. For 1 round, your weapons deal +1 damage and are treated as magic for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. For every five caster levels you possess, this bonus increases b
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast arcane spells.

Feat.Name: Armor Proficiency, Heavy
Feat.Description: You are skilled at wearing heavy armor.
Feat.Benefit: See Armor Proficiency, Light.
Feat.Prereq: Light Armor Proficiency, Medium Armor Proficiency.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Light Armor Proficiency, Medium Armor Proficiency

Feat.Name: Armor Proficiency, Light
Feat.Description: You are skilled at wearing light armor.
Feat.Benefit: When you wear a type of armor with which you are proficient, the armor check penalty for that armor applies only to Dexterity- and Strength-based skill checks.

Feat.Name: Armor Proficiency, Medium
Feat.Description: You are skilled at wearing medium armor.
Feat.Benefit: See Armor Proficiency, Light.
Feat.Prereq: Light Armor Proficiency.

Feat.Name: Athletic
Feat.Description: You possess inherent physical prowess.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on Climb and Swim skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Augment Summoning
Feat.Description: Your summoned creatures are more powerful and robust.
Feat.Benefit: Each creature you conjure with any summon spell gains a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength and Constitution for the duration of the spell that summoned it.
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus (conjuration).

Feat.Name: Bleeding Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hits cause opponents to bleed profusely.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing or piercing weapon, your opponent takes 2d6 points of bleed damage (see Appendix 2) each round on his turn, in addition to the damage dealt by the critical hit. Bleed damage can be stopped by a DC 15 Heal
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Blind-Fight
Feat.Description: You are skilled at attacking opponents that you cannot clearly perceive.
Feat.Benefit: In melee, every time you miss because of concealment (see Chapter 8), you can reroll your miss chance percentile roll one time to see if you actually hit. An invisible attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you in melee. That is, you don't lose yo

Feat.Name: Blinding Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hits blind your opponents.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent is permanently blinded. A successful Fortitude save reduces this to dazzled for 1d4 rounds. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. This feat has no effect on creatures that d
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, base attack bonus +15.

Feat.Name: Brew Potion
Feat.Description: You can create magic potions.
Feat.Benefit: You can create a potion of any 3rd-level or lower spell that you know and that targets one or more creatures or objects. Brewing a potion takes 2 hours if its base price is 250 gp or less, otherwise brewing a potion takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its ba
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 3rd.

Feat.Name: Catch Off-Guard
Feat.Description: Foes are surprised by your skilled use of unorthodox and improvised weapons.
Feat.Benefit: You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised melee weapon. Unarmed opponents are flat-footed against any attacks you make with an improvised melee weapon.

Feat.Name: Channel Smite
Feat.Description: You can channel your divine energy through a melee weapon you wield.
Feat.Benefit: Before you make a melee attack roll, you can choose to spend one use of your channel energy ability as a swift action. If you channel positive energy and you hit an undead creature, that creature takes an amount of additional damage equal to the damage de
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Cleave
Feat.Description: You can strike two adjacent foes with a single swing.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can make a single attack at your full base attack bonus against a foe within reach. If you hit, you deal damage normally and can make an additional attack (using your full base attack bonus) against a foe that is adjacent to the
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Combat Casting
Feat.Description: You are adept at spellcasting when threatened or distracted.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +4 bonus on concentration checks made to cast a spell or use a spell-like ability when casting on the defensive or while grappled.

Feat.Name: Combat Expertise
Feat.Description: You can increase your defense at the expense of your accuracy.
Feat.Benefit: You can choose to take a -1 penalty on melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to gain a +1 dodge bonus to your Armor Class. When your base attack bonus reaches +4, and every +4 thereafter, the penalty increases by -1 and the dodge bonus increases b
Feat.Prereq: Int 13.

Feat.Name: Combat Reflexes
Feat.Description: You can make additional attacks of opportunity.
Feat.Benefit: You may make a number of additional attacks of opportunity per round equal to your Dexterity bonus. With this feat, you may also make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed.

Feat.Name: Command Undead
Feat.Description: Using foul powers of necromancy, you can command undead creatures, making them into your servants.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can use one of your uses of channel negative energy to enslave undead within 30 feet. Undead receive a Will save to negate the effect. The DC for this Will save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your cleric level + your Charisma modifier. Und
Feat.Prereq: Channel negative energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Craft Magic Arms and Armor
Feat.Description: You can create magic armor, shields, and weapons.
Feat.Benefit: You can create magic weapons, armor, or shields. Enhancing a weapon, suit of armor, or shield takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in the price of its magical features. To enhance a weapon, suit of armor, or shield, you must use up raw materials costing half of
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 5th.

Feat.Name: Craft Rod
Feat.Description: You can create magic rods.
Feat.Benefit: You can create magic rods. Crafting a rod takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a rod, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price. See the magic item creation rules in Chapter 15 for more information.
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 9th.

Feat.Name: Craft Wand
Feat.Description: You can create magic wands.
Feat.Benefit: You can create a wand of any 4th-level or lower spell that you know. Crafting a wand takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a wand, you must use up raw materials costing half of this base price. A newly created wand has 50 charges. See
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 5th.

Feat.Name: Craft Staff
Feat.Description: You can create magic staves.
Feat.Benefit: You can create any staff whose prerequisites you meet. Crafting a staff takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a staff, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price. A newly created staff has 10 charges. See the magic it
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 11th.

Feat.Name: Craft Wondrous Item
Feat.Description: You can create wondrous items, a type of magic item.
Feat.Benefit: You can create a wide variety of magic wondrous items. Crafting a wondrous item takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its price. To create a wondrous item, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price. See the magic item creation rules in Chapt
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 3rd.

Feat.Name: Critical Focus
Feat.Description: You are trained in the art of causing pain.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +4 circumstance bonus on attack rolls made to confirm critical hits.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Critical Mastery
Feat.Description: Your critical hits cause two additional effects.
Feat.Benefit: When you score a critical hit, you can apply the effects of two critical feats in addition to the damage dealt.
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, any two critical feats, 14th-level fighter.

Feat.Name: Dazzling Display
Feat.Description: Your skill with your favored weapon can frighten enemies.
Feat.Benefit: While wielding the weapon in which you have Weapon Focus, you can perform a bewildering show of prowess as a full-round action. Make an Intimidate check to demoralize all foes within 30 feet who can see your display.
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus, proficiency with the selected weapon.

Feat.Name: Deadly Aim
Feat.Description: You can make exceptionally deadly ranged attacks by pinpointing a foe's weak spot, at the expense of making the attack less likely to succeed.
Feat.Benefit: You can choose to take a -1 penalty on all ranged attack rolls to gain a +2 bonus on all ranged damage rolls. When your base attack bonus reaches +4, and every +4 thereafter, the penalty increases by -1 and the bonus to damage increases by +2. You must ch
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Deadly Stroke
Feat.Description: With a well-placed strike, you can bring a swift and painful end to most foes.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, make a single attack with the weapon for which you have Greater Weapon Focus against a stunned or flat-footed opponent. If you hit, you deal double the normal damage and the target takes 1 point of Constitution bleed (see Appendix 2)
Feat.Prereq: Dazzling Display, Greater Weapon Focus, Shatter Defenses, Weapon Focus, proficiency with the selected weapon, base attack bonus +11.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Dazzling Display, Greater Weapon Focus, Shatter Defenses, Weapon Focus

Feat.Name: Deafening Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hits cause enemies to lose their hearing.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit against an opponent, the victim is permanently deafened. A successful Fortitude save reduces the deafness to 1 round. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. This feat has no effect on deaf
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, base attack bonus +13.

Feat.Name: Deceitful
Feat.Description: You are skilled at deceiving others, both with the spoken word and with physical disguises.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Bluff and Disguise skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Defensive Combat Training
Feat.Description: You excel at defending yourself from all manner of combat maneuvers.
Feat.Benefit: You treat your total Hit Dice as your base attack bonus when calculating your Combat Maneuver Defense (see Chapter 8).

Feat.Name: Deflect Arrows
Feat.Description: You can knock arrows and other projectiles off course, preventing them from hitting you.
Feat.Benefit: You must have at least one hand free (holding nothing) to use this feat. Once per round when you would normally be hit with an attack from a ranged weapon, you may def lect it so that you take no damage from it. You must be aware of the attack and not fla
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Deft Hands
Feat.Description: You have exceptional manual dexterity.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on Disable Device and Sleight of Hand skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Diehard
Feat.Description: You are especially hard to kill. Not only do your wounds automatically stabilize when grievously injured, but you can remain conscious and continue to act even at death's door.
Feat.Benefit: When your hit point total is below 0, but you are not dead, you automatically stabilize. You do not need to make a Constitution check each round to avoid losing additional hit points. You may choose to act as if you were disabled, rather than dying. You m

Feat.Name: Disruptive
Feat.Description: Your training makes it difficult for enemy spellcasters to safely cast spells near you.
Feat.Benefit: The DC to cast spells defensively increases by +4 for all enemies that are within your threatened area. This increase to casting spells defensively only applies if you are aware of the enemy's location and are capable of taking an attack of opportunity. I
Feat.Prereq: 6th-level fighter.

Feat.Name: Dodge
Feat.Description: Your training and ref lexes allow you to react swiftly to avoid an opponents' attacks.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 dodge bonus to your AC. A condition that makes you lose your Dex bonus to AC also makes you lose the benefits of this feat.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13.

Feat.Name: Double Slice
Feat.Description: Your off-hand weapon while dual-wielding strikes with greater power.
Feat.Benefit: Add your Strength bonus to damage rolls made with your off-hand weapon.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Two-Weapon Fighting.

Feat.Name: Elemental Channel
Feat.Description: Choose one elemental subtype, such as air, earth, fire, or water. You can channel your divine energy to harm or heal outsiders that possess your chosen elemental subtype.
Feat.Benefit: Instead of its normal effect, you can choose to have your ability to channel energy heal or harm outsiders of your chosen elemental subtype. You must make this choice each time you channel energy. If you choose to heal or harm creatures of your elemental
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Empower Spell
Feat.Description: You can increase the power of your spells, causing them to deal more damage.
Feat.Benefit: All variable, numeric effects of an empowered spell are increased by half, including bonuses to those dice rolls. Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables. An empowered spell uses up a spell slot two levels

Feat.Name: Endurance
Feat.Description: Harsh conditions or long exertions do not easily tire you.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +4 bonus on the following checks and saves: Swim checks made to resist nonlethal damage from exhaustion; Constitution checks made to continue running; Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from a forced march; Constitution checks m

Feat.Name: Enlarge Spell
Feat.Description: You can increase the range of your spells.
Feat.Benefit: You can alter a spell with a range of close, medium, or long to increase its range by 100%. An enlarged spell with a range of close now has a range of 50 ft. + 5 ft./ level, while medium-range spells have a range of 200 ft. + 20 ft./level and long-range s

Feat.Name: Eschew Materials
Feat.Description: You can cast many spells without needing to utilize minor material components.
Feat.Benefit: You can cast any spell with a material component costing 1 gp or less without needing that component. The casting of the spell still provokes attacks of opportunity as normal. If the spell requires a material component that costs more than 1 gp, you must

Feat.Name: Exhausting Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hits cause opponents to become exhausted.
Feat.Benefit: When you score a critical hit on a foe, your target immediately becomes exhausted. This feat has no effect on exhausted creatures.
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, Tiring Critical, base attack bonus +15.

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency
Feat.Description: Choose one type of exotic weapon, such as the spiked chain or whip. You understand how to use that type of exotic weapon in combat, and can utilize any special tricks or qualities that exotic weapon might allow.
Feat.Benefit: You make attack rolls with the weapon normally.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Extend Spell
Feat.Description: You can make your spells last twice as long.
Feat.Benefit: An extended spell lasts twice as long as normal. A spell with a duration of concentration, instantaneous, or permanent is not affected by this feat. An extended spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

Feat.Name: Extra Hex
Feat.Description: You have learned the secrets of a new hex.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional hex. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this hex.
Feat.Prereq: Hex class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Revelation
Feat.Description: You have discovered a new aspect of your mystery.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional revelation. You must meet all of the prerequisites for this revelation.
Feat.Prereq: Revelation class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Word
Feat.Description: You are skilled at using meta words to enhance your wordcasting ability.
Feat.Benefit: You can use meta words three additional times per day. In addition, select one additional meta word and add it to your spellbook, familiar, or list of words known.
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast wordspells.

Feat.Name: Experimental Spellcaster
Feat.Description: Despite casting spells, you dabble in the art of wordcasting.
Feat.Benefit: Select one class that grants you the ability to cast spells. You can now use the slots from that class to cast a limited number of words of power spells. Add all of the target words to your spell list and your spellbook, familiar, or list of spells known.
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast spells.

Feat.Name: Far Shot
Feat.Description: You are more accurate at longer ranges.
Feat.Benefit: You only suffer a -1 penalty per full range increment between you and your target when using a ranged weapon.
Feat.Prereq: Point-Blank Shot.

Feat.Name: Fleet
Feat.Description: You are faster than most.
Feat.Benefit: While you are wearing light or no armor, your base speed increases by 5 feet. You lose the benefits of this feat if you carry a medium or heavy load.

Feat.Name: Forge Ring
Feat.Description: You can create magic rings.
Feat.Benefit: You can create magic rings. Crafting a ring takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a ring, you must use up raw materials costing half of the base price. See the magic item creation rules in Chapter 15 for more information. You can also
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 7th.

Feat.Name: Gorgon's Fist
Feat.Description: With one well-placed blow, you leave your target reeling.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, make a single unarmed melee attack against a foe whose speed is reduced (such as from Scorpion Style). If the attack hits, you deal damage normally and the target is staggered until the end of your next turn unless it makes a Fortitu
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Scorpion Style, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Great Cleave
Feat.Description: You can strike many adjacent foes with a single blow.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can make a single attack at your full base attack bonus against a foe within reach. If you hit, you deal damage normally and can make an additional attack (using your full base attack bonus) against a foe that is adjacent to the
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Power Attack, base attack bonus +4.

Feat.Name: Great Fortitude
Feat.Description: You are resistant to poisons, diseases, and other maladies.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Fortitude saving throws.

Feat.Name: Greater Bull Rush
Feat.Description: Your bull rush attacks throw enemies off balance.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to bull rush a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Bull Rush. Whenever you bull rush an opponent, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).
Feat.Prereq: Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

Feat.Name: Greater Disarm
Feat.Description: You can knock weapons far from an enemy's grasp.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to disarm a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Disarm. Whenever you successfully disarm an opponent, the weapon lands 15 feet away from its previous wielder, in a random direction.
Feat.Prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Disarm, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

Feat.Name: Greater Feint
Feat.Description: You are skilled at making foes overreact to your attacks.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use feint to cause an opponent to lose his Dexterity bonus, he loses that bonus until the beginning of your next turn, in addition to losing his Dexterity bonus against your next attack.
Feat.Prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Feint, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

Feat.Name: Greater Grapple
Feat.Description: Maintaining a grapple is second nature to you.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Grapple. Once you have grappled a creature, maintaining the grapple is a move action. This feat allows you to make two grapple checks each round (
Feat.Prereq: Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +6, Dex 13.

Feat.Name: Greater Overrun
Feat.Description: Enemies must dive to avoid your dangerous move.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to overrun a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Overrun. Whenever you overrun opponents, they provoke attacks of opportunity if they are knocked prone by your overrun.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Overrun, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

Feat.Name: Greater Penetrating Strike
Feat.Description: Your attacks penetrate the defenses of most foes.
Feat.Benefit: Your attacks made with weapons selected with Weapon Focus ignore up to 10 points of damage reduction. This amount is reduced to 5 points for damage reduction without a type (such as DR 10/-).
Feat.Prereq: Penetrating Strike, Weapon Focus, 16th-level fighter.

Feat.Name: Greater Shield Focus
Feat.Description: You are skilled at def lecting blows with your shield.
Feat.Benefit: Increase the AC bonus granted by any shield you are using by 1. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Shield Focus.
Feat.Prereq: Shield Focus, Shield Proficiency, 8th-level fighter.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Focus
Feat.Description: Choose a school of magic to which you have already applied the Spell Focus feat. Any spells you cast of this school are very hard to resist.
Feat.Benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select. This bonus stacks with the bonus from Spell Focus.
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Penetration
Feat.Description: Your spells break through spell resistance much more easily than most.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature's spell resistance. This bonus stacks with the one from Spell Penetration.
Feat.Prereq: Spell Penetration.

Feat.Name: Greater Sunder
Feat.Description: Your devastating strikes cleave through weapons and armor and into their wielders, damaging both item and wielder alike in a single terrific strike.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to sunder an item. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Sunder. Whenever you sunder to destroy a weapon, shield, or suit of armor, any excess damage is applied to the item's wielder. No damage is trans
Feat.Prereq: Improved Sunder, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

Feat.Name: Greater Trip
Feat.Description: You can make free attacks on foes that you knock down.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to trip a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Trip. Whenever you successfully trip an opponent, that opponent provokes attacks of opportunity.
Feat.Prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

Feat.Name: Greater Two-Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: You are incredibly skilled at fighting with two weapons at the same time.
Feat.Benefit: You get a third attack with your off-hand weapon, albeit at a -10 penalty.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 19, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Greater Vital Strike
Feat.Description: You can make a single attack that deals incredible damage.
Feat.Benefit: When you use the attack action, you can make one attack at your highest base attack bonus that deals additional damage. Roll the weapon's damage dice for the attack four times and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilit
Feat.Prereq: Improved Vital Strike, Vital Strike, base attack bonus +16.

Feat.Name: Heighten Spell
Feat.Description: You can cast spells as if they were a higher level.
Feat.Benefit: A heightened spell has a higher spell level than normal (up to a maximum of 9th level). Unlike other metamagic feats, Heighten Spell actually increases the effective level of the spell that it modifies. All effects dependent on spell level (such as saving

Feat.Name: Improved Bull Rush
Feat.Description: You are skilled at pushing your foes around.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a bull rush combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to bull rush a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to bull
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Improved Channel
Feat.Description: Your channeled energy is harder to resist.
Feat.Benefit: Add 2 to the DC of saving throws made to resist the effects of your channel energy ability.
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Improved Counterspell
Feat.Description: You are skilled at countering the spells of others using similar spells.
Feat.Benefit: When counterspelling, you may use a spell of the same school that is one or more spell levels higher than the target spell.

Feat.Name: Improved Critical
Feat.Description: Attacks made with your chosen weapon are quite deadly.
Feat.Benefit: When using the weapon you selected, your threat range is doubled.
Feat.Prereq: Proficient with weapon, base attack bonus +8.

Feat.Name: Improved Disarm
Feat.Description: You are skilled at knocking weapons from a foe's grasp.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a disarm combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to disarm a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to disarm you.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Improved Familiar
Feat.Description: This feat allows you to acquire a powerful familiar, but only when you could normally acquire a new familiar.
Feat.Benefit: When choosing a familiar, the creatures listed below are also available to you (see the Pathfinder RPG Bestiary for statistics on these creatures). You may choose a familiar with an alignment up to one step away on each alignment axis (lawful through chao
Feat.Prereq: Ability to acquire a new familiar, compatible alignment, sufficiently high level (see below).

Feat.Name: Improved Feint
Feat.Description: You are skilled at fooling your opponents in combat.
Feat.Benefit: You can make a Bluff check to feint in combat as a move action.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Improved Grapple
Feat.Description: You are skilled at grappling opponents.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a grapple combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to grapple y
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Improved Great Fortitude
Feat.Description: You can draw upon an inner reserve to resist diseases, poisons, and other grievous harm.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you may reroll a Fortitude save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.
Feat.Prereq: Great Fortitude.

Feat.Name: Improved Initiative
Feat.Description: Your quick ref lexes allow you to react rapidly to danger.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +4 bonus on initiative checks.

Feat.Name: Improved Iron Will
Feat.Description: Your clarity of thought allows you to resist mental attacks.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you may reroll a Will save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.
Feat.Prereq: Iron Will.

Feat.Name: Improved Lightning Reflexes
Feat.Description: You have a knack for avoiding danger all around you.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you may reroll a Ref lex save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.
Feat.Prereq: Lightning Reflexes.

Feat.Name: Improved Overrun
Feat.Description: You are skilled at running down your foes.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing an overrun combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to overrrun a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to overrun
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Improved Precise Shot
Feat.Description: Your ranged attacks ignore anything but total concealment and cover.
Feat.Benefit: Your ranged attacks ignore the AC bonus granted to targets by anything less than total cover, and the miss chance granted to targets by anything less than total concealment. Total cover and total concealment provide their normal benefits against your rang
Feat.Prereq: Dex 19, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Improved Shield Bash
Feat.Description: You can protect yourself with your shield, even if you use it to attack.
Feat.Benefit: When you perform a shield bash, you may still apply the shield's shield bonus to your AC.
Feat.Prereq: Shield Proficiency.

Feat.Name: Improved Sunder
Feat.Description: You are skilled at damaging your foes' weapons and armor.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a sunder combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to sunder an item. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to sunder yo
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Improved Trip
Feat.Description: You are skilled at sending your opponents to the ground.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a trip combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to trip a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to trip you.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Improved Two-Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: You are skilled at fighting with two weapons.
Feat.Benefit: In addition to the standard single extra attack you get with an off-hand weapon, you get a second attack with it, albeit at a -5 penalty.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 17, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Improved Unarmed Strike
Feat.Description: You are skilled at fighting while unarmed.
Feat.Benefit: You are considered to be armed even when unarmed-you do not provoke attacks of opportunity when you attack foes while unarmed. Your unarmed strikes can deal lethal or nonlethal damage, at your choice.

Feat.Name: Improved Vital Strike
Feat.Description: You can make a single attack that deals a large amount of damage.
Feat.Benefit: When you use the attack action, you can make one attack at your highest base attack bonus that deals additional damage. Roll the weapon's damage dice for the attack three times and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abili
Feat.Prereq: Vital Strike, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Improvised Weapon Mastery
Feat.Description: You can turn nearly any object into a deadly weapon, from a razor-sharp chair leg to a sack of flour.
Feat.Benefit: You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised weapon. Increase the amount of damage dealt by the improvised weapon by one step (for example, 1d4 becomes 1d6) to a maximum of 1d8 (2d6 if the improvised weapon is two-handed). The improvised weapon
Feat.Prereq: Catch Off-Guard or Throw Anything, base attack bonus +8.

Feat.Name: Intimidating Prowess
Feat.Description: Your physical might is intimidating to others.
Feat.Benefit: Add your Strength modifier to Intimidate skill checks in addition to your Charisma modifier.

Feat.Name: Iron Will
Feat.Description: You are more resistant to mental effects.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Will saving throws.

Feat.Name: Leadership
Feat.Description: You attract followers to your cause and a companion to join you on your adventures.
Feat.Benefit: This feat enables you to attract a loyal cohort and a number of devoted subordinates who assist you. A cohort is generally an NPC with class levels, while followers are typically lower level NPCs. See Table 5-2 for what level of cohort and how many follow
Feat.Prereq: Character level 7th.

Feat.Name: Lightning Reflexes
Feat.Description: You have faster ref lexes than normal.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Ref lex saving throws.

Feat.Name: Lightning Stance
Feat.Description: The speed at which you move makes it nearly impossible for opponents to strike you.
Feat.Benefit: If you take two actions to move or a withdraw action in a turn, you gain 50% concealment for 1 round.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 17, Dodge, Wind Stance, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Lunge
Feat.Description: You can strike foes that would normally be out of reach.
Feat.Benefit: You can increase the reach of your melee attacks by 5 feet until the end of your turn by taking a -2 penalty to your AC until your next turn. You must decide to use this ability before any attacks are made.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Magical Aptitude
Feat.Description: You are skilled at spellcasting and using magic items.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Spellcraft checks and Use Magic Device checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Manyshot
Feat.Description: You can fire multiple arrows at a single target.
Feat.Benefit: When making a full-attack action with a bow, your first attack fires two arrows. If the attack hits, both arrows hit. Apply precision-based damage (such as sneak attack) and critical hit damage only once for this attack. Damage bonuses from using a compos
Feat.Prereq: Dex 17, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency
Feat.Description: Choose a type of martial weapon. You understand how to use that type of martial weapon in combat.
Feat.Benefit: You make attack rolls with the selected weapon normally (without the non-proficient penalty).

Feat.Name: Master Craftsman
Feat.Description: Your superior crafting skills allow you to create simple magic items.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one Craft or Profession skill in which you possess at least 5 ranks. You receive a +2 bonus on your chosen Craft or Profession skill. Ranks in your chosen skill count as your caster level for the purposes of qualifying for the Craft Magic Arms and
Feat.Prereq: 5 ranks in any Craft or Profession skill.

Feat.Name: Maximize Spell
Feat.Description: Your spells have the maximum possible effect.
Feat.Benefit: All variable, numeric effects of a spell modified by this feat are maximized. Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables. A maximized spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual lev

Feat.Name: Medusa's Wrath
Feat.Description: You can take advantage of your opponent's confusion, delivering multiple blows.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use the full-attack action and make at least one unarmed strike, you can make two additional unarmed strikes at your highest base attack bonus. These bonus attacks must be made against a dazed, flat-footed, paralyzed, staggered, stunned, or u
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Gorgon's Fist, Scorpion Style, base attack bonus +11.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Unarmed Strike, Gorgon's Fist, Scorpion Style

Feat.Name: Mobility
Feat.Description: You can easily move through a dangerous melee.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +4 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks of opportunity caused when you move out of or within a threatened area. A condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses. Dodge bonuses s
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Dodge.

Feat.Name: Mounted Archery
Feat.Description: You are skilled at making ranged attacks while mounted.
Feat.Benefit: The penalty you take when using a ranged weapon while mounted is halved: -2 instead of -4 if your mount is taking a double move, and -4 instead of -8 if your mount is running.
Feat.Prereq: Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat.

Feat.Name: Mounted Combat
Feat.Description: You are adept at guiding your mount through combat.
Feat.Benefit: Once per round when your mount is hit in combat, you may attempt a Ride check (as an immediate action) to negate the hit. The hit is negated if your Ride check result is greater than the opponent's attack roll.
Feat.Prereq: Ride 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Natural Spell
Feat.Description: You can cast spells even while in a form that cannot normally cast spells.
Feat.Benefit: You can complete the verbal and somatic components of spells while using wild shape. You substitute various noises and gestures for the normal verbal and somatic components of a spell. You can also use any material components or focuses you possess, even
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, wild shape class feature.

Feat.Name: Nimble Moves
Feat.Description: You can move across a single obstacle with ease.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you move, you may move through 5 feet of difficult terrain each round as if it were normal terrain. This feat allows you to take a 5-foot step into difficult terrain.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13.

Feat.Name: Penetrating Strike
Feat.Description: Your attacks are capable of penetrating the defenses of some creatures.
Feat.Benefit: Your attacks made with weapons selected with Weapon Focus ignore up to 5 points of damage reduction. This feat does not apply to damage reduction without a type (such as DR 10/-).
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus, 12th-level fighter, proficiency with weapon.

Feat.Name: Persuasive
Feat.Description: You are skilled at swaying attitudes and intimidating others into your way of thinking.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on Diplomacy and Intimidate skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Pinpoint Targeting
Feat.Description: You can target the weak points in your opponent's armor.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, make a single ranged attack. The target does not gain any armor, natural armor, or shield bonuses to its Armor Class. You do not gain the benefit of this feat if you move this round.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 19, Improved Precise Shot, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +16.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Precise Shot, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot

Feat.Name: Point-Blank Shot
Feat.Description: You are especially accurate when making ranged attacks against close targets.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons at ranges of up to 30 feet.

Feat.Name: Power Attack
Feat.Description: You can make exceptionally deadly melee attacks by sacrificing accuracy for strength.
Feat.Benefit: You can choose to take a -1 penalty on all melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to gain a +2 bonus on all melee damage rolls. This bonus to damage is increased by half (+50%) if you are making an attack with a two-handed weapon, a one handed weap
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Precise Shot
Feat.Description: You are adept at firing ranged attacks into melee.
Feat.Benefit: You can shoot or throw ranged weapons at an opponent engaged in melee without taking the standard -4 penalty on your attack roll.
Feat.Prereq: Point-Blank Shot.

Feat.Name: Quick Draw
Feat.Description: You can draw weapons faster than most.
Feat.Benefit: You can draw a weapon as a free action instead of as a move action. You can draw a hidden weapon (see the Sleight of Hand skill) as a move action. A character who has selected this feat may throw weapons at his full normal rate of attacks (much like a cha
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Quicken Spell
Feat.Description: You can cast spells in a fraction of the normal time.
Feat.Benefit: Casting a quickened spell is a swift action. You can perform another action, even casting another spell, in the same round as you cast a quickened spell. A spell whose casting time is more than 1 round or 1 fullround action cannot be quickened. A quickene

Feat.Name: Rapid Reload
Feat.Description: Choose a type of crossbow (hand, light, or heavy). You can reload such weapons quickly.
Feat.Benefit: The time required for you to reload your chosen type of crossbow is reduced to a free action (for a hand or light crossbow) or a move action (for a heavy crossbow). Reloading a crossbow still provokes an attack of opportunity. If you have selected this fe
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Proficiency (crossbow type chosen).

Feat.Name: Rapid Shot
Feat.Description: You can make an additional ranged attack.
Feat.Benefit: When making a full-attack action with a ranged weapon, you can fire one additional time this round at your highest bonus. All of your attack rolls take a -2 penalty when using Rapid Shot.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Point-Blank Shot.

Feat.Name: Ride-By Attack
Feat.Description: While mounted and charging, you can move, strike at a foe, and then continue moving.
Feat.Benefit: When you are mounted and use the charge action, you may move and attack as if with a standard charge and then move again (continuing the straight line of the charge). Your total movement for the round can't exceed double your mounted speed. You and your m
Feat.Prereq: Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat.

Feat.Name: Run
Feat.Description: You are swift of foot.
Feat.Benefit: When running, you move five times your normal speed (if wearing medium, light, or no armor and carrying no more than a medium load) or four times your speed (if wearing heavy armor or carrying a heavy load). If you make a jump after a running start (see t

Feat.Name: Scorpion Style
Feat.Description: You can perform an unarmed strike that greatly hampers your target's movement.
Feat.Benefit: To use this feat, you must make a single unarmed attack as a standard action. If this unarmed attack hits, you deal damage normally, and the target's base land speed is reduced to 5 feet for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier unless it makes
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Scribe Scroll
Feat.Description: You can create magic scrolls.
Feat.Benefit: You can create a scroll of any spell that you know. Scribing a scroll takes 2 hours if its base price is 250 gp or less, otherwise scribing a scroll takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To scribe a scroll, you must use up raw materials costing
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 1st.

Feat.Name: Selective Channeling
Feat.Description: You can choose whom to affect when you channel energy.
Feat.Benefit: When you channel energy, you can choose a number of targets in the area up to your Charisma modifier. These targets are not affected by your channeled energy.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, channel energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Self-Sufficient
Feat.Description: You know how to get along in the wild and how to effectively treat wounds.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Heal checks and Survival checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Shatter Defenses
Feat.Description: Your skill with your chosen weapon leaves opponents unable to defend themselves if you strike them when their defenses are already compromised.
Feat.Benefit: Any shaken, frightened, or panicked opponent hit by you this round is flat-footed to your attacks until the end of your next turn. This includes any additional attacks you make this round.
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus, Dazzling Display, base attack bonus +6, proficiency with weapon.

Feat.Name: Shield Focus
Feat.Description: You are skilled at def lecting blows with your shield.
Feat.Benefit: Increase the AC bonus granted by any shield you are using by 1.
Feat.Prereq: Shield Proficiency, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Shield Proficiency
Feat.Description: You are trained in how to properly use a shield.
Feat.Benefit: When you use a shield (except a tower shield), the shield's armor check penalty only applies to Strength- and Dexterity-based skills.

Feat.Name: Shield Slam
Feat.Description: In the right position, your shield can be used to send opponents flying.
Feat.Benefit: Any opponents hit by your shield bash are also hit with a free bull rush attack, substituting your attack roll for the combat maneuver check (see Chapter 8). This bull rush does not provoke an attack of opportunity. Opponents who cannot move back due to a
Feat.Prereq: Improved Shield Bash, Shield Proficiency, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Shield Bash, Shield Proficiency, Two-Weapon Fighting

Feat.Name: Shot on the Run
Feat.Description: You can move, fire a ranged weapon, and move again before your foes can react.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, you can move up to your speed and make a single ranged attack at any point during your movement.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility, Point-Blank Shot, base attack bonus +4.

Feat.Name: Sickening Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hits cause opponents to become sickened.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent becomes sickened for 1 minute. The effects of this feat do not stack. Additional hits instead add to the effect's duration.
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Silent Spell
Feat.Description: You can cast your spells without making any sound.
Feat.Benefit: A silent spell can be cast with no verbal components. Spells without verbal components are not affected. A silent spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

Feat.Name: Simple Weapon Proficiency
Feat.Description: You are trained in the use of basic weapons.
Feat.Benefit: You make attack rolls with simple weapons without penalty.

Feat.Name: Skill Focus
Feat.Description: Choose a skill. You are particularly adept at that skill.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +3 bonus on all checks involving the chosen skill. If you have 10 or more ranks in that skill, this bonus increases to +6.

Feat.Name: Snatch Arrows
Feat.Description: Instead of knocking an arrow or ranged attack aside, you can catch it in mid-flight.
Feat.Benefit: When using the Def lect Arrows feat you may choose to catch the weapon instead of just def lecting it. Thrown weapons can immediately be thrown back as an attack against the original attacker (even though it isn't your turn) or kept for later use. You mus
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Deflect Arrows, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Spell Focus
Feat.Description: Choose a school of magic. Any spells you cast of that school are more difficult to resist.
Feat.Benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select.

Feat.Name: Spell Mastery
Feat.Description: You have mastered a small handful of spells, and can prepare these spells without referencing your spellbooks at all.
Feat.Benefit: Each time you take this feat, choose a number of spells that you already know equal to your Intelligence modifier. From that point on, you can prepare these spells without referring to a spellbook.
Feat.Prereq: 1st-level wizard.

Feat.Name: Spell Penetration
Feat.Description: Your spells break through spell resistance more easily than most.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature's spell resistance.

Feat.Name: Spellbreaker
Feat.Description: You can strike at enemy spellcasters who fail to cast defensively when you threaten them.
Feat.Benefit: Enemies in your threatened area that fail their checks to cast spells defensively provoke attacks of opportunity from you.
Feat.Prereq: Disruptive, 10th-level fighter.

Feat.Name: Spirited Charge
Feat.Description: Your mounted charge attacks deal a tremendous amount of damage.
Feat.Benefit: When mounted and using the charge action, you deal double damage with a melee weapon (or triple damage with a lance).
Feat.Prereq: Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat, Ride-By Attack.

Feat.Name: Spring Attack
Feat.Description: You can deftly move up to a foe, strike, and withdraw before he can react.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, you can move up to your speed and make a single melee attack without provoking any attacks of opportunity from the target of your attack. You can move both before and after the attack, but you must move at least 10 feet before the
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility, base attack bonus +4.

Feat.Name: Staggering Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hits cause opponents to slow down.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent becomes staggered for 1d4+1 rounds. A successful Fortitude save reduces the duration to 1 round. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. The effects of this feat do not stack.
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, base attack bonus +13.

Feat.Name: Stand Still
Feat.Description: You can stop foes that try to move past you.
Feat.Benefit: When a foe provokes an attack of opportunity due to moving through your adjacent squares, you can make a combat maneuver check as your attack of opportunity. If successful, the enemy cannot move for the rest of his turn. An enemy can still take the rest o
Feat.Prereq: Combat Reflexes.

Feat.Name: Stealthy
Feat.Description: You are good at avoiding unwanted attention and slipping out of bonds.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Escape Artist and Stealth skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Step Up
Feat.Description: You can close the distance when a foe tries to move away.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an adjacent foe attempts to take a 5-foot step away from you, you may also make a 5-foot step as an immediate action so long as you end up adjacent to the foe that triggered this ability. If you take this step, you cannot take a 5-foot step durin
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Still Spell
Feat.Description: You can cast spells without moving.
Feat.Benefit: A stilled spell can be cast with no somatic components. Spells without somatic components are not affected. A stilled spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

Feat.Name: Strike Back
Feat.Description: You can strike at foes that attack you using their superior reach, by targeting their limbs or weapons as they come at you.
Feat.Benefit: You can ready an action to make a melee attack against any foe that attacks you in melee, even if the foe is outside of your reach.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Stunning Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hits cause opponents to become stunned.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent becomes stunned for 1d4 rounds. A successful Fortitude save reduces this to staggered for 1d4 rounds. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. The effects of this feat do not s
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, Staggering Critical, base attack bonus +17.

Feat.Name: Stunning Fist
Feat.Description: You know just where to strike to temporarily stun a foe.
Feat.Benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus, a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). Stunning Fist forces a foe damaged by your unarmed attack to make a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + y
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.

Feat.Name: Throw Anything
Feat.Description: You are used to throwing things you have on hand.
Feat.Benefit: You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised ranged weapon. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on attack rolls made with thrown splash weapons.

Feat.Name: Tiring Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hits cause opponents to become fatigued.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent becomes fatigued. This feat has no additional effect on a fatigued or exhausted creature.
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, base attack bonus +13.

Feat.Name: Toughness
Feat.Description: You have enhanced physical stamina.
Feat.Benefit: You gain +3 hit points. For every Hit Die you possess beyond 3, you gain an additional +1 hit point. If you have more than 3 Hit Dice, you gain +1 hit points whenever you gain a Hit Die (such as when you gain a level).

Feat.Name: Tower Shield Proficiency
Feat.Description: You are trained in how to properly use a tower shield.
Feat.Benefit: When you use a tower shield, the shield's armor check penalty only applies to Strength and Dexterity-based skills.
Feat.Prereq: Shield Proficiency.

Feat.Name: Trample
Feat.Description: While mounted, you can ride down opponents and trample them under your mount.
Feat.Benefit: When you attempt to overrun an opponent while mounted, your target may not choose to avoid you. Your mount may make one hoof attack against any target you knock down, gaining the standard +4 bonus on attack rolls against prone targets.
Feat.Prereq: Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat.

Feat.Name: Turn Undead
Feat.Description: Calling upon higher powers, you cause undead to flee from the might of your unleashed divine energy.
Feat.Benefit: You can, as a standard action, use one of your uses of channel positive energy to cause all undead within 30 feet of you to flee, as if panicked. Undead receive a Will save to negate the effect. The DC for this Will save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your cleric l
Feat.Prereq: Channel positive energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Two-Weapon Defense
Feat.Description: You are skilled at defending yourself while dual-wielding.
Feat.Benefit: When wielding a double weapon or two weapons (not including natural weapons or unarmed strikes), you gain a +1 shield bonus to your AC. When you are fighting defensively or using the total defense action, this shield bonus increases to +2.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Two-Weapon Fighting.

Feat.Name: Two-Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: You can fight with a weapon wielded in each of your hands. You can make one extra attack each round with the secondary weapon.
Feat.Benefit: Your penalties on attack rolls for fighting with two weapons are reduced. The penalty for your primary hand lessens by 2 and the one for your off hand lessens by 6. See Two-Weapon Fighting in Chapter 8.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15.

Feat.Name: Two-Weapon Rend
Feat.Description: Striking with both of your weapons simultaneously, you can use them to deliver devastating wounds.
Feat.Benefit: If you hit an opponent with both your primary hand and your off-hand weapon, you deal an additional 1d10 points of damage plus 1-1/2 times your Strength modifier. You can only deal this additional damage once each round.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 17, Double Slice, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Double Slice, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting

Feat.Name: Unseat
Feat.Description: You are skilled at unseating your mounted opponents.
Feat.Benefit: When charging an opponent while mounted and wielding a lance, resolve the attack as normal. If it hits, you may immediately make a free bull rush attempt in addition to the normal damage. If successful, the target is knocked off his horse and lands prone
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat, Power Attack, Improved Bull Rush, base attack bonus +1.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Mounted Combat, Power Attack, Improved Bull Rush

Feat.Name: Vital Strike
Feat.Description: You make a single attack that deals significantly more damage than normal.
Feat.Benefit: When you use the attack action, you can make one attack at your highest base attack bonus that deals additional damage. Roll the weapon's damage dice for the attack twice and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilities (
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Weapon Finesse
Feat.Description: You are trained in using your agility in melee combat, as opposed to brute strength.
Feat.Benefit: With a light weapon, elven curve blade, rapier, whip, or spiked chain made for a creature of your size category, you may use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls. If you carry a shield, its armor check penalty applies

Feat.Name: Weapon Focus
Feat.Description: Choose one type of weapon. You can also choose unarmed strike or grapple (or ray, if you are a spellcaster) as your weapon for the purposes of this feat.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected weapon.
Feat.Prereq: Proficiency with selected weapon, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Weapon Specialization
Feat.Description: You are skilled at dealing damage with one weapon. Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you have already selected the Weapon Focus feat. You deal extra damage when using this weapon.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon.
Feat.Prereq: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, fighter level 4th.

Feat.Name: Whirlwind Attack
Feat.Description: You can strike out at every foe within reach.
Feat.Benefit: When you use the full-attack action, you can give up your regular attacks and instead make one melee attack at your highest base attack bonus against each opponent within reach. You must make a separate attack roll against each opponent. When you use the
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack, base attack bonus +4.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Expertise, Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack

Feat.Name: Widen Spell
Feat.Description: You can cast your spells so that they occupy a larger space.
Feat.Benefit: You can alter a burst, emanation, or spread-shaped spell to increase its area. Any numeric measurements of the spell's area increase by 100%. A widened spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual level. Spells that do not have a

Feat.Name: Wind Stance
Feat.Description: Your erratic movements make it difficult for enemies to pinpoint your location.
Feat.Benefit: If you move more than 5 feet this turn, you gain 20% concealment for 1 round against ranged attacks.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Dodge, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Additional Traits
Feat.Description: You have more traits than normal.
Feat.Benefit: You gain two character traits of your choice (see Chapter 8). These traits must be chosen from different lists, and cannot be chosen from lists from which you have already selected a character trait. You must meet any additional qualifications for the cha

Feat.Name: Ability Focus
Feat.Description: One of this creature's special attacks is particularly difficult to resist.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one of the creature's special attacks. Add +2 to the DC for all saving throws against the special attack on which the creature focuses.
Feat.Prereq: Special attack.

Feat.Name: Awesome Blow
Feat.Description: This creature can send opponents flying.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, the creature may perform an awesome blow combat maneuver. If the creature's maneuver succeeds against a corporeal opponent smaller than itself, its opponent takes damage (typically slam damage plus Strength bonus) and is knocked flyi
Feat.Prereq: Str 25, Power Attack, Improved Bull Rush, size Large or larger.

Feat.Name: Craft Construct
Feat.Description: You can create construct creatures like golems.
Feat.Benefit: You can create any construct whose prerequisites you meet. The act of animating a construct takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its market price. To create a construct, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price, plus the full cost of the
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 5th, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Wondrous Item.

Feat.Name: Empower Spell-Like Ability
Feat.Description: One of this creature's spell-like abilities is particularly potent and powerful.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one of the creature's spell-like abilities, subject to the restrictions below. The creature can use that ability as an empowered spell-like ability three times per day (or less, if the ability is normally usable only once or twice per day). When a
Feat.Prereq: Spell-like ability at caster level 6th or higher.

Feat.Name: Flyby Attack
Feat.Description: This creature can make an attack before and after it moves while flying.
Feat.Benefit: When flying, the creature can take a move action and another standard action at any point during the move. The creature cannot take a second move action during a round when it makes a flyby attack.
Feat.Prereq: Fly speed.

Feat.Name: Hover
Feat.Description: This creature can hover in place with ease and can kick up clouds of dust and debris.
Feat.Benefit: A creature with this feat can halt its movement while flying, allowing it to hover without needing to make a Fly skill check. If a creature of size Large or larger with this feat hovers within 20 feet of the ground in an area with lots of loose debris, th
Feat.Prereq: Fly speed.

Feat.Name: Improved Natural Armor
Feat.Description: This creature's hide is tougher than most.
Feat.Benefit: The creature's natural armor bonus increases by +1.
Feat.Prereq: Natural armor, Con 13.

Feat.Name: Improved Natural Attack
Feat.Description: Attacks made by one of this creature's natural attacks leave vicious wounds.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one of the creature's natural attack forms (not an unarmed strike). The damage for this natural attack increases by one step on the following list, as if the creature's size had increased by one category. Damage dice increase as follows: 1d2, 1d3,
Feat.Prereq: Natural weapon, base attack bonus +4.

Feat.Name: Multiattack
Feat.Description: This creature is particularly skilled at making attacks with its natural weapons.
Feat.Benefit: The creature's secondary attacks with natural weapons take only a -2 penalty.
Feat.Prereq: Three or more natural attacks.

Feat.Name: Quicken Spell-Like Ability
Feat.Description: This creature can use one of its spell-like abilities with next to no effort.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one of the creature's spell-like abilities, subject to the restrictions described in this feat. The creature can use the chosen spell-like ability as a quickened spell-like ability three times per day (or less, if the ability is normally usable onl
Feat.Prereq: Spell-like ability at CL 10th or higher.

Feat.Name: Snatch
Feat.Description: This creature can grab other creatures with ease.
Feat.Benefit: The creature can start a grapple when it hits with a claw or bite attack, as though it had the grab ability. If it grapples a creature three or more sizes smaller, it squeezes each round for automatic bite or claw damage with a successful grapple check. A
Feat.Prereq: Size Huge or larger.

Feat.Name: Wingover
Feat.Description: This creature can make turns with ease while flying.
Feat.Benefit: Once each round, a creature with this feat can turn up to 180 degrees as a free action without making a Fly skill check. This free turn does not consume any additional movement from the creature.
Feat.Prereq: Fly speed.

Feat.Name: Allied Spellcaster
Feat.Description: With the aid of an ally, you are skilled at piercing the protections of other creatures with your spells.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you receive a +2 competence bonus on level checks made to overcome spell resistance. If your ally has the same spell prepared (or known with a slot available if they are spontaneous spellcasters
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 1st.

Feat.Name: Arcane Blast
Feat.Description: You can convert any spell into an attack.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can sacrifice a prepared spell or unused spell slot of 1st level or higher and transform it into a ray, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged touch attack. This attack deals 2d6 points of damage plus an additional 1d6 poin
Feat.Prereq: Arcane spellcaster, caster level 10th.

Feat.Name: Arcane Shield
Feat.Description: You can convert any spell into a defense.
Feat.Benefit: As a immediate action, you can sacrifice a prepared spell or unused spell slot of 1st level or higher and gain a def lection bonus to AC equal to the level of the spell or spell slot you sacrificed for 1 round. 0-level spells may not be sacrificed in this
Feat.Prereq: Arcane spellcaster, caster level 10th.

Feat.Name: Arcane Talent
Feat.Description: Magic is in your blood, and at your fingertips.
Feat.Benefit: Choose a 0-level spell from the sorcerer/wizard spell list. You can cast this spell three times per day as a spell-like ability. The caster level is equal to your character level. The save DC is 10 + your Charisma modifier.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 10; elf, half-elf, or gnome.

Feat.Name: Aspect of the Beast
Feat.Description: Whether by magic or a curse of your blood, some part of you is more beast than man.
Feat.Benefit: Your bestial nature manifests itself in one of the following ways. You choose the manifestation when you choose the feat, and then you cannot change it. Night Senses (Ex): If your base race has normal vision, you gain low-light vision. If your base race h
Feat.Prereq: wild shape class feature, see Special.

Feat.Name: Bashing Finish
Feat.Description: You follow a powerful blow from your weapon with an opportunistic bash from your shield.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee weapon, you can make a shield bash attack against the same target using the same bonus as a free action.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Shield Bash, Shield Master, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Shield Bash, Shield Master, Two-Weapon Fighting

Feat.Name: Bloody Assault
Feat.Description: Sacrificing accuracy, you can inflict bloody wounds that are slow to heal.
Feat.Benefit: You can choose to take a -5 penalty on all melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to inflict 1d4 points of bleed damage with your weapon melee attacks, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the weapon. A creature continues to take bleed damage
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Bodyguard
Feat.Description: Your swift strikes ward off enemies attacking nearby allies.
Feat.Benefit: When an adjacent ally is attacked, you may use an attack of opportunity to attempt the aid another action to improve your ally's AC. You may not use the aid another action to improve your ally's attack roll with this attack.
Feat.Prereq: Combat Reflexes.

Feat.Name: Bouncing Spell
Feat.Description: You can direct a failed spell against a different target.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever a bouncing spell targeting a single creature has no effect on its intended target (whether due to spell resistance or a successful saving throw) you may, as a swift action, redirect it to target another eligible creature within range. The redirec

Feat.Name: Breadth of Experience
Feat.Description: Although still young for your kind, you have a lifetime of knowledge and training.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Knowledge and Profession skill checks, and can make checks with those skills untrained.
Feat.Prereq: Dwarf, elf, or gnome; 100+ years old.

Feat.Name: Bull Rush Strike
Feat.Description: Your critical hits can push back your foes.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can push your opponent back, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. If your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you may push your opponent back as if from the bull rush c
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Charge Through
Feat.Description: You can overrun enemies when charging.
Feat.Benefit: When making a charge, you can attempt to overrun one creature in the path of the charge as a free action. If you successfully overrun that creature, you can complete the charge. If the overrun is unsuccessful, the charge ends in the space directly in fron
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Improved Overrun, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Childlike
Feat.Description: Your resemblance to a human child tends to make others trust you, perhaps more than they should.
Feat.Benefit: You can take 10 on Bluff checks to convince others you are telling the truth, so long as your story makes you appear innocent. You gain a +2 bonus on Disguise skill checks to pose as a human child, and ignore the check penalties for disguising yourself as
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, halfling.

Feat.Name: Cloud Step
Feat.Description: Your tread is of unearthly lightness.
Feat.Benefit: As a move action, you can air walk (as the spell) up to half your slow fall distance, maximum 50 feet. You must reach a solid, level surface by the end of your turn or you will fall.
Feat.Prereq: Spider Step, monk level 12th.

Feat.Name: Cockatrice Strike
Feat.Description: With a single strike, you transmute flesh to stone.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, you can make a single unarmed strike against a dazed, flat-footed, paralyzed, staggered, stunned, or unconscious foe. If that attack is a critical hit, the target is petrified unless it succeeds on a Fortitude saving throw with a D
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Gorgon's Fist, Medusa's Wrath, base attack bonus +14.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Unarmed Strike, Gorgon's Fist, Medusa's Wrath

Feat.Name: Combat Patrol
Feat.Description: You range across the battlefield, dealing with threats wherever they arise.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, you may set up a combat patrol, increasing your threatened area by 5 feet for every 5 points of your base attack bonus. Until the beginning of your next turn, you may make attacks of opportunity against any opponent in this threate
Feat.Prereq: Combat Reflexes, Mobility, base attack bonus +5.

Feat.Name: Cooperative Crafting
Feat.Description: Your assistance makes item crafting far more efficient.
Feat.Benefit: You can assist another character in crafting mundane and magical items. You must both possess the relevant Craft skill or item creation feat, but either one of you can fulfill any other prerequisites for crafting the item. You provide a +2 circumstance bo
Feat.Prereq: 1 rank in any Craft skill, any item creation feat.

Feat.Name: Coordinated Defense
Feat.Description: You are adept at working with allies to avoid being tripped, grappled, and subjected to other maneuvers.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you receive a +2 competence bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense. This bonus increases to +4 if the creature attempting the maneuver is larger than both you and your ally.

Feat.Name: Coordinated Maneuvers
Feat.Description: You are skilled at working with your allies to perform dangerous combat maneuvers.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you receive a +2 competence bonus on all combat maneuver checks. This bonus increases to +4 when attempting to break free from a grapple.

Feat.Name: Cosmopolitan
Feat.Description: Living in large, exotic cities has put you in touch with many diverse civilizations, cultures, and races.
Feat.Benefit: You can speak and read two additional languages of your choice. In addition, choose two Intelligence-, Wisdom-, or Charisma-based skills. Those skills always count as class skills for you.

Feat.Name: Covering Defense
Feat.Description: You are skilled at protecting yourself and your allies with your shield.
Feat.Benefit: When you use the total defense action while using a light, heavy, or tower shield, you can provide a cover bonus to AC against all attacks to an adjacent ally your size or smaller. This cover bonus is equal to your shield's shield bonus and lasts until th
Feat.Prereq: Shield Focus, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Crippling Critical
Feat.Description: You are able to maim a target and hinder its movement.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit against an opponent, its speed is halved for 1 minute. A successful Fortitude save reduces this duration to 1d4 rounds. The DC of this save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. Against creatures with multiple types of
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, base attack bonus +13.

Feat.Name: Crossbow Mastery
