Feat.Description: You can load crossbows with blinding speed and even fire them in melee with little fear of reprisal.
Feat.Benefit: The time required for you to reload any type of crossbow is reduced to a free action, regardless of the type of crossbow used. You can fire a crossbow as many times in a full attack action as you could attack if you were using a bow. Reloading a crossbow
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Reload, Rapid Shot.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Reload, Rapid Shot

Feat.Name: Dastardly Finish
Feat.Description: You can take advantage of an enemy's debilitated state to attempt a coup de grace.
Feat.Benefit: You can deliver a coup de grace to cowering or stunned targets.
Feat.Prereq: Sneak attack +5d6.

Feat.Name: Dazing Assault
Feat.Description: You can daze foes with wild attacks.
Feat.Benefit: You can choose to take a -5 penalty on all melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to daze opponents you hit with your melee attacks for 1 round, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. A successful Fortitude save negates the effect. T
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Dazing Spell
Feat.Description: You can daze creatures with the power of your spells.
Feat.Benefit: You can modify a spell to daze a creature damaged by the spell. When a creature takes damage from this spell, they become dazed for a number of rounds equal to the original level of the spell. If the spell allows a saving throw, a successful save negates

Feat.Name: Deep Drinker
Feat.Description: You draw greater amounts of ki from your libations.
Feat.Benefit: When you gain temporary ki from drunken ki, you gain 2 temporary ki rather than just 1.
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, monk level 11, drunken ki class feature.

Feat.Name: Deepsight
Feat.Description: Your senses are especially keen in the utter darkness.
Feat.Benefit: Your darkvision has a range of 120 feet.
Feat.Prereq: Darkvision 60 feet.

Feat.Name: Disarming Strike
Feat.Description: Your critical hits can disarm your foes.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can disarm your opponent, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. If your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you may disarm your opponent as if from the disarm combat man
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Disarm, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Disrupting Shot
Feat.Description: With a well-placed shot, you make it harder for a nearby opponent to cast spells.
Feat.Benefit: If you ready an action to shoot an opponent casting a spell within 30 feet and successfully hit that opponent with a ranged attack, the concentration DC to successfully cast the spell is increased by +4.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Point-Blank Shot, fighter level 6th.

Feat.Name: Disruptive Spell
Feat.Description: Your magical energies cling to enemies, interfering with their spellcasting.
Feat.Benefit: Targets affected by a disruptive spell must make concentration checks when using spells or spell-like abilities (DC equals the save DC of the disruptive spell plus the level of the spell being cast) for 1 round. Targets that avoid the spell's effects avoi

Feat.Name: Diviner's Delving
Feat.Description: Your keen magical intuition makes reading signs, portents, and mystical clues quick and easy.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on caster level checks with divinations to overcome spell resistance or effects that impede divination (for example, nondetection). When using a divination spell that requires concentration, you gain information from the spell 1 round
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus (divination).

Feat.Name: Dreadful Carnage
Feat.Description: Slaying an enemy demoralizes your other nearby foes.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you reduce an enemy to 0 or fewer hit points, you can make an Intimidate check to demoralize all enemies within 30 feet as a free action. Enemies that cannot see both you and the enemy you reduced to 0 or fewer hit points are unaffected.
Feat.Prereq: Str 15, Power Attack, Furious Focus, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Duck and Cover
Feat.Description: Your allies assist you in avoiding certain attacks.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, and both of you are required to make a Ref lex saving throw against a spell or effect, you may take the result of your die roll or that of your ally (your modifiers still apply to the roll, rega

Feat.Name: Eagle Eyes
Feat.Description: Your vision is especially keen.
Feat.Benefit: You ignore up to -5 in penalties due to distance on visual Perception checks, allowing you to see accurately at much greater distances than most.
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, keen senses racial trait.

Feat.Name: Eclectic
Feat.Description: You have a talent for picking up different vocations.
Feat.Benefit: Choose an additional favored class and gain either +1 hit point or +1 skill point whenever you take a level in that class. If you choose a class in which you already have levels, the benefits of this feat are retroactive.

Feat.Name: Ectoplasmic Spell
Feat.Description: Your spells breach the gulf between dimensions, sending ghostly emanations into the ether.
Feat.Benefit: An ectoplasmic spell has full effect against incorporeal or ethereal creatures. An ectoplasmic spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

Feat.Name: Eldritch Claws
Feat.Description: Who needs magic weapons? Eldritch tricks are no match for your bestial ferocity.
Feat.Benefit: You natural weapons are considered both magic and silver for purpose of overcoming damage reduction.
Feat.Prereq: Str 15, natural weapons, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Elemental Fist
Feat.Description: You empower your strike with elemental energy
Feat.Benefit: When you use Elemental Strike pick one of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. On a successful hit, the attack deals damage normally plus 1d6 points of damage of the chosen type. You must declare that you are using this feat befor
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.

Feat.Name: Elemental Focus
Feat.Description: Your spells of a certain element are more difficult to resist.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one energy type (acid, cold, electricity, or fire). Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells that deal damage of the energy type you select.

Feat.Name: Elemental Spell
Feat.Description: You can manipulate the elemental nature of your spells.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one energy type: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. You may replace a spell's normal damage with that energy type or split the spell's damage, so that half is of that energy type and half is of its normal type. An elemental spell uses up a spell slo

Feat.Name: Elven Accuracy
Feat.Description: Your sharp eyesight makes difficult shots easier.
Feat.Benefit: If you miss due to concealment when making a ranged attack with a longbow or shortbow (including composite bows), you can reroll your miss chance roll one time to see if you actually hit.

Feat.Name: Enforcer
Feat.Description: You are skilled at causing fear in those you brutalize.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you deal nonlethal damage with a melee weapon, you can make an Intimidate check to demoralize your target as a free action. If you are successful, the target is shaken for a number of rounds equal to the damage dealt. If your attack was a critica
Feat.Prereq: Intimidate 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Expanded Arcana
Feat.Description: Your research has revealed new spells.
Feat.Benefit: Add one spell from your class's spell list to your list of spells known. This is in addition to the number of spells normally gained at each new level in your class. You may instead add two spells from your class's spell list to your list of spells known,
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 1st, see Special.

Feat.Name: Fast Drinker
Feat.Description: You swiftly guzzle spirits to draw forth ki.
Feat.Benefit: Drinking strong alcohol to gain temporary ki, takes a swift action rather than a standard action.
Feat.Prereq: Con 18, drunken ki class feature.

Feat.Name: Fast Healer
Feat.Description: You benefit greatly from your healing, be it from spells or natural healing.
Feat.Benefit: When you regain hit points by resting or through magical healing, you recover additional hit points equal to half your Constitution modifier (minimum +1).
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Diehard, Endurance.

Feat.Name: Favored Defense
Feat.Description: Your cunning is your shield against your quarry's attacks.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one of your favored enemy types. You add half your favored enemy bonus to your CMD and as a dodge bonus to AC when attacked by a favored enemy.
Feat.Prereq: Favored enemy class feature.

Feat.Name: Fight On
Feat.Description: You can keep fighting even after you should be dead.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you can gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. You can activate this feat as an immediate action when reduced to 0 or fewer hit points. You can use this feat to prevent yourself from dying. These temporary
Feat.Prereq: Con 13; dwarf, half-orc, or orc.

Feat.Name: Focused Shot
Feat.Description: Your anatomical insight adds deadliness to your shots.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you may make an attack with a bow or crossbow and add your Intelligence modifier on the damage roll. You must be within 30 feet of your target to deal this extra damage. Creatures immune to critical hits and sneak attacks are immune
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot.

Feat.Name: Focused Spell
Feat.Description: When you cast a spell that affects more than one creature, one opponent finds it more difficult to resist.
Feat.Benefit: When casting a spell that affects or targets more than one creature, you can choose one target or creature within the spell effect. That creature's saving throw DC to resist the spell is increased by +2. You must choose which target to focus the spell on

Feat.Name: Following Step
Feat.Description: You can repeatedly close the distance when foes try to move away, without impeding your normal movement.
Feat.Benefit: When using the Step Up feat to follow an adjacent foe, you may move up to 10 feet. You may still take a 5-foot step during your next turn, and any movement you make using this feat does not subtract any distance from your movement during your next turn.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Step Up.

Feat.Name: Furious Focus
Feat.Description: Even in the midst of fierce and furious blows, you can find focus in the carnage and your seemingly wild blows strike home.
Feat.Benefit: When you are wielding a two-handed weapon or a one-handed weapon with two hands, and using the Power Attack feat, you do not suffer Power Attack's penalty on melee attack rolls on the first attack you make each turn. You still suffer the penalty on any ad
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Gang Up
Feat.Description: You are adept at using greater numbers against foes.
Feat.Benefit: You are considered to be flanking an opponent if at least two of your allies are threatening that opponent, regardless of your actual positioning.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Gnome Trickster
Feat.Description: Your arcane talents go beyond the illusory.
Feat.Benefit: In addition to your normal gnome spell-like abilities, you also gain the following spell-like abilities: 1/day-mage hand and prestidigitation.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, gnome, gnome magic racial trait.

Feat.Name: Go Unnoticed
Feat.Description: Your small size lets you quickly duck out of sight.
Feat.Benefit: During the first round of combat, flat-footed opponents are considered not to have noticed you yet for the purposes of Stealth skill checks, allowing you to make a Stealth check that round to hide from them.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Small size or smaller.

Feat.Name: Greater Blind-Fight
Feat.Description: Your enemies cannot hide from you.
Feat.Benefit: Your melee attacks ignore the miss chance for less than total concealment, and you treat opponents with total concealment as if they had normal concealment (20% miss chance instead of 50%). You may still reroll a miss chance percentile roll as normal. If
Feat.Prereq: Perception 15 ranks, Improved Blind-Fight.

Feat.Name: Greater Dirty Trick
Feat.Description: When you pull a dirty trick, your foe is truly hindered.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to attempt a dirty trick. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Dirty Trick. Whenever you successfully perform a dirty trick, the penalty lasts for 1d4 rounds, plus 1 round for every 5 by which your att
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Dirty Trick, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Greater Drag
Feat.Description: Foes that you drag are thrown out of balance.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to drag a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Drag. Whenever you drag a foe, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Improved Drag, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Greater Elemental Focus
Feat.Description: Choose an energy type to which you have already applied the Elemental Focus feat. Any spells you cast of this energy type are very hard to resist.
Feat.Benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells that deal damage of the energy type you select. This bonus stacks with the bonus from Elemental Focus.
Feat.Prereq: Elemental Focus.

Feat.Name: Greater Reposition
Feat.Description: When you reposition foes, they are left vulnerable to the attacks of your allies.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to reposition a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Reposition. Whenever you reposition a foe, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Reposition, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Greater Shield Specialization
Feat.Description: Your masterful shieldwork provides even greater protection to your vital areas.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one type of shield (buckler, light, heavy, or tower shield) for which you possess the Shield Specialization feat. With the selected shield, you gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class against critical hit confirmation rolls (this bonus stacks with that
Feat.Prereq: Proficiency with selected shield, Greater Shield Focus, Shield Focus, Shield Specialization with selected shield, fighter level 12th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Greater Shield Focus, Shield Focus, Shield Specialization

Feat.Name: Greater Steal
Feat.Description: You have a knack for snatching items from your opponents in combat.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to steal an item from a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Steal. If you successfully steal an item from a foe during combat, it does not notice the theft until after combat is over or if it att
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Steal, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Groundling
Feat.Description: You can speak with burrowing animals.
Feat.Benefit: You can use speak with animals as a spell-like ability at will, but only to communicate with burrowing animals like gophers, moles, and the like. You can still use your gnome speak with animals ability once per day to speak with any animal, as usual.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, gnome, gnome magic racial trait.

Feat.Name: Heroic Defiance
Feat.Description: You struggle on when others would fall.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day as an immediate action you can delay the onset of one harmful condition or aff liction (such as panicked, paralyzed, stunned, and so on), including permanent and instantaneous conditions. Activating this feat delays the onset of the condition
Feat.Prereq: Diehard, Endurance, base Fortitude save +8.

Feat.Name: Heroic Recovery
Feat.Description: You can throw off the effects of crippling conditions.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day as a standard action you may attempt a new saving throw against a harmful condition or aff liction requiring a Fortitude save that is affecting you. If this save against the aff liction fails, there is no additional effect, but a successful s
Feat.Prereq: Diehard, Endurance, base Fortitude save +4.

Feat.Name: Improved Blind-Fight
Feat.Description: Your keen senses guide your hand against hidden foes.
Feat.Benefit: Your melee attacks ignore the miss chance for less than total concealment. You may still reroll your miss chance percentile roll for total concealment. If you successfully pinpoint an invisible or hidden attacker within 30 feet, that attacker gets no adva
Feat.Prereq: Perception 10 ranks, Blind-Fight.

Feat.Name: Improved Dirty Trick
Feat.Description: You are skilled at pulling dirty tricks on your foes.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a dirty trick combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to attempt a dirty trick. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries a di
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Nightmare Fist
Feat.Description: You are even more deadly in magical darkness.
Feat.Benefit: While fighting within an area of magical darkness, you gain a +2 bonus on damage rolls with unarmed strikes, or a +4 bonus against opponents that are shaken, frightened, or panicked. You also gain a +2 morale bonus on Acrobatics and Intimidate checks.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Intimidate 1 rank, ability to create magical darkness.

Feat.Name: Nightmare Striker
Feat.Description: Your faerie fire not only illuminates your foes, but it also shows you their weaknesses.
Feat.Benefit: While a faerie fire you have cast (not one cast from a spell completion or spell trigger item) outlines an opponent, the DC for that opponent to resist your Stunning Fist attempts increases by +2. If you hit an opponent with a Stunning Fist attempt, and t
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Nightmare Fist, Nightmare Weaver, Stunning Fist, Heal 5 ranks, ability to cast faerie fire.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Unarmed Strike, Nightmare Fist, Nightmare Weaver, Stunning Fist

Feat.Name: Nightmare Weaver
Feat.Description: You can use your ability to create magical darkness to terrorize enemies.
Feat.Benefit: By spending a full-round action to cast darkness, you can also make Intimidate checks to demoralize all foes in the spell's initial area.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Nightmare Fist, Intimidate 2 ranks, ability to cast darkness.

Feat.Name: No Name
Feat.Description: You don't need an elaborate disguise to keep your identity under wraps.
Feat.Benefit: You often rely on surprise and misdirection in your social dealings. You gain a +2 bonus on Bluff checks, and you can spend 1 grit point to gain a +10 bonus on Disguise checks for 10 minutes per your gunslinger level (minimum 10 minutes). This deed does n
Feat.Prereq: Grit class feature or Amateur Gunslinger feat, Bluff 4 ranks.

Feat.Name: Opening Volley
Feat.Description: Your ranged assault leaves your foe disoriented and vulnerable to your melee attack.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you deal damage with a ranged attack, you gain a +4 circumstance bonus on the next melee attack roll you make against the opponent. This attack must occur before the end of your next turn.

Feat.Name: Pack Attack
Feat.Description: You are skilled at surrounding your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: When you are adjacent to an ally with this feat, the first time you melee attack an opponent, you can spend an immediate action to take a 5-foot step, even if you have otherwise moved this round.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Panther Claw
Feat.Description: You unleash a rapid series of blows on foes that attempt to attack you when you move.
Feat.Benefit: While using Panther Style, you can spend a free action, instead of spending a swift action, to make a retaliatory unarmed strike. You can make a number of retaliatory unarmed strikes on your turn equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Feat.Prereq: Wis 15, Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike, Panther Style.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike, Panther Style

Feat.Name: Panther Parry
Feat.Description: Your vicious strikes impair your foe's ability to attack you when you move.
Feat.Benefit: While using Panther Style, your retaliatory unarmed strikes are resolved before the triggering attacks. If your retaliatory unarmed strike deals damage to an opponent, that opponent takes a -2 penalty on attack and damage rolls with the triggering attack
Feat.Prereq: Wis 15, Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike, Panther Claw, Panther Style.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike, Panther Claw, Panther Style

Feat.Name: Panther Style
Feat.Description: You can strike back at enemies who attack you when you move.
Feat.Benefit: While using this style, when an opponent makes an attack of opportunity against you for moving through a threatened square, you can spend a swift action to make a retaliatory unarmed strike attack against that opponent. Your attack is resolved after the t
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Extra Ranger Trap
Feat.Description: You can use ranger traps more often.
Feat.Benefit: You can set ranger traps two additional times per day.
Feat.Prereq: Trap class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Summons
Feat.Description: You can summon monsters more often each day.
Feat.Benefit: You gain 1 additional use of your summon monster spell-like ability per day.
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast summon monster as a spell-like ability, summoner 1st.

Feat.Name: Eyes of Judgment
Feat.Description: The true motives of creatures cannot escape your discerning gaze.
Feat.Benefit: When using your detect alignment class feature, you may spend 3 rounds studying a creature within 60 feet. You cannot take any other actions while doing this. After that time has passed, you learn the alignment of the creature.
Feat.Prereq: Detect alignment class feature, caster level 6th.

Feat.Name: Fast Empathy
Feat.Description: Your empathic attunement to nature connects you swiftly with bestial minds.
Feat.Benefit: Using wild empathy is a standard action for you.
Feat.Prereq: Handle Animal 5 ranks, wild empathy class feature.

Feat.Name: Favored Judgment
Feat.Description: Your judgment against a particular type of creature is particularly harsh.
Feat.Benefit: Select a favored race from the ranger's favored enemies chart. Any sacred or profane bonus you gain from a judgment is 1 higher for attacks you make against or take from creatures that match the selected favored enemy.
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, judgment class feature.

Feat.Name: Fearless Aura
Feat.Description: Your aura of courage becomes more potent, as your steadfast resolve is also manifested by your allies.
Feat.Benefit: Your aura of courage expands to a 20-foot-radius emanation. Allies within the aura are immune to fear effects.
Feat.Prereq: Aura of courage class feature, caster level 8th.

Feat.Name: Fire Music
Feat.Description: Your ability to command fire and bardic music has created a strange blend of both magics.
Feat.Benefit: When you cast a bard spell that deals damage, you may replace the spell's normal damage with fire damage or split the spell's damage so that half of it is the normal damage type and half is fire damage. If you cast a summon monster spell as a bard spell,
Feat.Prereq: Spellcraft 5 ranks, ability to cast bard spells, ability to cast an arcane fire spell from some other spellcasting class.

Feat.Name: Flaring Spell
Feat.Description: You dazzle creatures when you affect them with a spell that has the fire, light, or electricity descriptor.
Feat.Benefit: The electricity, fire, or light effects of the affected spell create a flaring that dazzles creatures that take damage from the spell. A flare spell causes a creature that takes fire or electricity damage from the affected spell to become dazzled for a nu

Feat.Name: Focused Eidolon
Feat.Description: Your bond with your eidolon helps to focus your concentration.
Feat.Benefit: While you are adjacent to your eidolon, you receive a +4 bonus on concentration checks.
Feat.Prereq: Shield ally class feature.

Feat.Name: Gliding Steps
Feat.Description: You skate across the surface of the earth as if gliding on ice.
Feat.Benefit: If you have at least one ki in your ki pool, when you move you do not provoke attacks of opportunity when leaving the first square of that movement. You can spend 1 ki point to avoid provoking attacks of opportunity during that entire move.
Feat.Prereq: Dodge, Mobility, Nimble Moves, ki pool.

Feat.Name: Grant Initiative
Feat.Description: Not only are you a master at taking the initiative, but you can also grant it to someone else.
Feat.Benefit: At the start of each encounter, you can either choose to keep the bonus granted to you by your Wisdom modifier on initiative checks or choose to give that bonus to one of your allies that you can see. You must make this choice before you or the ally you a
Feat.Prereq: Cunning initiative class feature.

Feat.Name: Stretched Wings
Feat.Description: You strengthen your crippled wings.
Feat.Benefit: Your strix racial fly speed increases to 60 feet (average). You ignore the wing-clipped trait's Fly check requirement to fly upward.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Skill Focus (Fly), strix, wing-clipped racial trait.

Feat.Name: Extra Elemental Assault
Feat.Description: You have unlocked greater elemental power.
Feat.Benefit: Your elemental assault ability lasts an additional 2 rounds per day.

Feat.Name: Incremental Elemental Assault
Feat.Description: You may activate and quench your elemental assault ability multiple times per day.
Feat.Benefit: You may use your elemental assault ability in 1-round increments, up to a maximum number of rounds per day equal to your character level. These rounds do not have to be consecutive. Activating the ability is a swift action; ending it is a free action.

Feat.Name: Stoic Pose
Feat.Description: You can hold yourself as still as a statue, evading detection.
Feat.Benefit: By spending 5 rounds finding a suitable location, you can hold yourself so still that you appear to be a Small object such as a pile of rocks. This allows you to make a Stealth check without cover or concealment, as long as you do not move or take any oth

Feat.Name: Tree Hanger
Feat.Description: You can use your tail to defend against trip attacks and to hang from nearby protrusions.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to your CMD against all trip attacks. If your square has a branch or other sturdy large object that you could hang from, as a swift action you may make a DC 15 Acrobatics check to jump upward and use your tail to hang from that object.
Feat.Prereq: Acrobatics 1 rank, vanara.

Feat.Name: Sleep Venom
Feat.Description: You can change the nature of your toxic spittle to put your enemies to sleep.
Feat.Benefit: As a swift action, you may alter the effects of your venom so the target falls unconscious. This changes the initial and secondary effect of your venom to the following: initial effect staggered for 1d4 rounds; secondary effect unconsciousness for 1 minut

Feat.Name: Shadowy Dash
Feat.Description: In dim light, you resemble little more than a shadow.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can move at full speed using Stealth without taking the normal -5 penalty for doing so.

Feat.Name: Belier's Bite
Feat.Description: Your unarmed strikes cause your opponent to bleed.
Feat.Benefit: When you damage an opponent with an unarmed strike, you deal an extra 1d4 bleed damage.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Cornugon Shield
Feat.Description: You can use your spiked chain as both armor and weapon.
Feat.Benefit: When wielding a spiked chain, you gain a +1 shield bonus to your AC. When you are fighting defensively or using the total defense action, this shield bonus increases to +2.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Weapon Focus (spiked chain).

Feat.Name: Cornugon Smash
Feat.Description: Your terrible attacks strike fear into your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: When you damage an opponent with a Power Attack, you may make an immediate Intimidate check as a free action to attempt to demoralize your opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Power Attack, Intimidate 6 ranks.

Feat.Name: Cornugon Stun
Feat.Description: You are able to make stunning attacks with special monk weapons.
Feat.Benefit: You may use Stunning Fist when making melee attacks with special monk weapons as well as when making unarmed attacks.
Feat.Prereq: Stunning Fist.

Feat.Name: Cornugon Trip
Feat.Description: You can throw your spiked chain to make trip attacks.
Feat.Benefit: You may throw your spiked chain (as if it were a thrown weapon with a range increment of 10 feet) and can make trip attacks when throwing it. Failing at this attack does not knock you prone.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Improved Trip, Weapon Focus (spiked chain).

Feat.Name: Steady Engagement
Feat.Description: You can draw on your excellent balance to trip or disarm opponents when they try to disengage.
Feat.Benefit: If you use the Stand Still feat to prevent an opponent from moving, you may make a disarm or trip combat maneuver against the target as an immediate action.
Feat.Prereq: Worshiper of Irori, Combat Reflexes, Stand Still.

Feat.Name: Firebrand
Feat.Description: You can make use of a torch as a deadly, macelike weapon.
Feat.Benefit: You treat a torch as a light weapon that deals bludgeoning damage equal to that of a light mace of its size, plus 1 point of fire damage, and you do not incur penalties as you would for using it as an improvised weapon.
Feat.Prereq: Worshiper of Asmodeus

Feat.Name: Ordered Mind
Feat.Description: Your study of Hell's laws improves your counterspells.
Feat.Benefit: You are able to modify more of your spells to use as counterspells. The DC of the Spellcraft check you must succeed at to identify an opponent's spell is equal to 20 + the spell level of the opponent's spell (instead of 15 + the spell level), but you are
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 7th, lawful alignment, worshiper of Asmodeus.

Feat.Name: Destroy Identity
Feat.Description: You are able to use your weapons to destroy some of your opponent's most distinctive physical characteristics.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit against an opponent, the target is so maimed that it takes 2 points of Charisma damage and becomes staggered for 1 round.
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, base attack bonus +11, worshiper of Lamashtu.

Feat.Name: Fearsome Finish
Feat.Description: When you slay enemies, you frighten other opponents.
Feat.Benefit: Upon reducing an enemy to 0 or fewer hit points, for the remaining duration of the combat encounter, you gain a +4 bonus on any Intimidate checks made to demoralize opponents who can see both you and the opponent you reduced to 0 or fewer hit points. This
Feat.Prereq: Intimidating Prowess, worshiper of Lamashtu.

Feat.Name: Reject Poison
Feat.Description: You are a careful poisoner, and know how to protect yourself against exposure to the ill effects of most substances.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever a creature attempts to poison you with a poison you have previously used or undergone the effects of, you have a 20% chance of naturally rejecting the poison's effects on you, negating its effects and wasting its use.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, poison use class feature, worshiper of Norgorber.

Feat.Name: Shadow Dodge
Feat.Description: You use light and darkness to your advantage, confusing your enemies and confounding their senses.
Feat.Benefit: You are able to use the light around you to move back and forth from shadow to light again, and your sudden shifting dazzles your enemies' eyes. By spending a number of feet (in 10-foot increments) when you use this feat to move from one square to another
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, worshiper of Norgorber.

Feat.Name: Merciless Rush
Feat.Description: You are a determined foe, and though hordes may stand against you, they will not stand long.
Feat.Benefit: When you bull rush a creature and your check exceeds the target's CMD by 5 or more, you can choose to move through that creature instead of pushing it back a number of feet, effectively trampling the creature and dealing it a number of points of damage eq
Feat.Prereq: Improved Bull Rush, worshiper of Rovagug.

Feat.Name: Squash Flat
Feat.Description: You are able to bull rush an opponent straight to the ground.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you make a bull rush attack and your check exceeds the target's CMD by 5 or more, you can choose to expend one of the increments of 5 feet you would normally move the target back to instead attempt to trip the target as a part of your bull rush a
Feat.Prereq: Improved Bull Rush, Merciless Rush, worshiper of Rovagug.

Feat.Name: Shatter Resolve
Feat.Description: Damaging a foe with negative energy causes despair.
Feat.Benefit: When you damage a creature by channeling negative energy, you fill it with fear. A creature that is affected by your channel negative energy ability and fails its Will save to halve the damage also becomes shaken for a number of rounds equal to the number
Feat.Prereq: Channel negative energy class feature, worshiper of Urgathoa.

Feat.Name: Eagle Knight Candidate
Feat.Description: You have proven your courage and skill to both the Eagle Knights and the leaders of Andoran.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one branch of the Eagle Knights you hope to join. You gain a specific benefit based on this choice. Golden Legion: Each round as a move action, you may issue commands to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear you. Each affected ally that ob
Feat.Prereq: Character level 5th, convince four different Eagle Knights and either a member of the People's Council or an Andoran town mayor to write letters of commendation on your behalf.

Feat.Name: Talmandor's Lifting
Feat.Description: You felt the powerful wings of Talmandor surround you when you risked death from a fall, and somehow a tiny spark of his essence remains connected to your soul.
Feat.Benefit: When you cast a healing spell on an unharmed creature, it briefly manifests as a pair of wings made of golden light. The spell's duration becomes 1 hour or until discharged. For the next hour, the spell remains on the target, triggering automatically a
Feat.Prereq: Take at least 10d6 falling damage on three different occasions and survive.

Feat.Name: Advanced Defensive Combat Training
Feat.Description: You are a master at defending yourself from all manner of combat maneuvers.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +4 bonus to your CMD.
Feat.Prereq: Defensive Combat Training, Bellf lower Network 10 TPA.

Feat.Name: Bloodstone Manhunter
Feat.Description: You are skilled at fighting criminal humans such as bandits.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on Bluff, Knowledge, Perception, Sense Motive, and Survival checks against humans, and a +1 bonus on weapon attack and damage rolls against humans. If you have a favored enemy bonus against humans, this feat does not stack with that bo
Feat.Prereq: Bloodstone Swords 10 TPA.

Feat.Name: Calm Disposition
Feat.Description: You always appear to be in control of your situation.
Feat.Benefit: You gain +2 bonus on saving throws against effects that affect your composure. This includes all mindaffecting spells, as well as any spell or ability that would cause you to behave in an out-of-control manner, such as fear effects and nausea. This does n
Feat.Prereq: Prophets of Kalistrade 10 TPA.

Feat.Name: Death's Suitor
Feat.Description: You have died and returned so often that even Pharasma now deems it part of your fate.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you may reroll a save or skill check if failure has a chance of killing you (whether from hit point damage, ability damage, or some instant effect). You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the secon
Feat.Prereq: Risen Guard 20 TPA.

Feat.Name: Disassemble Magic Item
Feat.Description: You can take apart and reassemble magic items.
Feat.Benefit: You can break a magic item down into component pieces. These pieces are nonmagical and may have little resemblance to the original item other than being of the same material (a magical sword may be three recognizable metal pieces or simply a collection of
Feat.Prereq: Any item creation feat, Aspis Consortium 20 TPA.

Feat.Name: Divine Deception
Feat.Description: You are skilled at manipulating divine magical items.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +5 bonus on Use Magic Device checks to use divine spell-trigger or spell completion items or to emulate a divine class feature.
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (religion) 5 ranks, Use Magic Device 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Fast Crawl
Feat.Description: You are skilled at moving while prone.
Feat.Benefit: While prone, you can move at half speed. This movement provokes attacks of opportunity as normal. You can take a 5-foot step while crawling. This benefit does not stack with the rogue crawl talent.

Feat.Name: Fearsome Barricade
Feat.Description: Your wrath is as potent a barrier as your blades.
Feat.Benefit: Choose an adjacent ally as a free action on your turn. Once per round, when an opponent attacks that ally, you may make an Intimidate check to demoralize the opponent as an immediate action. This action counts as an attack of opportunity.
Feat.Prereq: Intimidate 5 ranks, Ulfen Guard TPA 20.

Feat.Name: Improved Drag
Feat.Description: You are skilled at dragging foes around the battlefield.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a drag combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to drag a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to drag you.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Improved Ki Throw
Feat.Description: Your enemies are living weapons in your hands.
Feat.Benefit: When using the Ki Throw feat, you may throw your target into any square you threaten that is occupied by another creature. Make a bull rush combat maneuver check with a -4 penalty against the secondary target. If this check succeeds, the thrown creature l
Feat.Prereq: Improved Bull Rush, Ki Throw.

Feat.Name: Improved Reposition
Feat.Description: You have learned how to force your enemies to move around the battlefield.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a reposition combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to reposition a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to reposit
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Improved Second Chance
Feat.Description: You can turn a missed strike into a second chance without sacrificing later attacks.
Feat.Benefit: When you reroll a missed attack using the Second Chance feat, you can still make the rest of your attacks that turn, albeit at a -5 penalty to each attack.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Second Chance, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Improved Share Spells
Feat.Description: You can share spells with those you have a magical connection with.
Feat.Benefit: Any non-instantaneous spell (but not any spell-like ability) you cast on yourself can also affect a creature bonded to you (such as an animal companion, eidolon, familiar, or special mount). The creature must be within 5 feet of you at the time of casting
Feat.Prereq: Spellcraft 10 ranks, ability to acquire an animal companion, eidolon, familiar, or special mount.

Feat.Name: Improved Sidestep
Feat.Description: You are adept at sidestepping your opponent's melee attacks without compromising your mobility.
Feat.Benefit: After sidestepping an opponent's missed attack using the Sidestep feat, you may still take a 5-foot step during your next turn, or you may move up to your full speed if you take an action to move during your next turn.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Dodge, Mobility, Sidestep.

Feat.Name: Improved Steal
Feat.Description: You have a knack for snatching items from your opponents.
Feat.Benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a steal combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to steal an item from a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to stea
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Improved Stonecunning
Feat.Description: Your sense for stonework is uncanny.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +4 bonus on Perception checks to notice unusual stonework. This bonus replaces the stonecunning ability's normal bonus on Perception checks.
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, dwarf, stonecunning racial trait.

Feat.Name: Intensified Spell
Feat.Description: Your spells can go beyond several normal limitations.
Feat.Benefit: An intensified spell increases the maximum number of damage dice by 5 levels. You must actually have sufficient caster levels to surpass the maximum in order to benefit from this feat. No other variables of the spell are affected, and spells that inf lict

Feat.Name: In Harm's Way
Feat.Description: You put yourself in danger's path to save your allies.
Feat.Benefit: While using the aid another action to improve an adjacent ally's AC, you can intercept a successful attack against that ally as an immediate action, taking full damage from that attack and any associated effects (bleed, poison, etc.). A creature cannot be

Feat.Name: Ironguts
Feat.Description: You have an especially strong stomach.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against any effect causing the nauseated or sickened conditions and against all ingested poisons (but not other poisons). In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on Survival skill checks to find food for yourself (a
Feat.Prereq: Con 13; dwarf, half-orc, or orc.

Feat.Name: Ironhide
Feat.Description: Your skin is thicker and more resilient than that of most of your people.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus due to your unusually tough hide.
Feat.Prereq: Con 13; dwarf, half-orc, or orc.

Feat.Name: Keen Scent
Feat.Description: Your nose is as sensitive as that of a wild predator.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the scent special ability.
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, half-orc or orc.

Feat.Name: Ki Throw
Feat.Description: Your physical control and mastery of momentum allows you to throw enemies.

Feat.Prereq: Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Leaf Singer
Feat.Description: Your songs recount the ways and mysteries of your people.

Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, bardic performance class feature, elf or half-elf.

Feat.Name: Light Step
Feat.Description: You pick your way nimbly through even the most dangerous and uneven terrain.
Feat.Benefit: You can ignore the effects of difficult terrain in natural environments, as if it were normal terrain.
Feat.Prereq: Acrobatic Steps, Nimble Moves, elf.

Feat.Name: Lingering Performance
Feat.Description: The effects of your bardic performance carry on, even after you have stopped performing.
Feat.Benefit: The bonuses and penalties from your bardic performance continue for 2 rounds after you cease performing. Any other requirement, such as range or specific conditions, must still be met for the effect to continue. If you begin a new bardic performance durin
Feat.Prereq: Bardic performance class feature.

Feat.Name: Lingering Spell
Feat.Description: You spell clings to existence, slowly fading from the world.

Feat.Description: Your allies help you avoid being surprised.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you may act in the surprise round as long as your ally would normally be able to act in the surprise round. If you would normally be denied the ability to act in the surprise round, your initiat

Feat.Name: Low Profile
Feat.Description: Yours small stature helps you avoid ranged attacks.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 dodge bonus to AC against ranged attacks. In addition, you do not provide soft cover to creatures when ranged attacks pass through your square.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Small size or smaller.

Feat.Name: Lucky Halfling
Feat.Description: You bring luck to those with whom you travel.

Feat.Benefit: Choose one spell that you know of 5th level or lower. You may cast that spell twice per day as a spelllike ability. The caster level for this spell-like ability is equal to your caster level in the class from whose spell list the spell is taken. The spell
Feat.Prereq: Minor Spell Expertise, ability to cast 9th-level spells.

Feat.Name: Master Alchemist
Feat.Description: Your mastery of alchemy is nearly supernatural.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on Craft (alchemy) checks, and you may create mundane alchemical items much more quickly than normal. When making poisons, you can create a number of doses equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1) at one time. These additiona
Feat.Prereq: Craft (alchemy) 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Merciful Spell
Feat.Description: Your damaging spells subdue rather than kill.
Feat.Benefit: You can alter spells that inf lict damage to inf lict nonlethal damage instead. Spells that inf lict damage of a particular type (such as fire) inf lict nonlethal damage of that same type. A merciful spell does not use up a higher-level spell slot than th

Feat.Name: Minor Spell Expertise
Feat.Description: You are able to cast a 1st-level spell as a spell-like ability.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one 1st-level spell that you know. You may cast that spell twice per day as a spell-like ability. The caster level for this spell-like ability is equal to your caster level in the class from whose spell list the spell is taken. The spell-like abili
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast 4th-level spells.

Feat.Name: Missile Shield
Feat.Description: You are skilled at def lecting ranged attacks with your shield.
Feat.Benefit: You must be using a light, heavy, or tower shield to use this feat. Once per round when you would normally be hit with an attack from a ranged weapon (not including spell effects, natural attacks, or massive ranged weapons), you may def lect it so that yo
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Shield Focus.

Feat.Name: Mounted Shield
Feat.Description: Your defensive tactics defend both you and your mount.
Feat.Benefit: You may add your base shield bonus (including the bonus from Shield Focus but not including enhancement bonuses) to your mount's AC. In addition, you may add this bonus when making a Ride check to negate a hit against your mount using the Mounted Combat f
Feat.Prereq: Mounted Combat, Shield Focus.

Feat.Name: Mounted Skirmisher
Feat.Description: You are adept at attacking from upon a swift moving steed.
Feat.Benefit: If your mount moves its speed or less, you can still take a full-attack action.
Feat.Prereq: Ride rank 14, Mounted Combat, Trick Riding.

Feat.Name: Outflank
Feat.Description: You look for every edge when flanking an enemy.

Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +4.

Feat.Name: Paired Opportunists
Feat.Description: You know how to make an enemy pay for lax defenses.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this feat, you receive a +4 circumstance bonus on attacks of opportunity against creatures that you both threaten. Enemies that provoke attacks of opportunity from your ally also provoke attacks of opportu

Feat.Name: Parry Spell
Feat.Description: You can throw an enemy spell back at its caster.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you successfully counter a spell, it returns back to its caster. This works exactly like the spell turning spell (Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook page 347).
Feat.Prereq: Spellcraft 15 ranks, Improved Counterspell.

Feat.Name: Parting Shot
Feat.Description: You are an expert skirmisher, able to rain missiles upon your enemies whether advancing or retreating.
Feat.Benefit: Once per encounter, when using the withdraw action, you can make a single ranged attack at any point during your movement.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility, Point Blank Shot, Shot on the Run, base attack bonus +6.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Dodge, Mobility, Point Blank Shot, Shot on the Run

Feat.Name: Pass For Human
Feat.Description: You're easily mistaken for a human rather than a member of your own race.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +10 bonus on Disguise checks to disguise yourself as a human, and do not receive the penalty for disguising yourself as a member of another race when you do so. In areas largely populated or settled by humans, you can take 10 on your Disguis
Feat.Prereq: Half-elf, half-orc, or halfling (see Special).

Feat.Name: Perfect Strike
Feat.Description: When wielding a monk weapon, your attacks can be extremely precise.
Feat.Benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). You must use one of the following weapons to make the attack: kama, nunchaku, quarterstaff, sai, and siangham. You can roll your
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.

Feat.Name: Persistent Spell
Feat.Description: You can modify a spell to become more tenacious when its targets resist its effect.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever a creature targeted by a persistent spell or within its area succeeds on its saving throw against the spell, it must make another saving throw against the effect. If a creature fails this second saving throw, it suffers the full effects of the sp

Feat.Name: Point Blank Master
Feat.Description: You are adept at firing ranged weapons in close quarters.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one type of ranged weapon. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity when firing the selected weapon while threatened.
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Specialization with selected ranged weapon.

Feat.Name: Practiced Tactician
Feat.Description: With only a few quick gestures and commands, you can direct others in combat.
Feat.Benefit: You can use your tactician ability to grant allies a teamwork feat one additional time per day.
Feat.Prereq: Tactician class feature.

Feat.Name: Precise Strike
Feat.Description: You are skilled at striking where it counts, as long as an ally distracts your foe.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you and an ally who also has this feat are flanking the same the creature, you deal an additional 1d6 points of precision damage with each successful melee attack. This bonus damage stacks with other sources of precision damage, such as sneak att
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Preferred Spell
Feat.Description: You find it very easy to cast one particular spell.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one spell which you have the ability to cast. You can cast that spell spontaneously by sacrificing a prepared spell or spell slot of equal or higher level. You can apply any metamagic feats you possess to this spell when you cast it. This increases
Feat.Prereq: Spellcraft 5 ranks, Heighten Spell.

Feat.Name: Punishing Kick
Feat.Description: Your kicks are so powerful you use them to push or knock back your foes.
Feat.Benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). On a successful hit, the attack deals damage normally and you can choose to push your target 5 feet or attempt to knock them pron
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.

Feat.Name: Pushing Assault
Feat.Description: A strike made with a two-handed weapon can push a similar sized opponent backward.

Feat.Prereq: Str 15, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Racial Heritage
Feat.Description: The blood of a non-human ancestor flows in your veins.
Feat.Benefit: Choose another humanoid race. You count as both human and that race for any effects related to race. For example, if you choose dwarf, you are considered both a human and a dwarf for the purpose of taking traits, feats, how spells and magic items affect y

Feat.Name: Raging Vitality
Feat.Description: While raging, you are full of vigor and health.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are raging, the morale bonus to your Constitution increases by +2. Your rage does not end if you become unconscious. While unconscious you must still expend rounds of rage per day each round.
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Ray Shield
Feat.Description: You can even deflect rays with your shield.

Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Missile Shield, Spellbreaker.

Feat.Name: Razortusk
Feat.Description: Your powerful jaws and steely teeth are deadly enough to give you a bite attack.

Feat.Description: Your spells go farther than normal.

Feat.Name: Rending Claws
Feat.Description: Your claw attacks do greater harm to your enemy.
Feat.Benefit: If you hit a creature with two claw attacks in the same turn, the second claw attack deals an additional 1d6 points of damage. This damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a critical hit. You can use this feat once per round.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, two claw natural weapon attacks, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Repositioning Strike
Feat.Description: Your critical hits can move your foes where you wish.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can move your opponent, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. If your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you may move your opponent as if from the reposition combat man
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Reposition, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Saving Shield
Feat.Description: You deflect attacks that could mean your ally's death.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an adjacent ally is the target of an attack, you can, as an immediate action, grant that adjacent ally a +2 shield bonus to AC. You must be wielding a light shield, heavy shield, or tower shield to use this feat.
Feat.Prereq: Shield Proficiency.

Feat.Name: Second Chance
Feat.Description: Quick ref lexes turn missed strikes into second chances.
Feat.Benefit: When making a full attack, if you miss on your first attack, you can forgo making any other attacks for the rest of your turn to reroll that attack at your highest base attack bonus.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Selective Spell
Feat.Description: Your allies need not fear friendly fire.

Feat.Prereq: Spellcraft 10 ranks.

Feat.Name: Shadow Strike
Feat.Description: You accurately strike even those you cannot clearly see.
Feat.Benefit: You can deal precision damage, such as sneak attack damage, against targets with concealment (but not total concealment).
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Shared Insight
Feat.Description: You deftly direct others' attentions where you wish.
Feat.Benefit: As a move action, you can grant all friendly creatures within 30 feet who can see or hear you a +2 bonus on Perception checks for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1 round).

Feat.Name: Sharp Senses
Feat.Description: Your senses are especially sharp, even for your kind.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +4 racial bonus on Perception skill checks. This replaces the normal bonus from the keen senses racial trait.

Feat.Name: Shield of Swings
Feat.Description: A wild frenzy of attacks serves to bolster your defenses.

Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Description: You have mastered the use of one type of shield.

Feat.Prereq: Proficiency with selected shield, Shield Focus, fighter level 4th.

Feat.Description: You form a unified defense with those around you.

Feat.Prereq: Shield Proficiency.

Feat.Name: Shielded Caster
Feat.Description: Your allies cover you while you cast complicated spells.

Feat.Description: You can sicken creatures with your spells.

Feat.Description: You can reposition yourself after a foe's missed swing.

Feat.Name: Smash
Feat.Description: You overcome obstacles by breaking them.
Feat.Benefit: When you attack an inanimate, unattended object, you ignore the first 5 points of its hardness. You also receive a +5 bonus on Strength checks made to knock down or break open doors.
Feat.Prereq: Power Attack, half-orc.

Feat.Name: Smell Fear
Feat.Description: You can catch the sour scent of fear on the wind.

Feat.Prereq: Keen Scent, half-orc or orc.

Feat.Name: Sociable
Feat.Description: You have a way of helping others to get along.
Feat.Benefit: As a move action, you grant all friendly creatures within 30 feet who can see or hear you (including yourself ) a +2 bonus on Diplomacy checks for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1 round).
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, half-elf.

Feat.Name: Spell Perfection
Feat.Description: You are unequaled at the casting of one particular spell.

Feat.Name: Spider Step
Feat.Description: Your physical mastery grants you an impossible stride.
Feat.Benefit: As a move action, you can move up to half your slow fall distance (maximum 50 feet) across a wall or ceiling or across ropes, branches, or even water or other surfaces that cannot support your weight. You must reach a solid, level surface by the end of yo
Feat.Prereq: Acrobatics 6 ranks, Climb 6 ranks, monk level 6th.

Feat.Name: Stabbing Shot
Feat.Description: You can clear the way to continue using your bow.
Feat.Benefit: When adjacent to an opponent and making a full-attack action with a longbow or shortbow (including composite bows), you may choose to make a melee attack against that opponent with a drawn arrow rather than firing it. If the attack hits-whether or not it
Feat.Prereq: Rapid Shot, elf.

Feat.Name: Steel Soul
Feat.Description: You are especially resistant to magic.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +4 racial bonus on saving throws against spells and spell-like abilities. This replaces the normal bonus from the dwarf 's hardy racial trait.
Feat.Prereq: Dwarf, hardy racial trait.

Feat.Name: Step Up and Strike
Feat.Description: When a foe tries to move away, you can follow and make an attack.

Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Following Step, Step Up, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Stone-Faced
Feat.Description: Rocks show more expression than you.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +4 bonus on Bluff checks to lie or conceal your feelings or true motives, but not to feint in combat or deliver secret messages. In addition, the DC for Sense Motive checks to get a hunch about you is 25 rather than 20.

Feat.Description: You can feel movement in the very earth and stones around you.

Feat.Name: Stone Singer
Feat.Description: Your songs are in accordance with the ways and lands of your people.

Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, bardic performance class feature, dwarf.

Feat.Description: You powerful but imprecise attacks can stun your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: You can choose to take a -5 penalty on all melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to stun targets you hit with your melee attacks for 1 round. A successful Fortitude save negates the effect. The DC of this save is 10 + your base attack bonus. You m
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +16.

Feat.Name: Summoner's Call
Feat.Description: Whenever you summon your eidolon, it is more powerful for a brief period of time.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you summon your eidolon, you may give it a +2 enhancement bonus to its Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution. This bonus lasts 10 minutes after the summoning ritual is complete.
Feat.Prereq: Eidolon class feature.

Feat.Name: Sundering Strike
Feat.Description: Your critical hits can sunder your foes' weapons.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can sunder your opponent's weapon, in addition to the normal damage dealt by the attack. If your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you may deal damage to your opponent's weapon as if
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Improved Sunder, Power Attack, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Swap Places
Feat.Description: You are skilled at changing places with your ally during a chaotic melee.

Feat.Description: With a quick but harmless swipe, you can aid an ally's assault.
Feat.Benefit: As a swift action, you can attempt the aid another action, granting your ally either a +1 bonus on his next attack roll or a +1 bonus to his AC.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Taunt
Feat.Description: You may be small, but your remarks cut others down to size.
Feat.Benefit: You can demoralize opponents using Bluff rather than Intimidate (see the Intimidate skill description for details) and take no skill check penalty for being smaller than your target.

Feat.Name: Team Up
Feat.Description: When you are ganging up against an enemy, you can aid an ally with a quick feint.
Feat.Benefit: When you and at least two of your allies are adjacent to an opponent, you can attempt the aid another action as a move action.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Gang Up, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Teleport Tactician
Feat.Description: You are highly alert for enemies using teleportation to approach you or flee from you.
Feat.Benefit: Any creature using a teleportation effect to enter or leave a square threatened by you provokes an attack of opportunity, even if casting defensively or using a supernatural ability.
Feat.Prereq: Combat Reflexes, Disruptive, Spellbreaker.

Feat.Name: Tenacious Transmutation
Feat.Description: Your mastery of the magic of changing makes your transmutations more durable.
Feat.Benefit: The DC of caster level checks to dispel or remove your transmutations increases by 2; even if the spell is negated, its effects persist for 1 additional round before dissipating.
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus (transmutation).

Feat.Name: Thundering Spell
Feat.Description: You can conjure your spells into existence with blaring thunder or fearful shrieks, deafening creatures damaged by their effects.

Feat.Name: Touch of Serenity
Feat.Description: With a single touch you can reduce the threat of even the most savage of foes.
Feat.Benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). On a successful hit, the attack deals no damage and bestows no other effect or condition, but the target cannot cast spells or at
Feat.Prereq: Wis 18, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.

Feat.Name: Trick Riding
Feat.Description: You are not only skilled at controlling a horse in combat; you can make it look like art.
Feat.Benefit: While wearing light or no armor, you do not need to make Ride skill checks for any task listed in the Ride skill with a DC of 15 or lower. You do not take a -5 penalty for riding a mount bareback. You can make a check using Mounted Combat to negate a hit
Feat.Prereq: Ride 9 ranks, Mounted Combat.

Feat.Name: Tripping Strike
Feat.Description: The force intrinsic to your critical hits can knock your foes down.

Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Under and Over
Feat.Description: You can slip under a foe trying to grab you, knocking him off balance.
