Feat.Prereq: Agile Maneuvers, Small size or smaller.

Feat.Name: Underfoot
Feat.Description: You slip under and around your larger foes.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +4 dodge bonus on Acrobatics checks to move past opponents without provoking attacks of opportunity, so long as they are larger than you. In addition, you gain a +2 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks of opportunity caused when you mo
Feat.Prereq: Dodge, Mobility, Small size or smaller.

Feat.Name: Vermin Heart
Feat.Description: You have a special bond with things that creep, crawl, skitter, and sting.
Feat.Benefit: You may target vermin with spells and special abilities that only affect animals (although they are still affected by spells targeting vermin as well). You may use wild empathy to inf luence vermin as easily as you inf luence animals.
Feat.Prereq: Wild empathy class feature.

Feat.Name: War Singer
Feat.Description: Your songs draw upon the savage chants and brutal ways of your people, inspiring those around you to new heights of violence and savagery.
Feat.Benefit: When you use bardic performance with audible components on a battlefield (any area where a combat involving a dozen or more combatants is taking place), the range or area of your chosen performance is doubled. In addition, the DC for saving throws against
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, bardic performance class feature, half-orc or orc.

Feat.Name: Well-Prepared
Feat.Description: Somehow, you always seem to have the right tools or supplies close at hand.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, when confronted with a situation that calls for a particular mundane item of equipment, you may make a Sleight of Hand check with a DC of 10 plus the item's cost in gold pieces to happen= to have such an item on your person. For example, hav

Feat.Name: Adder Strike
Feat.Description: You can quickly apply poison to gloved hands, protected feet, or other protected body parts, delivering the poison with your unarmed strikes.
Feat.Benefit: As a swift action, you can apply one dose of contact or injury poison to two body parts that you use for unarmed strikes. You must still protect yourself against exposure to contact poisons you apply in this way.
Feat.Prereq: Poison use class feature, Craft (alchemy) 1 rank, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Adept Champion
Feat.Description: You can alter your smite ability, channeling the power of your deity into divine inspiration that grants you greater aptitude for performing combat maneuvers.
Feat.Benefit: While using your smite evil class feature, as a swift action at the start of your turn, you can forgo the bonus on damage rolls and instead gain half that bonus as a bonus on combat maneuver checks against the target of your smite. The effects of your smi
Feat.Prereq: Smite evil class feature, base attack bonus +5.

Feat.Name: Amateur Gunslinger
Feat.Description: Although you are not a gunslinger, you have and can use grit.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a small amount of grit and the ability to perform a single 1st-level deed from the gunslinger deed class feature. At the start of the day, you gain 1 grit point, though throughout the day you can gain grit points up to a maximum of your Wisdom mo
Feat.Prereq: You have no levels in a class that has the grit class feature.

Feat.Name: Arc Slinger
Feat.Description: You can twirl your sling in a way that maximizes its effectiveness.
Feat.Benefit: When using a sling or sling staff, you reduce your penalty on ranged attack rolls due to range by 2. Point-Blank Shot's damage bonus applies within the first normal range increment of your sling (50 feet) or sling staff (80 feet).
Feat.Prereq: Point-Blank Shot, proficient with sling or halfling sling staff.

Feat.Name: Back to Back
Feat.Description: Your ally's eyes are your own, and yours are his.
Feat.Benefit: While you are flanked and adjacent to an ally with this feat, you receive a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against attacks from opponents flanking you.
Feat.Prereq: Perception 3 ranks.

Feat.Name: Betrayer
Feat.Description: You can charm people into lowering their defenses, allowing you to ambush them more effectively.
Feat.Benefit: When you succeed at a Diplomacy check to change a creature's attitude, you can draw a weapon and make a single melee attack against that creature as an immediate action. If you changed your target's attitude to friendly or better, your target is considere
Feat.Prereq: Quick Draw, Persuasive, base attack bonus +3.

Feat.Name: Binding Throw
Feat.Description: You can strike your enemy and use the blow as an opportunity to grab and hold him.
Feat.Benefit: After you successfully use the Ki Throw feat on an opponent, you can use a swift action to attempt a grapple combat maneuver against that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Grapple, Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike, Ki Throw.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Grapple, Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike, Ki Throw

Feat.Name: Bludgeoner
Feat.Description: You can knock foes out cold with just about any blunt instrument.
Feat.Benefit: You take no penalty on attack rolls for using a lethal bludgeoning weapon to deal nonlethal damage.

Feat.Name: Boar Ferocity
Feat.Description: Your flesh-ripping unarmed strikes terrify your victims.
Feat.Benefit: You add piercing damage to the damage types you can deal with your unarmed strikes. Further, you gain a +2 bonus on Intimidate checks to demoralize opponents. While using Boar Style, whenever you tear an opponent's f lesh, you can spend a free action to m
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Boar Style, Intimidate 6 ranks.

Feat.Name: Boar Shred
Feat.Description: The wounds you inf lict with your unarmed strikes bleed, giving you renewed vigor.
Feat.Benefit: You can make an Intimidate check to demoralize an opponent as a move action. While using Boar Style, whenever you tear an opponent's flesh, once per round at the start of that opponent's turn he takes 1d6 bleed damage. The bleed damage dealt while using B
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Boar Ferocity, Boar Style, Intimidate 9 ranks.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Unarmed Strike, Boar Ferocity, Boar Style

Feat.Name: Boar Style
Feat.Description: Your sharp teeth and nails rip your foes open.
Feat.Benefit: You can deal bludgeoning damage or slashing damage with your unarmed strikes-changing damage type is a free action. While using this style, once per round when you hit a single foe with two or more unarmed strikes, you can tear flesh. When you do, you dea
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Intimidate 3 ranks.

Feat.Name: Body Shield
Feat.Description: With a sly maneuver, you force a grappled opponent into the path of an incoming attack.
Feat.Benefit: As an immediate action while you are grappling an adjacent creature, you can make a grapple combat maneuver check against that creature to gain cover against a single attack. If you are successful and the attack misses you, that attack targets the creatur
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Bolstered Resilience
Feat.Description: You can dramatically increase your damage reduction in exchange for its temporary loss.
Feat.Benefit: As an immediate action, you can double your DR against a single attack, to a maximum of DR 20. The type of the DR remains unchanged. If the attack you are guarding against is not successful, the increased damage reduction persists until you are hit with a
Feat.Prereq: Damage reduction.

Feat.Name: Bonebreaker
Feat.Description: When your opponent is unable to adequately defend against them, your precise unarmed strikes break bone and tear tissue.
Feat.Benefit: When you make a successful Stunning Fist attempt against an opponent that is grappled, helpless, or stunned, you can forgo any other Stunning Fist effect to deal 1d6 Strength or Dexterity damage to that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, Jawbreaker, Stunning Fist, Heal 9 ranks.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, Jawbreaker, Stunning Fist

Feat.Name: Branded for Retribution
Feat.Description: You brand an enemy with your bane weapon, making it more vulnerable to your allies' attacks.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, expend 3 rounds of your bane class feature and make a melee touch attack with the weapon affected by bane. If you hit, your target takes no damage but is branded until the start of your next turn. While this brand remains, your allie
Feat.Prereq: Bane class feature.

Feat.Name: Break Guard
Feat.Description: You can use one of your two weapons to occupy your opponent's defenses while attacking with the other.
Feat.Benefit: While wielding two weapons, whenever you successfully use one weapon to disarm an opponent, you can spend a swift action to attack the opponent you attempted to disarm using your other weapon.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Disarm, Two-Weapon Fighting.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Expertise, Improved Disarm, Two-Weapon Fighting

Feat.Name: Broken Wing Gambit
Feat.Description: You feign weakness, making yourself a tempting and distracting target.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you make a melee attack and hit your opponent, you can use a free action to grant that opponent a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls against you until the end of your next turn or until your opponent attacks you, whichever happens first. If that
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Cartwheel Dodge
Feat.Description: You use your knack for avoiding damage to reposition yourself in combat.
Feat.Benefit: When you successfully use improved evasion to avoid taking damage, you can move up to half your speed as an immediate action. This movement provokes attacks of opportunity as normal.
Feat.Prereq: Evasion class feature, improved evasion class feature, acrobatics 12 ranks.

Feat.Name: Cavalry Formation
Feat.Description: You are skilled at riding in close formation with your mounted allies without impeding your effectiveness on the battlefield.
Feat.Benefit: You and your mount can overlap the space of mounts whose riders have this feat, although no more than two creatures can share any one square. Further, you can charge through a space containing an allied mount if that mount's rider has this feat, although
Feat.Prereq: Mounted Combat.

Feat.Name: Channeled Revival
Feat.Description: You can expend a large portion of your channeling power to reverse death itself.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action that provokes attacks of opportunity, you can expend three uses of your channel energy class feature to restore a dead creature to life as if you had cast the breath of life spell (Core Rulebook 251).
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy 6d6 (positive energy).

Feat.Name: Channeling Scourge
Feat.Description: Your zeal for hunting your faith's enemies empowers your ability to channel divine energy, as long as you channel that energy for harm.
Feat.Benefit: When you use channel energy to deal damage, your inquisitor levels count as cleric levels for determining the number of damage dice and the saving throw DC.
Feat.Prereq: Inquisitor channel energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Charging Hurler
Feat.Description: You know how to use your momentum to enhance your thrown weapon attacks.
Feat.Benefit: You can use the charge rules to make a thrown weapon attack. All the parameters of a charge apply, except that you must only move closer to your opponent, and you must end your movement within 30 feet of that opponent. If you do, you can make a single thr
Feat.Prereq: Point-Blank Shot.

Feat.Name: Chokehold
Feat.Description: While grappling, you can cut off an opponent's air and blood supply.
Feat.Benefit: While you have an opponent up to one size category larger than you grappled, you can attempt a grapple combat maneuver with a -5 penalty on the check. If you succeed, you have pinned your opponent and hold the opponent in a chokehold. When you maintain th
Feat.Prereq: Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +6 or monk level 5th.

Feat.Name: Cleaving Finish
Feat.Description: When you strike down an opponent, you can continue your swing into another target.
Feat.Benefit: If you make a melee attack, and your target drops to 0 or fewer hit points as a result of your attack, you can make another melee attack using your highest base attack bonus against another opponent within reach. You can make only one extra attack per rou
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Power Attack.

Feat.Name: Close-Quarters Thrower
Feat.Description: You are agile enough to avoid melee attacks while throwing weapons or bombs.
Feat.Benefit: Choose a type of thrown weapon. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity for making ranged attacks using the selected weapon. If you are an alchemist, and you select this feat and choose alchemist bombs, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity for the
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Dodge, Weapon Focus with selected thrown weapon.

Feat.Name: Clustered Shots
Feat.Description: You take a moment to carefully aim your shots, causing them all to strike nearly the same spot.
Feat.Benefit: When you use a full-attack action to make multiple ranged weapon attacks against the same opponent, total the damage from all hits before applying that opponent's damage reduction.
Feat.Prereq: Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Combat Medic
Feat.Description: You know the urgency of treating wounds in the heat of battle, applying first aid to your allies with such speed that you assure no one gets left behind.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use Heal to provide first aid, treat caltrop wounds, or treat poison on an ally who also has this feat, you provoke no attacks of opportunity, and can take 10 on the check.
Feat.Prereq: Heal 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Combat Style Master
Feat.Description: You shift between combat styles, combining them to increased effect.
Feat.Benefit: You can switch your style as a free action. At the start of combat, pick one of your styles. You start the combat in that style, even in the surprise round.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, two or more style feats, base attack bonus +6 or monk level 5th.

Feat.Name: Contingent Channeling
Feat.Description: You can imbue others with your healing energy so that they can use it at the moment of greatest need.
Feat.Benefit: You can use a standard action to touch an ally and expend one of your daily uses of channel energy to create a repository of positive energy within that ally. This repository contains the same number and type of dice as normal for your channel energy feat
Feat.Prereq: True healer class feature, Selective Channeling.

Feat.Name: Coordinated Charge
Feat.Description: You are an expert at leading your allies into the fray.
Feat.Benefit: When an ally with this feat charges a creature that is no further away from you than your speed, you can, as an immediate action, charge that creature. You must be able to follow all of the normal charge rules.
Feat.Prereq: You have at least two other teamwork feats, base attack bonus +10.

Feat.Name: Crane Riposte
Feat.Description: You use your defensive abilities to make overpowering counterattacks.
Feat.Benefit: You take only a -1 penalty on attack rolls for fighting defensively. Whenever you use Crane Wing to def lect an opponent's attack, you can make an attack of opportunity against that opponent after the attack is def lected.
Feat.Prereq: Crane Style, Crane Wing, Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8 or monk level 7th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Crane Style, Crane Wing, Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Crane Style
Feat.Description: Your unarmed fighting techniques blend poise with graceful defense.
Feat.Benefit: You take only a -2 penalty on attack rolls for f ighting defensively. While using this style and fighting defensively or using the total defense action, you gain an additional +1 dodge bonus to your Armor Class.
Feat.Prereq: Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +2 or monk level 1st.

Feat.Name: Crane Wing
Feat.Description: You move with the speed and finesse of an avian hunter, your sweeping blocks and graceful motions allowing you to def lect melee attacks with ease.
Feat.Benefit: Once per round while using Crane Style, when you have at least one hand free and are either fighting defensively or using the total defense action, you can def lect one melee weapon attack that would normally hit you. You expend no action to def lect the
Feat.Prereq: Crane Style, Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +5 or monk level 5th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Crane Style, Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Crusader's Fist
Feat.Description: You pour divine energy into the enemy you strike.
Feat.Benefit: When you attack with an unarmed strike and hit a creature that you can harm with your lay on hands or touch of corruption feature, you can use a swift action to expend a daily use of that feature to deal its normal damage as if you had hit with the featur
Feat.Prereq: Lay on hands class feature or touch of corruption class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Crusader's Flurry
Feat.Description: You learned to use your deity's favored weapon as part of your martial arts form.
Feat.Benefit: You can use your deity's favored weapon as if it were a monk weapon.
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy class feature, flurry of blows class feature, Weapon Focus with your deity's favored melee weapon.

Feat.Name: Crushing Blow
Feat.Description: Your focus allows you to smash your enemy's defenses.
Feat.Benefit: You can make a Stunning Fist attempt as a full-round action. If successful, instead of stunning your target, you reduce the target's AC by an amount equal to your Wisdom modifier for 1 minute. This penalty does not stack with other penalties applied due t
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist.

Feat.Name: Deadly Finish
Feat.Description: Your attacks don't just fell your opponents-they kill them outright.
Feat.Benefit: When you hit with a melee attack and reduce your opponent to -1 or fewer hit points, you can force that opponent to succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15 + the damage your attack dealt) or die.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Death from Above
Feat.Description: You allow gravity to add extra force to your charges.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you charge an opponent from higher ground, or from above while flying, you gain a +5 bonus on attack rolls in place of the bonuses from charging and being on higher ground.

Feat.Name: Death or Glory
Feat.Description: Even when facing a larger foe, you aren't afraid to take great risks in order to finish the fight.
Feat.Benefit: Against a creature of size Large or larger, you can make a single melee attack as a full-round action, gaining a +4 bonus on the attack roll, damage roll, and critical confirmation roll. You gain an additional +1 on this bonus at base attack bonus +11, +1
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Deathless Initiate
Feat.Description: For you, impending death is a call to wrath.
Feat.Benefit: You are not staggered while using the Diehard feat, but if you take a move and a standard action or a fullround action while you are at 0 or fewer hit points you take 1 point of damage. Further, while using the Diehard feat, you gain a +2 bonus on melee a
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Con 13, orc or half-orc, Diehard, Endurance, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Deathless Master
Feat.Description: Even if you suffer a grievous wound, you can shrug off the damage and continue your relentless assault.
Feat.Benefit: When you are at 0 or fewer hit points, you do not lose 1 hit point when you take an action.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Con 15, orc or half-orc, Deathless Initiate, Diehard, Endurance, Ironhide**, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Deathless Zealot
Feat.Description: Only the most serious wounds can stop you.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever a creature rolls to confirm a critical hit against you, it must roll twice and take the lowest result.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Con 17, orc or half-orc, Deathless Initiate, Deathless Master, Diehard, Endurance, Ironhide**, base attack bonus +12.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Deathless Initiate, Deathless Master, Diehard, Endurance, Ironhide

Feat.Name: Deceptive Exchange
Feat.Description: You trick an adversary into grabbing an object you hand them, even in the midst of combat.
Feat.Benefit: If you successfully feint an opponent, you can trick that opponent into accepting a one-handed object you are holding instead of denying that opponent its Dexterity bonus to AC against your next attack. The opponent must have appendages capable of holding
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Feint.

Feat.Name: Defensive Weapon Training
Feat.Description: You know how to defend yourself against a certain class of weaponry.
Feat.Benefit: Choose a weapon group from the fighter's weapon training class ability list (except natural weapons). You gain a +2 dodge bonus on AC when an opponent attacks you using a weapon from that group. If you also have the weapon training class feature in the se
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, base attack bonus +5.

Feat.Name: Deft Shootist Deed
Feat.Description: You keep an eye out while focusing on your weapon, allowing you to avoid attacks while shooting and reloading firearms.
Feat.Benefit: As long as you have at least 1 grit point, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity when shooting or reloading a firearm.
Feat.Prereq: Grit class feature or Amateur Gunslinger feat, Dodge, Mobility.

Feat.Name: Destructive Dispel
Feat.Description: When you dispel an enemy's magical defenses, those defenses crash down with debilitating effects.
Feat.Benefit: When you successfully make a targeted dispel check against an opponent, that opponent must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC equals the DC of the spell used to dispel) or be stunned until the start of your next turn. If the save succeeds, the opponent is in
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast dispel magic or greater dispel magic, caster level 11th.

Feat.Name: Devastating Strike
Feat.Description: Pitting all of your strength and resolve against your enemy, you deliver a strike that is impossible to ignore.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use Vital Strike, Improved Vital Strike, or Greater Vital Strike, you gain a +2 bonus on each extra weapon damage dice roll those feats grant (+6 maximum). This bonus damage is multiplied on a critical hit.
Feat.Prereq: Vital Strike, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Dimensional Agility
Feat.Description: Teleportation does not faze you.
Feat.Benefit: After using abundant step or casting dimension door, you can take any actions you still have remaining on your turn. You also gain a +4 bonus on Concentration checks when casting teleportation spells.
Feat.Prereq: Ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door.

Feat.Name: Dimensional Assault
Feat.Description: You have been trained to use magical movement as part of your combat tactics.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, you use abundant step or cast dimension door as a special charge. Doing so allows you to teleport up to double your current speed (up to the maximum distance allowed by the spell or ability) and to make the attack normally allowed
Feat.Prereq: Ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door, Dimensional Agility.

Feat.Name: Dimensional Dervish
Feat.Description: You teleport with a mere thought, savaging your opponents as you flash in and out of reality.
Feat.Benefit: You can take a full-attack action, activating abundant step or casting dimension door as a swift action. If your do, you can teleport up to twice your speed (up to the maximum distance allowed by the spell or ability), dividing this teleportation into inc
Feat.Prereq: Ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door, Dimensional Agility, Dimensional Assault, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Dimensional Maneuvers
Feat.Description: Your rapid teleportation makes your combat maneuvers more difficult to avoid.
Feat.Benefit: While using the Dimensional Dervish feat, you gain a +4 bonus on combat maneuver checks to bull rush, disarm, reposition, or trip an opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door, Dimensional Agility, Dimensional Assault, Dimensional Dervish, base attack bonus +9.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Dimensional Agility, Dimensional Assault, Dimensional Dervish

Feat.Name: Dimensional Savant
Feat.Description: You flash into and out of reality so quickly it is impossible to tell exactly where you are at any given time.
Feat.Benefit: While using the Dimensional Dervish feat, you provide flanking from all squares you attack from. Flanking starts from the moment you make an attack until the start of your next turn. You can effectively flank with yourself and with multiple allies when us
Feat.Prereq: Dimensional Agility, Dimensional Assault, Dimensional Dervish, ability to use the abundant step class feature or cast dimension door, base attack bonus +9.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Dimensional Agility, Dimensional Assault, Dimensional Dervish

Feat.Name: Discordant Voice
Feat.Description: By singing out a precise tone, you cause discordant vibrations to run through allies' weapons.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are using bardic performance to create a spell-like or supernatural effect, allies within 30 feet of you deal an extra 1d6 points of sonic damage with successful weapon attacks. This damage stacks with other energy damage a weapon might deal.
Feat.Prereq: Bardic performance class feature, Perform (oratory or sing) 10 ranks.

Feat.Name: Disengaging Feint
Feat.Description: You can feint to disengage from combat.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, use Bluff to feint against an opponent. Instead of denying that opponent his Dexterity bonus to AC, a successful feint allows you to move up to your speed without provoking an attack of opportunity from the opponent you feinted for l
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Feint.

Feat.Name: Disengaging Flourish
Feat.Description: Distracting your opponents gives you the opportunity to make a swift retreat.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, make a Bluff check against each opponent that currently threatens you. If you succeed against at least one opponent, you can move up to your speed. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from any opponent you succeeded
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Disengaging Feint, Improved Feint.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Expertise, Disengaging Feint, Improved Feint

Feat.Name: Disengaging Shot
Feat.Description: You make one last attack before beating a hasty retreat.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use Disengaging Feint or Disengaging Flourish, you can make a single melee attack against one opponent you succeeded at feinting against. That opponent is denied his Dexterity bonus to AC against this attack.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Disengaging Feint, Dodge, Improved Feint, Mobility.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Expertise, Disengaging Feint, Dodge, Improved Feint, Mobility

Feat.Name: Disorienting Maneuver
Feat.Description: Your erratic movements disorient your opponent.
Feat.Benefit: If you successfully use Acrobatics to tumble through an opponent's space, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on attack rolls against that opponent until the start of your next turn. If you choose to make a trip attempt against that opponent, you gain a +4 c
Feat.Prereq: Dodge, Acrobatics 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Dispel Synergy
Feat.Description: By tearing away an opponent's magical defenses, you leave your enemy vulnerable, making it difficult for him to resist your spells.
Feat.Benefit: If you successfully dispel an ongoing magical effect on an opponent, that opponent takes a -2 penalty on saving throws against your spells until the end of your next turn.
Feat.Prereq: Spellcraft 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Dispelling Critical
Feat.Description: Your blows attack the physical and arcane forms of your enemies at the same time.
Feat.Benefit: If you have dispel magic prepared or can cast it spontaneously, when you score a critical hit against an opponent, you may use a swift action to cast dispel magic to make a targeted dispel against that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Arcane Strike, base attack bonus +11, ability to cast dispel magic.

Feat.Name: Dispelling Fist
Feat.Description: By focusing on your knowledge of magic and spells that negate its powers, you use your bare hands to rip magical defenses from your enemy.
Feat.Benefit: If you have dispel magic prepared or can cast it spontaneously, you can cast it as a swift action after hitting an opponent with an unarmed strike. Treat this as a targeted dispel against the opponent you hit.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +11, ability to cast dispel magic, caster level 7th.

Feat.Name: Disposable Weapon
Feat.Description: You ignore the limitations of your equipment, striking harder despite the damage it does to your weapon.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use a melee or thrown weapon with the fragile weapon special quality to score a critical threat against an opponent, you can give your weapon the broken condition to automatically conf irm the critical hit.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, proficient with weapon.

Feat.Name: Disruptive Recall
Feat.Description: You can disrupt an enemy caster's spells to fuel your own arcane power.
Feat.Benefit: When you use a melee attack to successfully disrupt an arcane spellcaster's spell, you can immediately use your spell recall class feature to regain a magus spell you have already cast. This ability functions as if you had expended a number of points from
Feat.Prereq: Spell recall class feature, Spellcraft 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Distance Thrower
Feat.Description: You are accurate with thrown weapons at longer ranges than normal.
Feat.Benefit: With a thrown weapon, you reduce your penalty on ranged attack rolls due to range by 2.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13.

Feat.Name: Djinni Spin
Feat.Description: You can surround yourself with the power of the storm, spinning like a hurricane to unleash a violent blast of electrical energy.
Feat.Benefit: While using Djinni Style, as a standard action you can spend two Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempts to surround yourself with a whirlwind of electrified air. Creatures adjacent to you take your unarmed strike damage plus the electricity
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, Wis 17, Djinni Style, Djinni Spirit, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +13 or monk level 11th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Djinni Style, Djinni Spirit, Elemental Fist, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Djinni Spirit
Feat.Description: By calling upon the spirits of storms, you can manipulate lightning to protect yourself and buffet your enemies with peals of thunder.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While using Djinni Style, you gain electricity resistance equal to your base attack bonus or monk level, whichever is higher. While denied your Dexterity bonus to AC you
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, Wis 15, Djinni Style, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +11 or monk level 9th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Djinni Style, Elemental Fist, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Djinni Style
Feat.Description: Your hands sheathed in an auras of lightning, you move like the wind.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While you are in this style you must use Elemental Fist to deal electricity damage and you gain a bonus on electricity damage rolls equal to your Wisdom bonus. Further,
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Wis 15, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 5th.

Feat.Name: Domain Strike
Feat.Description: You unleash a domain power upon your enemy as part of your unarmed strike.
Feat.Benefit: When you gain this feat, choose one domaingranted power that you can use to affect no more than one opponent. If you make a successful unarmed strike against an opponent, in addition to dealing your unarmed strike damage, you can use a swift action to del
Feat.Prereq: Domain class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Double Bane
Feat.Description: You extend your bane effect to two weapons.
Feat.Benefit: You can apply your bane to a second weapon you are wielding. While your bane class feature is active, at the start of each of your turns as a free action, you choose whether to apply the ability to one weapon or the other, or both. For each round you appl
Feat.Prereq: Bane class feature, Two-Weapon Fighting.

Feat.Name: Drag Down
Feat.Description: When you are knocked prone, you are skilled at bringing your opponent down with you.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an opponent successfully trips you, you can attempt to trip that opponent as an immediate action.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip.

Feat.Name: Dragon Ferocity
Feat.Description: You attack with the strength of a dragon, your telling blows striking fear into your enemies.

Feat.Description: The spirit of the dragon wells up inside you and bursts forth in a mighty roar.

Feat.Prereq: Str 15, Improved Unarmed Strike, Dragon Style, Stunning Fist, Acrobatics 8 ranks.

Feat.Name: Dragon Style
Feat.Description: You call upon the spirit of dragonkind, gaining greater resilience, mobility, and fierceness from the blessing of these great beings.

Feat.Prereq: Str 15, Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 3 ranks.

Feat.Name: Dramatic Display
Feat.Description: Your skill with your weapon is obvious to enemies and onlookers alike.
Feat.Benefit: When you spend a swift action to make a performance check, you exude an aura of awe-inspiring skill. You gain a +2 bonus on your performance check, and gain a +2 bonus on all attack rolls and combat maneuver checks until the end of your next turn.
Feat.Prereq: Dazzling Display.

Feat.Name: Earth Child Binder
Feat.Description: Even the greatest giants fear your technique.

Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, dwarf or gnome, defensive training racial trait, Earth Child Style, Earth Child Topple, Greater Trip, Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist, Acrobatics 9 ranks.

Feat.Name: Earth Child Style
Feat.Description: Your martial training makes you a dangerous and elusive target for giants.
Feat.Benefit: While using this style, your defensive training dodge bonus to AC increases to +6. Further, against creatures of the giant subtype, you can add your Wisdom bonus on your unarmed strike damage rolls.
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, dwarf or gnome, defensive training racial trait, Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 3 ranks.

Feat.Description: Your mastery of balance and momentum allows you to bring down giants with your bare hands.

Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, dwarf or gnome, defensive training racial trait, Earth Child Style, Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 6 ranks.

Feat.Name: Efreeti Stance
Feat.Description: Calling upon the burning spirits of incarnate flame, you can manipulate fire to protect yourself and immolate your foes.

Feat.Prereq: Con 15, Wis 15, Efreeti Style, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +11 or monk level 9th.

Feat.Name: Efreeti Style
Feat.Description: Your mastery of the unpredictable power of flames allows you to unleash scorching strikes that burn your enemies even when you fail to make contact.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While using this style and Elemental Fist to deal fire damage, you gain a bonus on fire damage rolls equal to your Wisdom bonus. Further, if your Elemental Fist melee at
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Wis 15, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 5th.

Feat.Name: Efreeti Touch
Feat.Description: Your knowledge of the secrets of the burning wind and blazing sun allows you to collect flames into your hands and unleash them in a gout of elemental fire.
Feat.Benefit: While using Efreeti Style, as a standard action, you can spend two Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempts to unleash a 15-foot coneshaped burst of flame. Creatures caught in the cone take your unarmed strike damage plus the fire damage from
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, Wis 17, Efreeti Style, Efreeti Stance, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +13 or monk level 11th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Efreeti Style, Efreeti Stance, Elemental Fist, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Elusive Redirection
Feat.Description: You can redirect an attack back at your assailant or into an adjacent enemy.
Feat.Benefit: When you successfully use your elusive target class feature to avoid taking damage, you can spend an immediate action and an additional point from your ki pool to redirect that attack back at your attacker or toward any other opponent adjacent to you and
Feat.Prereq: Elusive target class feature, Combat Expertise, Improved Unarmed Strike, flowing monk level 12th.

Feat.Name: Enfilading Fire
Feat.Description: Your ranged attacks take advantage of the flanking maneuvers of allies.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on ranged attacks made against a foe flanked by 1 or more allies with this feat.
Feat.Prereq: Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, one other teamwork feat.

Feat.Name: Escape Route
Feat.Description: You have trained to watch your allies' backs, covering them as they make tactical withdraws.
Feat.Benefit: An ally who also has this feat provokes no attacks of opportunity for moving through squares adjacent to you or within your space.

Feat.Name: Expert Driver
Feat.Description: When driving a chosen type of vehicle, you exhibit incredible control, maneuvering the vehicle with greater ease and stopping with uncanny precision.
Feat.Benefit: You can make an accelerate, decelerate, or turn action as a move action instead of a standard action. Furthermore, when stopping a vehicle, you subtract 10 feet from the roll to determine how many feet the vehicle moves forward before it stops.
Feat.Prereq: Skilled Driver with the selected vehicle type.

Feat.Name: Extra Bane
Feat.Description: You can use your bane ability more often than normal.
Feat.Benefit: You can use your bane ability for 3 additional rounds per day.
Feat.Prereq: Bane class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Grit
Feat.Description: You have more grit than the ordinary gunslinger.
Feat.Benefit: You gain 2 extra grit points at the start of each day, and your maximum grit increases by 2.
Feat.Prereq: Grit class feature or the Amateur Gunslinger feat.

Feat.Name: False Opening
Feat.Description: When you make a ranged attack while threatened, you can fool your opponent into thinking he has an opening.
Feat.Benefit: Choose a ranged weapon or a thrown weapon. When you make a ranged attack using that weapon, you can choose to provoke an attack of opportunity from one or more opponents who threaten you. You gain a +4 dodge bonus against such attacks. An opponent that ma
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Dodge, Close Quarters Thrower or Point-Blank Master, Weapon Focus with selected ranged weapon.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Dodge, Close Quarters Thrower|Point-Blank Master, Weapon Focus

Feat.Name: Feint Partner
Feat.Description: A little diversion is all you need to slip through your foe's defenses.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an ally who also has this feat successfully feints an opponent, that opponent also loses his Dexterity bonus to AC against the next attack you make against him before the end of the feinting ally's next turn.
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Felling Escape
Feat.Description: Through the use of fluid contortions and manipulations of leverage, you can throw your opponent to the ground after escaping a grapple.
Feat.Benefit: When you break an opponent's grapple with a combat maneuver check or Escape Artist check, you can spend a swift action to make a trip attempt against that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip.

Feat.Name: Felling Smash
Feat.Description: You commit all your focus to a devastating blow, trying to crush your opponent to the ground.
Feat.Benefit: If you use the attack action to make a single melee attack at your highest base attack bonus while using Power Attack and you hit an opponent, you can spend a swift action to attempt a trip combat maneuver against that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Str 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, Power Attack

Feat.Name: Feral Combat Training
Feat.Description: You were taught a style of martial arts that relies on the natural weapons from your racial ability or class feature.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one of your natural weapons. While using the selected natural weapon, you can apply the effects of feats that have Improved Unarmed Strike as a prerequisite, as well as effects that augment an unarmed strike.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Weapon Focus with selected natural weapon.

Feat.Name: Field Repair
Feat.Description: You can repair your broken weapon or armor to serviceability even without the benefits of artisan tools.
Feat.Benefit: If you are trained in a Craft skill appropriate to a broken item, you can repair that item with no raw material cost and no penalty on your Craft skill check for using improvised tools. If you spend a day, the item regains 1 hit point plus one-quarter of
Feat.Prereq: Craft 4 ranks.

Feat.Name: Final Embrace
Feat.Description: Your coils are particularly deadly, allowing you to constrict opponents of your size or smaller.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the constrict and grab special attacks. Your constrict attack deals damage equal to your unarmed strike or primary natural weapon melee attack. Further, you can grab and constrict opponents up to your size.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Int 3; naga, serpentfolk, or creature that has the constrict special attack; base attack bonus +3.

Feat.Name: Final Embrace Horror
Feat.Description: Your constricting attack has become stronger and more lethal.
Feat.Benefit: A creature that takes damage from your constrict attack is also shaken until the start of your next turn.
Feat.Prereq: Str 15, Int 3; naga, serpentfolk, or creature that has the constrict special attack; Ability Focus (constrict); Final Embrace; base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Final Embrace Master
Feat.Description: Few creatures can survive the crushing horror of your Final Embrace.
Feat.Benefit: Double the number of damage dice for your constrict special attack.
Feat.Prereq: Str 17, Int 3; naga, serpentfolk, or creature that has the constrict special attack; Ability Focus (constrict); Final Embrace; Final Embrace Horror; base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Flanking Foil
Feat.Description: Fighting multiple foes is easy for you.

Feat.Name: Fortified Armor Training
Feat.Description: You have learned to let your armor bear the brunt of the worst attacks.
Feat.Benefit: If an opponent scores a critical hit against you, you can turn the critical hit into a normal hit. If you do, either your armor or your shield gains the broken condition (your choice).
Feat.Prereq: Proficient with armor or shield.

Feat.Name: Furious Finish
Feat.Description: You channel all of your rage into one massive blow to crush your enemy.
Feat.Benefit: While raging, when you use the Vital Strike feat, you can choose not to roll your damage dice and instead deal damage equal to the maximum roll possible on those damage dice. If you do, your rage immediately ends, and you are fatigued (even if you would n
Feat.Prereq: Rage class feature, Vital Strike, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Gory Finish
Feat.Description: By drawing upon wells of savagery, you can slay your foe in creative and horrifyingly gruesome manners, intimidating nearby foes.

Feat.Prereq: Dazzling Display, Weapon Focus.

Feat.Name: Greater Channel Smite
Feat.Description: You empower your weapon with the might of your deity, which you discharge as you strike your foes.
Feat.Benefit: Before making any melee attacks on your turn, you can use a swift action to expend one daily use of your channel energy class feature. The dice from your channel energy feature form a pool of damage dice you can access to further damage creatures normally
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy class feature, Channel Smite, base attack bonus +8.

Feat.Name: Greater Rending Fury
Feat.Description: When your claws latch on to an opponent, the effect is bloody and horrific.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you rend an opponent, you deal 1d6 bleed damage to that opponent. This is an addition to the effects of the rend.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Rending Fury, Rending Fury, base attack bonus +12, rend special attack.

Feat.Name: Greater Snap Shot
Feat.Description: You can prey on any gap in your foe's guard with impunity, and with even greater range.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you make an attack of opportunity using a ranged weapon and hit, you gain a +2 bonus on the damage roll and a +2 bonus on rolls to confirm a critical hit with that attack. These bonuses increase to +4 when you have base attack bonus +16, and to +
Feat.Prereq: Dex 17, Improved Snap Shot, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Snap Shot, base attack bonus +12.

Feat.Description: You can use a whip to make combat maneuvers with ease.

Feat.Name: Guided Hand
Feat.Description: Your deity blesses any strike you make with that deity's favored weapon.
Feat.Benefit: With your deity's favored weapon, you can use your Wisdom modifier instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier on attack rolls.
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy class feature, Channel Smite, proficiency with your deity's favored weapon.

Feat.Name: Gunsmithing
Feat.Description: You know the secrets of repairing and restoring firearms.
Feat.Benefit: If you have access to a gunsmith's kit, you can create and restore firearms, craft bullets, and mix black powder for all types of firearms. You do not need to make a Craft check to create firearms and ammunition or to restore firearms. Crafting Firearms:

Feat.Name: Hammer the Gap
Feat.Description: You repeatedly strike the same location, causing increasing amounts of damage.
Feat.Benefit: When you take a full-attack action, each consecutive hit against the same opponent deals extra damage equal to the number of previous consecutive hits you have made against that opponent this turn. This damage is multiplied on a critical hit.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Harmonic Sage
Feat.Description: Your thorough understanding of acoustics in artificial surroundings allows you to improve the power of your bardic performance.

Feat.Prereq: Bardic performance class feature, Knowledge (engineering) 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Haunted Gnome
Feat.Description: You use your gnome magic to take on an eerie illusory appearance.

Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, gnome magic racial trait, Knowledge (arcana) 1 rank.

Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, gnome magic racial trait, Haunted Gnome, Knowledge (arcana) 3 ranks.

Feat.Description: Your disturbing glamer expands to make your exact location hard to pinpoint.

Feat.Name: Hero's Display
Feat.Description: With a dramatic flourish you display your weapons to the crowd. Onlookers are elated, and your enemies are demoralized.
Feat.Benefit: When you spend a swift action to make a performance combat check, you present the weapon in which you have Weapon Focus in a triumphant display. You gain a +2 bonus on the performance combat check and make an Intimidate check to demoralize all foes within
Feat.Prereq: Dazzling Display, Weapon Focus, and proficiency with the selected weapon.

Feat.Name: Hex Strike
Feat.Description: Chanting and cursing, you put a hex on your enemy as part of your unarmed strike.
Feat.Benefit: When you gain this feat, choose one hex that you can use to affect no more than one opponent. If you make a successful unarmed strike against an opponent, in addition to dealing your unarmed strike damage, you can use a swift action to deliver the effects

Feat.Name: Horse Master
Feat.Description: You blend horsemanship skills from disparate traditions into a seamless mounted combat technique.
Feat.Benefit: Use your character level to determine your effective druid level for determining the powers and abilities of your mount.
Feat.Prereq: Expert trainer class feature (Advanced Player's Guide 33), Ride 6 ranks.

Feat.Name: Impact Critical Shot
Feat.Description: With a series of ranged attacks, you bring your foes to their knees or force them to move.

Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Point-Blank Shot, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Impaling Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hits can skewer your foes.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with the selected piercing melee weapon, you can impale your opponent on your weapon. While your opponent is impaled in this way, each time he starts his turn, you deal damage equal to your weapon's damage dice plus the e
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, Weapon Specialization with selected piercing melee weapon, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Description: After much practice, you and an ally have become adept at fighting in close proximity to one another.
Feat.Benefit: While you are adjacent to an ally who is flanked and also has this feat, you can spend a swift action to gain a +2 bonus to AC against all flankers until the start of your next turn.
Feat.Prereq: Back to Back, Perception 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Improved Charging Hurler
Feat.Description: Every muscle in your body adds its force to your thrown weapons.
Feat.Benefit: When you use Charging Hurler, your target can be at any range up to your weapon's maximum range. If your target is within 30 feet, you gain a +2 bonus on damage rolls.
Feat.Prereq: Charging Hurler, Point-Blank Shot.

Feat.Name: Improved Cleaving Finish
Feat.Description: You can cut down many opponents in a single strike.
Feat.Benefit: You can use Cleaving Finish any number of times per round.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Cleaving Finish, Great Cleave, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Cleave, Cleaving Finish, Great Cleave, Power Attack

Feat.Name: Improved Devastating Strike
Feat.Description: The fury and power channeled through your attack is enough to kill a lesser being outright.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use Vital Strike, Improved Vital Strike, or Greater Vital Strike, you gain a bonus on attack rolls to confirm a critical hit equal to the bonus on damage rolls you gain from Devastating Strike.
Feat.Prereq: Devastating Strike, Vital Strike, base attack bonus +13.

Feat.Name: Improved Feint Partner
Feat.Description: Knowledge of your companions' tricks and techniques allow you to take even greater advantage of your allies' feints.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an ally who also has this feat successfully feints against an opponent, that opponent provokes an attack of opportunity from you.
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank, Combat Reflexes, Feint Partner, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Improved Impaling Critical
Feat.Description: When you impale a target, you hinder its movement and can cause severe bleeding.

Feat.Prereq: Impaling Critical, Critical Focus, Weapon Specialization with selected piercing melee weapon, base attack bonus +13.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Impaling Critical, Critical Focus, Weapon Specialization

Feat.Name: Improved Rending Fury
Feat.Description: Honing the deadliness of your claws, you are a living hurricane of rending fury.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you successfully rend an opponent, you deal an extra 1d6 damage. This damage is not multiplied on a critical hit.
Feat.Prereq: Rending Fury, base attack bonus +9, rend special attack.

Feat.Name: Improved Snap Shot
Feat.Description: You can take advantage of your opponent's vulnerabilities from a greater distance, and without exposing yourself.
Feat.Benefit: You threaten an additional 10 feet with Snap Shot.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Snap Shot, Weapon Focus, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Improved Stalwart
Feat.Description: You can roll with the punches while simultaneously striking back at your attackers.
Feat.Benefit: Double the DR you gain from Stalwart, to a maximum of DR 10/-.
Feat.Prereq: Diehard, Endurance, Stalwart, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Improved Two-Weapon Feint
Feat.Description: Your primary weapon keeps a foe off balance, allowing you to slip your off-hand weapon past his defenses.
Feat.Benefit: While using Two-Weapon Fighting to make melee attacks, you can forgo your first primary-hand melee attack to make a Bluff check to feint an opponent. If you successfully feint, that opponent is denied his Dexterity bonus to AC until the end of your turn.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 17, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Description: You are able to entangle opponents with the coils of your whip.

Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus (whip), Whip Mastery, base attack bonus +5.

Feat.Name: Instant Judgment
Feat.Description: Your hastiest condemnations can have power.
Feat.Benefit: You can spend an immediate action to pronounce a judgment or change an active judgment.
Feat.Prereq: Second judgment class feature.

Feat.Name: Intimidating Bane
Feat.Description: Your bane weapon strikes fear into your enemies.

Feat.Prereq: Bane class feature, Dazzling Display, Weapon Focus, character level 8th.

Feat.Name: Janni Rush
Feat.Description: When you leap to the attack, your blows are like bolts from on high.
Feat.Benefit: While using Janni Style, you are always considered to have a running start when jumping. Further, if you jump as part of a charge and make an unarmed strike against the designated opponent, a hit allows you to roll the unarmed strike's damage dice twice a
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Janni Style, Janni Tempest, Acrobatics 8 ranks, Perform (dance) 8 ranks.

Feat.Name: Janni Style
Feat.Description: Your whirling fighting technique makes you difficult to hit.
Feat.Benefit: While using this style, you take only a -1 penalty to AC for charging. Further, opponents that flank you gain only a +1 bonus on attack rolls against you.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 3 ranks, Perform (dance) 3 ranks.

Feat.Name: Janni Tempest
Feat.Description: Your gale of attacks easily throws your opponents off balance.
Feat.Benefit: While you are using the Janni Style feat, whenever you make an unarmed attack and hit an opponent, you gain a +4 bonus on checks made to bull rush or trip that opponent, as long as the combat maneuver is your next attack by the end of your turn. You do no
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Janni Style, Acrobatics 5 ranks, Perform (dance) 5 ranks.

Feat.Benefit: When you make a successful Stunning Fist attempt against an opponent that is grappled, helpless, or stunned, instead of imparting any other Stunning Fist effect, you can cripple that opponent's mouth, dealing normal unarmed strike damage and 1d4 points of

Feat.Description: You have read the texts of the perfect way, and know how identify to your enemies' weak spot.

Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Kirin Style, Improved Unarmed Strike, Knowledge (arcana) 9 ranks, Knowledge (dungeoneering, local, nature, planes, or religion) 3 ranks.

Feat.Description: Your study and your grace allows you to exploit your enemies' weaknesses.

Feat.Name: Knockout Artist
Feat.Description: You can throw devastating knockout punches.
Feat.Benefit: When you use your unarmed strike to deal nonlethal damage and sneak attack damage to an opponent denied his Dexterity bonus to AC, you gain a +1 bonus on the damage roll per each sneak attack damage die you roll.
Feat.Prereq: Sneak attack class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Landing Roll
Feat.Description: You have learned the technique of rolling safely away when an enemy trips you.
Feat.Benefit: If you are tripped, you can spend an immediate action to move 5 feet without provoking an attack of opportunity. This does not count as taking a 5-foot step. You fall prone after this movement.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility.

Feat.Name: Leaping Shot Deed
Feat.Description: You leap through the air, guns blazing.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Acrobatics checks made to jump. As a full-round action, you can move up to your speed and make firearm attacks at your highest base attack bonus with each loaded firearm you are wielding. You can make these attacks at any point duri
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, grit class feature or Amateur Gunslinger feat, Dodge, Mobility, base attack bonus +4.

Feat.Name: Mantis Style
Feat.Description: You have learned to target vital areas with crippling accuracy.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional Stunning Fist attempt per day. While using this style, you gain a +2 bonus to the DC of effects you deliver with your Stunning Fist.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist, Heal 3 ranks.

Feat.Name: Mantis Torment
Feat.Description: Your knowledge of the mysteries of anatomy allows you to cause debilitating pain with a simple touch.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional Stunning Fist attempt per day. While using Mantis Style, you make an unarmed attack that expends two daily attempts of your Stunning Fist. If you hit, your opponent must succeed at a saving throw against your Stunning Fist or becom
Feat.Prereq: Heal 9 ranks, Improved Unarmed Strike, Mantis Style, Mantis Wisdom, Stunning Fist.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Unarmed Strike, Mantis Style, Mantis Wisdom, Stunning Fist

Feat.Name: Mantis Wisdom
Feat.Description: Your knowledge of vital areas allows you to land debilitating strikes with precision.
Feat.Benefit: Treat half your levels in classes other than monk as monk levels for determining effects you can apply to a target of your Stunning Fist per the Stunning Fist monk class feature. You can also use a standard action and a successful melee touch attack to re
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Mantis Style, Stunning Fist, Heal 6 ranks.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Unarmed Strike, Mantis Style, Stunning Fist

Feat.Name: Marid Coldsnap
Feat.Description: You can summon a torrent of water to blast your enemies, chilling them to the bone.
Feat.Benefit: While using Marid Style, as a standard action, you can spend two Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempts to unleash a 30-foot line of frigid water. Creatures caught in the line take your unarmed strike damage plus the cold damage from your E
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, Wis 17, Elemental Fist**, Marid Spirit, Marid Style, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +13 or monk level 11th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Elemental Fist, Marid Spirit, Marid Style, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Marid Spirit
Feat.Description: You can manipulate cold energy to protect yourself and freeze your foes.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While using Marid Style, you gain cold resistance equal to your base attack bonus, or monk level plus base attack bonus gained from levels in classes other than monk, wh
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, Wis 15, Elemental Fist**, Marid Style, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +11 or monk level 9th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Elemental Fist, Marid Style, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Marid Style
Feat.Description: You conjure tendrils of icy water to strike your enemies from a distance.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While using this style and Elemental Fist to deal cold damage, you gain a bonus on cold damage rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier, and your reach with your unarmed stri
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Wis 15, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 5th.

Feat.Name: Master Combat Performer
Feat.Description: You are a master of the techniques and weapons of the arena and the stage.
Feat.Benefit: You can make performance combat checks as a free action. You are proficient in all weapons with the performance special quality.
Feat.Prereq: Performing Combatant or at least three performance feats, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Master Siege Engineer
Feat.Description: You are significantly faster at loading a siege engine, as well as a better shot.
Feat.Benefit: If you are the crew lead on a siege engine, your crew can use move actions to load a siege engine. When you spend actions to aim a siege engine, you and your crew can use move actions instead of full-round actions to aim the siege engine (page 160).
Feat.Prereq: Siege Weapon Engineer, Knowledge (engineering) 10 ranks.

Feat.Name: Masterful Display
Feat.Description: You craft a special victory performance that causes the crowd to go wild.
Feat.Benefit: Choose the effects of any two performance feats you have. When you make a performance combat check, you gain the benefits of those two feats, but you only gain a +2 bonus on the performance combat check.
Feat.Prereq: Dazzling Display, any two performance feats.

Feat.Name: Maximized Spellstrike
Feat.Description: You deal brutal damage against opponents caught unawares.
Feat.Benefit: When you make a melee attack and successfully use your spellstrike ability against an opponent denied his Dexterity bonus to AC, you can spend 3 points from your arcane pool to maximize the spell delivered through your spellstrike as if using the Maximize
Feat.Prereq: Maximized magic magus arcana, weapon expertise class feature or Quick Draw.

Feat.Name: Menacing Bane
Feat.Description: You are deadly when you team up with allies against a single foe.
Feat.Benefit: You can use your bane class feature to imbue a melee weapon with the menacing special weapon ability (Advanced Player's Guide 288) instead of bane. You can spend a swift action to switch between the two special weapon abilities. Doing so otherwise works a
Feat.Prereq: Bane class feature.

Feat.Name: Merciful Bane
Feat.Description: You can use your bane ability to inf lict nonlethal damage.
Feat.Benefit: While a weapon you wield is under the effect of your bane class feature, you can spend a swift action to switch between dealing lethal or nonlethal damage with bane. While your bane effect allows you to deal nonlethal damage in this way, you take no penal
Feat.Prereq: Bane class feature.

Feat.Name: Mocking Dance
Feat.Description: You do a little dance that mocks your foe and entertains the crowd.
Feat.Benefit: When you spend a swift action to make a performance combat check, before making that check you can either move 5 feet without provoking attacks of opportunity, or you can move your speed and provoke attacks of opportunity. You cannot end this move in a sp
Feat.Prereq: Acrobatics 4 ranks or Perform (dance) 4 ranks.

Feat.Name: Monastic Legacy
Feat.Description: Your formal unarmed training continues to bolster your training in other areas.
Feat.Benefit: Add half the levels you have in classes other than monk to your monk level to determine your effective monk level for your base unarmed strike damage. This feat does not make levels in classes other than monk count toward any other monk class features.
Feat.Prereq: Still mind class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Monkey Moves
Feat.Description: You scramble around your foes, moving and striking in an erratic fashion.
Feat.Benefit: While using Monkey Style, you gain a Wisdom bonus on Climb checks. You can also can climb and crawl at half your speed; you can take a 5-foot step by jumping, crawling, or climbing; and you retain your Dexterity bonus to AC while climbing. Further, while
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, Monkey Style, Acrobatics 8 ranks, Climb 8 ranks.

Feat.Name: Monkey Shine
Feat.Description: You combine acrobatics and opportunity to devastating effect against your opponent.
Feat.Benefit: While using Monkey Style, if you successfully deliver a Stunning Fist attempt, in addition to the normal effect of Stunning Fist, you can spend a free action to enter a square adjacent to you that is within your opponent's space. This movement does not pr
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, Monkey Moves, Monkey Style, Stunning Fist, Acrobatics 11 ranks, Climb 11 ranks.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Unarmed Strike, Monkey Moves, Monkey Style, Stunning Fist

Feat.Name: Monkey Style
Feat.Description: Your unarmed fighting style is nimble and unpredictable, full of ground rolls and short leaps.
Feat.Benefit: You add your Wisdom bonus on Acrobatics checks. While using this style, you take no penalty on melee attack rolls or to AC while prone. Further, you can crawl and stand up from lying prone without provoking attacks of opportunity, and you can stand up as
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 5 ranks, Climb 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Moonlight Stalker
Feat.Description: You are adept at using shadows to conceal your attacks.
Feat.Benefit: While you have concealment from an opponent, you gain a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls against that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Blind-Fight, Combat Expertise, Bluff 3 ranks, darkvision or low-light vision racial trait.

Feat.Name: Moonlight Stalker Feint
Feat.Description: You strike through the shadows so quickly that your opponent can barely react to your attacks.
Feat.Benefit: Once per round, against an opponent from whom you have concealment, you can spend a swift action to make a Bluff check to feint.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Blind-Fight, Combat Expertise, Moonlight Stalker, Bluff 6 ranks, darkvision or lowlight vision racial trait.

Feat.Name: Moonlight Stalker Master
Feat.Description: You leave your opponents swinging at shadows while you slide elusively through the darkness.
Feat.Benefit: While you have concealment, your opponents' miss chance against you increases by 10%. If an opponent misses you due to your concealment, you can spend an immediate action to move 5 feet, this movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity and does not c
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Blind-Fight, Combat Expertise, Improved Feint, Moonlight Stalker, Moonlight Stalker Feint, Bluff 9 ranks, darkvision or low-light vision racial trait.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Blind-Fight, Combat Expertise, Improved Feint, Moonlight Stalker, Moonlight Stalker Feint

Feat.Name: Murderer's Circle
Feat.Description: After savaging your foe, you circle like a hunter ready for the kill.
Feat.Benefit: When you spend a swift action to make a performance combat check after scoring a critical hit or performing a combat maneuver, and you are adjacent to the target of the critical hit or combat maneuver, you can move to any other space that is adjacent to t
Feat.Prereq: Dodge, Acrobatics 4 ranks.

Feat.Name: Neckbreaker
Feat.Description: With a quick jerk, you snap an enemy's neck.
Feat.Benefit: If you have an opponent your size or smaller helpless or pinned, after you initiate or maintain a grapple, you can make a Stunning Fist attempt at a -5 penalty on the attack roll. If you succeed, you wrench that opponent's neck, dealing 2d6 Strength or De
Feat.Prereq: Bonebreaker, Greater Grapple, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, Jawbreaker, Stunning Fist, Heal 12 ranks.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Bonebreaker, Greater Grapple, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, Jawbreaker, Stunning Fist

Feat.Name: Net Adept
Feat.Description: You have trained to use the net as a melee weapon.
Feat.Benefit: You can treat a net as a one-handed melee reach weapon with a 10-foot reach. Further, you take no penalty on melee attack rolls for using an unfolded net, and you can use one full-round action or two move actions to fold a net.
Feat.Prereq: Exotic Weapon Proficiency (net), base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Net and Trident
Feat.Description: Your skill with lighter weapons allows you to wield one alongside your net.
Feat.Benefit: You can treat a net as a one-handed ranged weapon, allowing you to wield a light or one-handed melee weapon and still make ranged attacks with your net. When you use your light or one-handed melee weapon to attack an entangled opponent, you gain a +2 bonu
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Exotic Weapon Proficiency (net), Net Adept, Two-Weapon Fighting.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Exotic Weapon Proficiency (net), Net Adept, Two-Weapon Fighting

Feat.Name: Net Maneuvering
Feat.Description: With sweeping movements and brute force, you can use your net to put foes at a disadvantage.
Feat.Benefit: In melee, you can use a net to trip or disarm opponents instead of entangling them. You gain a +2 bonus on disarm checks made to use a net in this way. Further, if you have an opponent entangled in your net, you can attempt to drag or reposition that oppo
Feat.Prereq: Exotic Weapon Proficiency (net), Net Adept, base attack bonus +3.

Feat.Name: Net Trickery
Feat.Description: You have become very proficient at using your net to hinder your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: In place of one of your melee attacks, you can use your net to attempt a dirty trick combat maneuver to blind an opponent (Advance Player's Guide 320). If you have an opponent entangled in your net, you can attempt to trip that opponent as long as he is w
Feat.Prereq: Exotic Weapon Proficiency (net), Net Adept, Net Maneuvering, base attack bonus +6.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Exotic Weapon Proficiency (net), Net Adept, Net Maneuvering

Feat.Name: Passing Trick
Feat.Description: Slipping past a foe gives you the chance to feint.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you make a successful Acrobatics check to move through an opponent's space, you can spend a swift action to make a Bluff check against that opponent to feint in combat.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Dodge, Improved Feint, Mobility, size Small or smaller.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Expertise, Dodge, Improved Feint, Mobility

Feat.Name: Performance Weapon Mastery
Feat.Description: You wield all your weapons with the flair of a performer.
Feat.Benefit: You treat all weapons you are proficient in as if they had the performance weapon quality (page 144).

Feat.Name: Performing Combatant
Feat.Description: You treat every combat as a performance, bringing flare and showmanship.
Feat.Benefit: You can make performance combat checks in any combat. When making a performance check outside of performance combat, you can pick a single performance feat to use. You automatically gain any bonus on the performance combat check the feat grants, and then
Feat.Prereq: Dazzling Display, any one performance feat.

Feat.Name: Pin Down
Feat.Description: You easily block enemy escapes.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an opponent you threaten takes a 5-foot step or uses the withdraw action, that opponent provokes an attack of opportunity from you. If the attack hits, you deal no damage, but the targeted creature is prevented from making the move action that gr
Feat.Prereq: Combat Reflexes, fighter level 11th.

Feat.Name: Pinning Knockout
Feat.Description: An opponent you have pinned is easy for you to knock out.
Feat.Benefit: While you have an opponent pinned, when you succeed at a grapple combat maneuver check to deal an opponent nonlethal damage using an unarmed strike or a light or one-handed weapon, double your damage result. Any creature that is immune to critical hits is
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Greater Grapple, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 9th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Greater Grapple, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Pinning Rend
Feat.Description: You tear flesh when you damage an opponent that you have pinned.
Feat.Benefit: While you have an opponent pinned, when you succeed at a grapple combat maneuver check to deal an opponent damage using an unarmed strike or a light or one-handed weapon, that opponent also takes bleed damage equal to your unarmed strike or weapon damage
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Greater Grapple, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 9th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Greater Grapple, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Pinpoint Poisoner
Feat.Description: You deftly use specially prepared needles to apply poison for maximum effect.
Feat.Benefit: When you use Adder Strike, you can instead poison up to two blowgun darts that you can then use to strike your opponent in melee. (Drawing such darts is a free action.) While holding these darts, you can spend a standard action to attack with one or a ful
Feat.Prereq: Poison use class feature, Craft (alchemy) 6 ranks, Adder Strike, Improved Unarmed Strike, Two-Weapon Fighting or flurry of blows class feature.

Feat.Name: Planar Wild Shape
Feat.Description: You can infuse your wild shape with planar strength.
Feat.Benefit: When you use wild shape to take the form of an animal, you can expend an additional daily use of your wild shape class feature to add the celestial template or fiendish template to your animal form. (Good druids must use the celestial template, while evil
Feat.Prereq: Wild shape class feature, Knowledge (planes) 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Prone Shooter
Feat.Description: While prone, you use the ground to stabilize your aim while using a crossbow or firearm.
Feat.Benefit: If you have been prone since the end of your last turn, you can ignore the penalty the prone condition imposes on ranged attack rolls you make using a crossbow or firearm with which you have Weapon Focus.
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus (crossbow or firearm), base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Prone Slinger
Feat.Description: Your sideways sling release allows you to launch bullets and stones even while prone.
Feat.Benefit: While prone, you can use a sling to make ranged attacks.

Feat.Name: Quick Bull Rush
Feat.Description: You can barrel into your opponent and follow this with an attack.
Feat.Benefit: On your turn, you can perform a single bull rush combat maneuver in place of one of your melee attacks. You must choose the melee attack with the highest base attack bonus to make the bull rush.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Quick Dirty Trick
Feat.Description: You can perpetrate a dirty trick and deliver an attack before your opponent is the wiser.
Feat.Benefit: On your turn, you can perform a single dirty trick combat maneuver (Advanced Players Guide 320) in place of one of your melee attacks. You must choose the melee attack with the highest base attack bonus to make the dirty trick combat maneuver.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Dirty Trick, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Quick Drag
Feat.Description: You drag your enemy and deliver a punishing blow.
Feat.Benefit: On your turn, you can perform a single drag combat maneuver (Advanced Players Guide 320) in place of one of your melee attacks. You must choose the melee attack with the highest base attack bonus to make the drag.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Improved Drag, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Quick Reposition
Feat.Description: Your opponent becomes an unwitting dance partner, following your lead while you fight.
Feat.Benefit: On your turn, you can perform a single reposition combat maneuver (Advanced Players Guide 320) in place of one of your melee attacks. You must choose the melee attack with the highest base attack bonus to make the reposition.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Reposition, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Quick Steal
Feat.Description: You are adept at relieving foes of their belongings even while you strike.
Feat.Benefit: On your turn, you can perform a single steal combat maneuver (Advanced Players Guide 320) in place of one of your melee attacks. You must choose the melee attack with the highest base attack bonus to make the steal.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Steal, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Raging Brutality
Feat.Description: You expend some of your rage to strike your opponents with a more powerful weapon blow.
Feat.Benefit: While raging and using Power Attack, you can spend 3 additional rounds of your rage as a swift action to add your Constitution bonus on damage rolls for melee attacks or thrown weapon attacks you make on your turn. If you are using the weapon two-handed,
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, rage class feature, Power Attack, base attack bonus +12.

Feat.Name: Raging Deathblow
Feat.Description: Every killing blow gives you a surge of vitality, further fueling your rage.
Feat.Benefit: While raging, whenever your attack reduces your opponent to -1 or fewer hit points, you gain 1 extra round of rage for that day. If that attack was a critical hit, you gain 1 additional extra round of rage for that day. Whenever you rest to renew your tot
Feat.Prereq: Greater rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Raging Hurler
Feat.Description: An opponent can do little to evade your wrathful pitching of weapons and objects.
Feat.Benefit: While raging, you can throw a two-handed weapon as a standard action, and you double the range increment for weapons you throw. If you also have the Quick Draw feat, you can throw two-handed weapons at your full normal rate of attacks. Further, you can pi
Feat.Prereq: Rage class feature, Throw Anything.

Feat.Name: Raging Throw
Feat.Description: You expend some of your rage to throw one opponent at another.
Feat.Benefit: While raging, when you attempt a bull rush combat maneuver, you can spend 1 additional round of your rage as a swift action to add your Constitution bonus on your combat maneuver check to the bull rush. Further, if you bull rush an opponent into a square
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Con 13, rage class feature, Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Rapid Grappler
Feat.Description: You are a quick hand at grappling.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use Greater Grapple to successfully maintain a grapple as a move action, you can then spend a swift action to make a grapple combat maneuver check.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Greater Grapple, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 9th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Greater Grapple, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Rapid Reload
Feat.Description: Choose a type of crossbow (hand, light, heavy) or a single type of one-handed or two-handed firearm that you are proficient with. You can reload such a weapon quickly.
Feat.Benefit: The time required for you to reload your chosen type of weapon is reduced to a free action (for a hand or light crossbow), a move action (for heavy crossbow or onehanded firearm), or a standard action (two-handed firearm). Reloading a crossbow or firearm
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Proficiency (crossbow type chosen) or Exotic Weapon Proficiency (firearm).

Feat.Name: Rebounding Leap
Feat.Description: Your riding and lancing expertise allows you to enter and leave the saddle with great speed.
Feat.Benefit: When you succeed at the Acrobatics check to jump as part of your leaping lance class feature, you can remount your steed as a swift action.
Feat.Prereq: Leaping lance class feature, Acrobatics 5 ranks, Ride 11 ranks.

Feat.Name: Rebuffing Reduction
Feat.Description: Your damage reduction can turn the force of blows back on your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an opponent that is adjacent to you fails to penetrate your DR with a melee attack, you can spend an immediate action to attempt a bull rush combat maneuver against that opponent. If you succeed, you cannot move with the opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, damage reduction, Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Rending Fury
Feat.Description: You easily tear your enemies limb from limb with your natural attacks.
Feat.Benefit: You deal rend damage if you hit with half the normal natural attacks your rend requires. For example, a troll that has this feat can rend when it hits with one claw attack, while a girallon that has this feat must hit one target with two claw attacks to r
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +6, rend special attack.

Feat.Name: Revelation Strike
Feat.Description: Your unarmed strike brings a revelation down upon your foe.
