Feat.Benefit: When you gain this feat, choose one revelation that you can use to affect no more than one opponent. If you make a successful unarmed strike against an opponent, in addition to dealing your unarmed strike damage, you can use a swift action to deliver the
Feat.Prereq: Revelation class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Rhetorical Flourish
Feat.Description: You rapidly change topics and employ confusing rhetoric to distract people from your true intent.
Feat.Benefit: When using the Diplomacy skill to make a request or change a creature's attitude, you can use verbal misdirection. To do so, make a Bluff check against that creature. If you succeed, you gain a +4 bonus on your next Diplomacy check against that creature i
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Persuasive.

Feat.Name: Ricochet Shot Deed
Feat.Description: You can ricochet a firearm shot off the wall and still hit your target.
Feat.Benefit: You can fire a shot at a wall or piece of solid terrain, and have it ricochet off. When you do, use the square immediately in front of the wall or piece of solid terrain to determine line of sight to a target, and this square is considered the new origin
Feat.Prereq: Grit class feature or Amateur Gunslinger feat, Blind-Fight.

Feat.Name: Righteous Healing
Feat.Description: Your healing spells are more potent when you have a judgment active.
Feat.Benefit: If you cast a cure spell while you have a judgment active, each target regains 1 extra hit point from the cure spell + 1 hit point per three inquisitor levels you possess.
Feat.Prereq: Judgment class feature.

Feat.Name: Sap Adept
Feat.Description: You know just where to hit to knock the sense out of your foe.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use a bludgeoning weapon to deal nonlethal sneak attack damage, you gain a bonus on your damage roll equal to twice the number of sneak attack damage dice you rolled.
Feat.Prereq: Sneak attack +1d6.

Feat.Name: Sap Master
Feat.Description: You knock the sense out of foes with a well-timed surprise attack.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use a bludgeoning weapon to deal nonlethal sneak attack damage to a flat-footed opponent, roll your sneak attack dice twice, totaling the results as your nonlethal sneak attack damage for that attack.
Feat.Prereq: Sneak attack +3d6, Sap Adept.

Feat.Name: Savage Display
Feat.Description: With your victory and a roar, you push yourself on with increased savagery.
Feat.Benefit: When you spend a swift action to make a performance combat check, you gain a +2 bonus on your performance combat check and gain a +1d6 bonus on damage rolls until the end of your next turn. This extra damage is not precision damage.
Feat.Prereq: Dazzling Display.

Feat.Name: School Strike
Feat.Description: You focus the secrets of your school of wizardry into your unarmed strike.
Feat.Benefit: When you gain this feat, choose one arcane school power that you can use to affect no more than one opponent. If you make a successful unarmed strike against an opponent, in addition to dealing your unarmed strike damage, you can use a swift action to del
Feat.Prereq: Wizard school class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Sea Legs
Feat.Description: You have a sailor's instincts for moving about while aboard seagoing vessels.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Acrobatics, Climb, and Swim checks.
Feat.Prereq: Profession (sailor) 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Secret Stash Deed
Feat.Description: You are so skilled at stashing small packets of firearm ammunition and black powder on your person that you sometimes surprise yourself when you find them.
Feat.Benefit: Spend 1 grit point while in combat to recover either 1 bullet and 1 dose of black powder or 1 alchemical cartridge from a hidden stash on your person that you had, until now, forgotten about. If the bullet and black powder or the alchemical cartridges are
Feat.Prereq: Grit class feature or Amateur Gunslinger feat, Sleight of Hand 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Seize the Moment
Feat.Description: You and your allies are poised to pounce whenever one of you scores a telling blow.
Feat.Benefit: When an ally who also has this feat confirms a critical hit against an opponent that you also threaten, you can make an attack of opportunity against that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Combat Reflexes, Improved Critical.

Feat.Name: Shaitan Earthblast
Feat.Description: With a forceful stomp you release a blast of acid from the earth to burn your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: While using the Shaitan Style feat, as a standard action, you can spend two Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempts to unleash a 20-foot column of acid that has a 5-foot radius and erupts from a point of origin within 30 feet of you. Creatur
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, Wis 17, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, Shaitan Skin, Shaitan Style, base attack bonus +13 or monk level 11th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Elemental Fist, Improved Unarmed Strike, Shaitan Skin, Shaitan Style

Feat.Name: Shaitan Skin
Feat.Description: You can manipulate acid to shield yourself and disable your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While using the Shaitan Style feat, you gain acid resistance equal to your base attack bonus, or your monk level plus BAB gained from levels in classes other than monk,
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, Wis 15, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, Shaitan Style, base attack bonus +11 or monk level 9th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Elemental Fist, Improved Unarmed Strike, Shaitan Style

Feat.Name: Shaitan Style
Feat.Description: You strike with the caustic forces from within the earth.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist (Advanced Player's Guide 158) attempt per day. While using the Shaitan Style and Elemental Fist feats to deal acid damage, you gain a bonus on acid damage rolls equal to your Wisdom bonus. Further, if your Elemental
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Wis 15, Elemental Fist**, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 5th.

Feat.Name: Shake It Off
Feat.Description: You support your allies and help them recover from crippling effects.
Feat.Benefit: When you are adjacent to one or more allies who also have this feat, you gain a +1 bonus on saving throws per such ally (maximum +4).

Feat.Name: Shapeshifter Foil
Feat.Description: Your command of shapeshifting magic can disrupt similar effects in others.
Feat.Benefit: A creature you deal damage to has difficulty using or maintaining polymorph effects until the end your next turn. To use a polymorph effect it must make a concentration check (DC 15 + twice the level of the effect). If you deal damage to an opponent under
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (arcana) 5 ranks or Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks, ability to use any polymorph effect.

Feat.Name: Shapeshifting Hunter
Feat.Description: You blend your knowledge of foes and your shapeshifting abilities together.
Feat.Benefit: Your levels of druid stack with your ranger levels for determining when you select your next favored enemy. Also, your ranger levels stack with your druid levels in determining the number of times per day you can use your wild shape class feature, up to a
Feat.Prereq: Favored enemy class feature, wild shape class feature.

Feat.Name: Shared Judgment
Feat.Description: You extend the benefits of your judgment to an ally.
Feat.Benefit: You can pronounce a single judgment and extend its effects to one adjacent ally instead of pronouncing a second judgment. Similarly, once you have the third judgment class feature, you can pronounce a single judgment and extend its effects to two adjacent
Feat.Prereq: Second judgment class feature.

Feat.Name: Siege Commander
Feat.Description: Under your leadership, the time required to assemble and move a siege engine is greatly reduced.
Feat.Benefit: When you lead a siege engine assembly crew, you grant all of its members a +4 competence bonus on checks to assemble or move the weapon. You also halve the time required to assemble a siege engine.
Feat.Prereq: Craft (siege weapon) 5 ranks, Knowledge (engineering) 5 ranks or Profession (siege engineer) 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Siege Engineer
Feat.Description: You are proficient with all siege weaponry.
Feat.Benefit: You are considered to be proficient with all siege weapons. Also, when you are crew lead for a siege engine, you do not generate mishaps on the roll of a natural 1.
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (engineering) 5 ranks or Profession (siege engineer) 5 ranks, proficiency with one siege engine.

Feat.Name: Siege Gunner
Feat.Description: Aiming outsized siege weapons poses little difficulty for you.
Feat.Benefit: You take no size penalty for aiming a directfire siege weapon larger than yourself. If you operate an indirect-fire siege weapon and miss, you misdirect fire by 1 square per range increment.
Feat.Prereq: Siege Engineer, Profession (siege engineer) 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Signature Deed
Feat.Description: You are known for performing a particular deed, and can perform it with greater ease.
Feat.Benefit: Pick a deed that you have access to and that you must spend grit to perform. You can perform this deed for 1 fewer grit point (minimum 0). If the amount of grit needed to perform the deed is reduced to 0, you can perform this deed for the normal action co
Feat.Prereq: Grit class feature, gunslinger level 11th.

Feat.Name: Skilled Driver
Feat.Description: Choose a type a type of vehicle (either air, land, or water). You are more skilled when driving that vehicle.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +4 bonus on driving checks with your chosen vehicle.

Feat.Name: Slayer's Knack
Feat.Description: You know how to battle your favored enemies with such efficacy that any weapon you wield against them becomes more deadly.
Feat.Benefit: When you take this feat, choose one of your favored enemy types. Against enemies of that type, the threat range of any weapon you wield is doubled. This effect does not stack with any other effect that expands a weapon's threat range.
Feat.Prereq: Favored enemy class feature, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Sling Flail
Feat.Description: You can use your loaded sling to effectively strike at nearby foes.
Feat.Benefit: You can make melee attacks using your loaded sling, using that weapon's normal statistics but treating it as a flail. Using a sling in this way does not expend mundane ammunition, but magical or masterwork ammunition loses its special properties after a s
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus (sling), base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Snake Fang
Feat.Description: You can unleash attacks against an opponent that has dropped its guard.
Feat.Benefit: While using the Snake Style feat, when an opponent's attack misses you, you can make an unarmed strike against that opponent as an attack of opportunity. If this attack of opportunity hits, you can spend an immediate action to make another unarmed strike
Feat.Prereq: Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike, Snake Sidewind, Snake Style, Acrobatics 6 ranks, Sense Motive 9 ranks.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike, Snake Sidewind, Snake Style

Feat.Name: Snake Style
Feat.Description: You watch your foe's every movement and then punch through its defense.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Sense Motive checks, and you can deal piercing damage with your unarmed strikes. While using the Snake Style feat, when an opponent targets you with a melee or ranged attack, you can spend an immediate action to make a Sense Motive
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 1 rank, Sense Motive 3 ranks.

Feat.Name: Snap Shot
Feat.Description: With a ranged weapon, you can take advantage of any opening in your opponent's defenses.
Feat.Benefit: While wielding a ranged weapon with which you have Weapon Focus, you threaten squares within 5 feet of you. You can make attacks of opportunity with that ranged weapon. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity when making a ranged attack as an attack of
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Weapon Focus, base attack bonus +6.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Weapon Focus

Feat.Name: Snapping Turtle Clutch
Feat.Description: Your unarmed style allows you to turn your opponent's attack into an opportunity.
Feat.Benefit: While you are using the Snapping Turtle Style feat, the shield bonus the style grants to your AC applies to your CMD and touch AC. Whenever an opponent misses you with a melee attack while you are using the Snapping Turtle Style feat, you can use an immed
Feat.Prereq: Snapping Turtle Style, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +3 or monk level 3rd.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Snapping Turtle Style, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Snapping Turtle Shell
Feat.Description: Your guarding hand is almost magical in its skill at def lecting incoming blows.
Feat.Benefit: While you are using the Snapping Turtle Style feat, the shield bonus the style grants to your AC increases to +2, and your enemies take a -4 penalty on critical confirmation rolls against you.
Feat.Prereq: Snapping Turtle Clutch, Snapping Turtle Style, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +5 or monk level 5th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Snapping Turtle Clutch, Snapping Turtle Style, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Snapping Turtle Style
Feat.Description: Your deft unarmed style allows you to shield your body from harm.
Feat.Benefit: While using the Snapping Turtle Style feat with at least one hand free, you gain a +1 shield bonus to AC.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +1 or monk level 1st.

Feat.Name: Sneaking Precision
Feat.Description: Your knowledge of your enemies' vulnerable spots is especially punishing.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you successfully sneak attack an opponent for a second time on your turn, you can spend a swift action to apply the effects of one critical feat you know to that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Sneak attack class feature, Critical Focus, any critical feat, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Sorcerous Strike
Feat.Description: The power flowing through your veins also flows through your unarmed strike.
Feat.Benefit: When you gain this feat, you choose one bloodline power that you can use to affect a single opponent. If you make a successful unarmed strike against an opponent, in addition to dealing your unarmed strike damage, you can spend a swift action to deliver t
Feat.Prereq: Sorcerer bloodline class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Spell Bane
Feat.Description: While your bane weapon is active, creatures that your bane affects find it more difficult to resist your spells.
Feat.Benefit: While your bane class feature is affecting a creature type, the saving throw's DCs for your spells increase by +2 for creatures of that type.
Feat.Prereq: Bane class feature.

Feat.Name: Spinning Throw
Feat.Description: You whirl your foe around and then let go.
Feat.Benefit: On a successful unarmed trip combat maneuver against an opponent your size or smaller, you can spend a swift action to attempt a bull rush combat maneuver against that opponent. If your bull rush succeeds, you can move that opponent to any unoccupied squa
Feat.Prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Bull Rush, Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike, Ki Throw.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Expertise, Improved Bull Rush, Improved Trip, Improved Unarmed Strike, Ki Throw

Feat.Name: Splintering Weapon
Feat.Description: Your fragile weapon works to your advantage, breaking off fragments in wounds you inf lict.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use a melee or thrown weapon with the fragile weapon feature (page 146) or similar quality and hit an opponent, you can give your weapon the broken condition to deal that opponent 1d4 points of bleed damage.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, proficient with weapon, weapon made of primitive material.

Feat.Name: Stage Combatant
Feat.Description: You are a master of stage and nonlethal combats.
Feat.Benefit: When you make an attack with a weapon that you have Weapon Focus in, you take no penalty on the attack roll when you are attempting to make an attack that deals no damage or nonlethal damage.
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus, base attack bonus +5

Feat.Name: Stalwart
Feat.Description: You adopt a defensive stance that allows you to absorb and redirect hits.
Feat.Benefit: While using the total defense action, fighting defensively action, or Combat Expertise, you can forgo the dodge bonus to AC you would normally gain to instead gain an equivalent amount of DR, to a maximum of DR 5/-, until the start of your next turn. This
Feat.Prereq: Diehard, Endurance, base attack bonus +4.

Feat.Name: Stealth Synergy
Feat.Description: Working closely with an ally, you are able to move like twin shadows.
Feat.Benefit: While you can see one or more allies who also have this feat, whenever you and your allies make a Stealth check, you all take the highest roll and add all your modifiers to Stealth.

Feat.Name: Strangler
Feat.Description: Throttling the life out of enemies is second nature to you.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you successfully maintain a grapple and choose to deal damage, you can spend a swift action to deal your sneak attack damage to the creature you are grappling.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, sneak attack +1d6, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Strong Comeback
Feat.Description: You learn quickly from past mistakes.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are allowed to reroll an ability check, a skill check, or a saving throw, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on the reroll.

Feat.Name: Stunning Pin
Feat.Description: You can render a pinned foe temporarily incapacitated.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you pin an opponent, you can spend a swift action to make a Stunning Fist attempt against that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist

Feat.Name: Sure Grasp
Feat.Description: Your quick ref lexes and skill at climbing keep you from falling to your doom.
Feat.Benefit: Roll twice while climbing or when making a Ref lex save to avoid falling, and take the higher result.
Feat.Prereq: Climb 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Sword and Pistol
Feat.Description: You effortlessly pair melee and ranged weaponry.
Feat.Benefit: When you use the Two-Weapon Fighting feat while wielding a melee weapon and a crossbow or firearm, your attacks with the crossbow or firearm provoke no attacks of opportunity from foes that you threaten with your melee weapon.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Snap Shot, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Snap Shot, Two-Weapon Fighting

Feat.Name: Tandem Trip
Feat.Description: You know how to work together to trip your foes.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you attempt a trip combat maneuver against an enemy threatened by an ally with this feat, you roll twice and take the better result.

Feat.Name: Target of Opportunity
Feat.Description: You and your allies pelt your enemies with a deadly barrage of missiles.
Feat.Benefit: When an ally who also has this feat makes a ranged attack and hits an opponent within 30 feet of you, you can spend an immediate action to make a single ranged attack against that opponent. Your ranged weapon must be in hand, loaded, and ready to be fired
Feat.Prereq: Point-Blank Shot, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Team Pickpocketing
Feat.Description: You distract a mark with friendly conversation while your partner robs the victim blind.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an ally with this feat succeeds a Bluff check to feint an opponent, if you are adjacent to that creature, you can spend an immediate action to make a Sleight of Hand check to pickpocket that opponent and gain a +4 bonus on that attempt.
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank, Sleight of Hand 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Tiger Claws
Feat.Description: You can sacrifice multiple attacks to make a single devastating strike.
Feat.Benefit: While you are using the Tiger Style feat and have both hands free, you can use a full-round action to make a single unarmed strike with both hands. Use your highest base attack bonus, rolling unarmed strike damage for each hand separately and multiplying
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Tiger Style, base attack bonus +6 or monk level 5th.

Feat.Name: Tiger Pounce
Feat.Description: Your unarmed strikes are as precise as they are powerful, but they leave you open and you can pursue foes with blinding speed.
Feat.Benefit: While using the Tiger Style feat, you can apply the penalty from Power Attack to your AC instead of attack rolls. Additionally, once per round as a swift action, you can move up to half your speed closer to a target you hit with an unarmed strike or made
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Power Attack, Tiger Claws, Tiger Style, base attack bonus +9 or monk level 8th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Unarmed Strike, Power Attack, Tiger Claws, Tiger Style

Feat.Name: Tiger Style
Feat.Description: Your unarmed fighting style emulates the strength and ferocity of a tiger.
Feat.Benefit: While using this style, you gain a +2 bonus to your CMD against bull rush, overrun, and trip maneuvers. You can also deal slashing damage with your unarmed strikes. Whenever you score a critical hit with your slashing unarmed strike, your opponent also ta
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +3 or monk level 3rd.

Feat.Name: Trapper's Setup
Feat.Description: You have an instinct for waiting until just the right moment to spring a hazard or trap.
Feat.Benefit: When you manually trigger a trap against opponents, that trap receives either a +2 circumstance bonus on melee attack rolls or a +2 circumstance bonus to its saving throw DC.
Feat.Prereq: Craft (traps) 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Twin Thunders
Feat.Description: When you fight giants, your powerful blows combine with skills learned from generations of your people to quickly even the odds.
Feat.Benefit: Once per round, when wielding a bludgeoning weapon in each hand against a creature with the giant subtype, if you hit the creature with your off-hand weapon after you hit with your primary weapon, roll the damage dice for your off-hand weapon twice and ad
Feat.Prereq: Dwarf or gnome, defensive training racial trait, Two-Weapon Fighting or flurry of blows class feature, Weapon Focus with both wielded weapons.

Feat.Name: Twin Thunders Flurry
Feat.Description: Your dual bludgeoning strikes are especially deadly when you are fighting giants.
Feat.Benefit: You can trip a creature with the giant subtype of up to Huge size, and you gain a +2 bonus on damage rolls against creatures of the giant subtype. Further, each time you hit a creature of the giant subtype with your offhand weapon after you hit that creat
Feat.Prereq: Dwarf or gnome; defensive training racial trait; Improved Two-Weapon Fighting and Two-Weapon Fighting, or flurry of blows class feature; Twin Thunders; Weapon Focus with both wielded weapons; base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Twin Thunders Master
Feat.Description: With thunderous simultaneous strikes, you can batter a mighty giant into submission.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you deal an opponent extra damage with the Twin Thunders feat, that opponent is shaken for 1 round. You also force that opponent to succeed at a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + half your level + your Str modif ier) or become staggered for 1 round
Feat.Prereq: Dwarf or gnome; defensive training racial trait; Improved Two-Weapon Fighting and Two-Weapon Fighting, or flurry of blows class feature; Twin Thunders; Twin Thunders Flurry; Weapon Focus with both wielded weapons; base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Two-Handed Thrower
Feat.Description: You hurl weapons with both hands and with great force, sometimes using a whirling technique to send your weapon flying through the air at tremendous speeds.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use two hands to throw a onehanded or two-handed weapon, you gain a bonus on damage rolls equal to 1-1/2 times your Strength bonus. Using two hands to throw any weapon requires only a standard action for you. If you also have the Quick Draw f
Feat.Prereq: Str 15.

Feat.Name: Two-Weapon Feint
Feat.Description: You use one weapon to distract your enemy while slipping another past his defenses.
Feat.Benefit: While using Two-Weapon Fighting to make melee attacks, you can forgo your first primary-hand melee attack to make a Bluff check to feint an opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Two-Weapon Fighting.

Feat.Name: Vicious Stomp
Feat.Description: You take advantage of the moment to brutally kick an enemy when he is down.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an opponent falls prone adjacent to you, that opponent provokes an attack of opportunity from you. This attack must be an unarmed strike.
Feat.Prereq: Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Feat.Name: Wave Strike
Feat.Description: You present a serene facade until you unsheathe your weapon and strike in one fluid motion.
Feat.Benefit: If on your first turn of combat you draw a melee weapon to attack an opponent within your reach, you can spend a swift action to make a Bluff check to feint against that opponent.
Feat.Prereq: Weapon expertise class feature or Quick Draw, Bluff 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Whip Mastery
Feat.Description: Your superior expertise with this weapon does not provoke attacks of opportunity from your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: You no longer provoke attacks of opportunity when attacking with a whip. You can deal lethal damage with a whip, although you can still deal nonlethal damage when you want. Further, you can deal damage with a whip despite a creature's armor bonus or natur
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus (whip), base attack bonus +2.

Feat.Name: Abundant Revelations
Feat.Description: You can plumb the depths of your mystery to use your revelations more often.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one of your revelations that has a number of uses per day. You gain 1 additional use per day of that revelation.
Feat.Prereq: Mystery class feature.

Feat.Name: Accursed Critical
Feat.Description: Your spells carry an embedded curse that manifests when they strike true.
Feat.Benefit: When you confirm a critical hit with a spell or spell-like ability, you may cast bestow curse or major curse on that target as an immediate action. This works even with ranged spells. You must have bestow curse or major curse prepared or otherwise availab
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, ability to cast bestow curse or major curse, caster level 9th.

Feat.Name: Accursed Hex
Feat.Description: You can make a second attempt at failed hexes.
Feat.Benefit: When you target a creature with a hex that cannot target the same creature more than once per day, and that creature succeeds at its saving throw against the hex's effect, you can target the creature with the same hex a second time before the end of your
Feat.Prereq: Hex class feature.

Feat.Name: Advanced Ranger Trap
Feat.Description: Your ranger traps are especially difficult to notice and avoid.
Feat.Benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class on all Perception and Disable Device skill checks to find or disable the traps you make with your trap class feature. Add a +1 to the Difficulty Class on all saving throws against the effects of the trap you make with your t
Feat.Prereq: Trap class feature, ranger level 5th.

Feat.Name: Antagonize
Feat.Description: Whether with biting remarks or hurtful words, you are adept at making creatures angry with you.
Feat.Benefit: You can make Diplomacy and Intimidate checks to make creatures respond to you with hostility. No matter which skill you use, antagonizing a creature takes a standard action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity, and has a DC equal to 10 + the targe

Feat.Name: Blighted Critical
Feat.Description: With a critical hit from a spell or spell-like ability, you give the target a minor spellblight.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you confirm a critical hit with a touch spell, ranged touch spell, or spell-like ability against an opponent, the victim gains a random minor spellblight (see page 95).
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 5th.

Feat.Name: Blighted Critical Mastery
Feat.Description: You control the type of spellblight your critical hits give your opponent.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you apply a spellblight by way of the Blighted Critical or Greater Blighted critical feat, you can choose the spellblight you apply rather than determining it randomly.
Feat.Prereq: Blighted Critical, caster level 9th.

Feat.Name: Burning Spell
Feat.Description: You cause creatures to take extra damage when you affect them with a spell that has the acid or fire descriptor.
Feat.Benefit: The acid or fire effects of the affected spell adhere to the creature, causing more damage the next round. When a creature takes acid or fire damage from the affected spell, that creature takes damage equal to 2 x the spell's actual level at the start of

Feat.Name: Channeled Shield Wall
Feat.Description: You draw on your channel energy to enhance the protective ability of your shield and those of adjacent allies.
Feat.Benefit: As a swift action, you can spend a use of your channel energy to grant yourself a +2 def lection bonus while using a shield. This bonus lasts 1 minute per cleric level or effective cleric level. While you benefit from this bonus, allies with shields also
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy, 3d6 prof iciency with a shield.

Feat.Name: Concussive Spell
Feat.Description: You cause creatures to be disoriented when you affect them with a spell that has the sonic descriptor.
Feat.Benefit: With sonic damage comes a concussive wave of energy that rattles creatures affected by the spell. A concussive spell causes creatures that take damage from a spell that has the sonic descriptor to take a -2 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, skill ch

Feat.Name: Create Reliquary Arms and Shields
Feat.Description: Your magical creations are infused with divine power.
Feat.Benefit: When you craft a magic weapon, magic armor, or magic shield, you may add one casting of consecrate or desecrate as part of the item crafting process. This increases the item's Price by 250 gp. The item becomes a reliquary and can be used as a holy (or unh
Feat.Prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, ability to cast consecrate or desecrate.

Feat.Name: Create Sanguine Elixir
Feat.Description: You can condense a fraction of your bloodline's power into a powerful elixir.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, when you clear your mind to regain spell slots, you can create a sanguine elixir. When you do, pick one of your bloodline powers. You transfer that power into a small potion that any creature can drink to temporarily gain the benefit of your
Feat.Prereq: Cha 15, Brew Potion, Craft (alchemy) 12 ranks, sorcerer level 3rd.

Feat.Name: Defending Eidolon
Feat.Description: You have trained your eidolon to protect you.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to your eidolon, you can choose for the eidolon to take a -1 penalty on melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to gain a +1 dodge bonus to your Armor Class. When your eidolon's base attack bonus reaches +5, and for every +
Feat.Prereq: Shield ally feature.

Feat.Name: Deny Death
Feat.Description: Your ki is so strong that it can deny death.
Feat.Benefit: As long as you have 1 ki point in your ki pool, when you fail your Constitution check to stabilize, you do not lose 1 hit point. If you succeed at the check, you can spend 1 ki point to heal 1d6 hit points. If you roll a natural 20 on the check to stabili
Feat.Prereq: Ki pool, Endurance

Feat.Name: Detect Expertise
Feat.Description: You can detect the mystic specialty of a foe.
Feat.Benefit: When you use any of the spells listed in this feat's prerequisites to detect a creature's alignment or its magic, you have a chance of detecting what spellcasting expertise it has. After you observe a creature with the detect spell for 3 rounds, it must m
Feat.Prereq: Int 13; ability to cast detect chaos, detect evil, detect good, detect law, or detect magic.

Feat.Name: Die for Your Master
Feat.Description: Your tumor familiar goes to any length to save your life.
Feat.Benefit: If your tumor familiar is attached, and you would be reduced to 0 or fewer hit points by damage in combat (from a weapon or other blow, not a spell or special ability), the familiar throws itself in the way of the attack as an immediate action. If it make
Feat.Prereq: Tumor familiar alchemist discovery.

Feat.Name: Divine Interference
Feat.Description: You can convert a spell to interfere with an enemy's attack.
Feat.Benefit: As an immediate action, when an enemy within 30 feet hits an ally with an attack, you can sacrifice a prepared divine spell or (if you are a spontaneous caster) an unused spell slot and make the enemy reroll the attack roll. The second attack roll takes a
Feat.Prereq: Divine spellcaster, caster level 10th.

Feat.Name: Dragonbane Aura
Feat.Description: Those within your dragonbane aura gain the same protection that you do.
Feat.Benefit: When fighting dragons, your aura of courage expands to a 20-foot-radius emanation, and allies in the aura gain a morale bonus on saving throws against dragon breath equal to your aura of courage's bonus against fear effects.
Feat.Prereq: Aura of courage class feature, caster level 8th.

Feat.Name: Echoing Spell
Feat.Description: You have learned how to release most, but not all, of a spell's potential when you cast it.
Feat.Benefit: When you cast an echoing spell, it does not disappear entirely from memory, and you can cast it one additional time during that day. No effect that allows you to reprepare or recast a spell can affect the echoed spell. If you prepare spells, this second c

Feat.Name: Eldritch Heritage
Feat.Description: You are descended from a long line of sorcerers, and some portion of their power flows in your veins.
Feat.Benefit: Select one sorcerer bloodline. You must have Skill focus in the class skill that bloodline grants to a sorcerer at 1st level (for example, Heal for the celestial bloodline). This bloodline cannot be a bloodline you already have. You gain the first-level b
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Skill Focus with the class skill of bloodline selected for this feat (see below), character level 3rd.

Feat.Name: Ensemble
Feat.Description: You can create an ensemble of skilled and amateur performers to aid you in your performance.
Feat.Benefit: When you are performing, allies within 20 feet who also have this feat can aid you with your Perform checks (including those made as part of bardic performance) as if they were aiding another as an immediate action. The allies make their aid another rolls
Feat.Prereq: Perform 5 ranks

Feat.Name: Evolved Familiar
Feat.Description: Your familiar is different from others of its kind.
Feat.Benefit: Select an evolution from the list of 1-point evolutions available to a summoner's eidolon. Your familiar has this evolution. The familiar must conform to any limitations of the evolution. For instance, no familiars can benefit from the mount evolution and
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Cha 13, familiar class feature.

Feat.Name: Exploit Lore
Feat.Description: You can use your knowledge of a creature's weaknesses to deliver a driving and relentless assault against it.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, when you successfully identify all abilities and weaknesses of a creature using the appropriate Knowledge check, you gain a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls against that creature for 1 minute. If you identify the abilities and weaknesses
Feat.Prereq: Monster lore class feature, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Extra Arcana
Feat.Description: You have unlocked the secret of a new magus arcana.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional magus arcana. You must meet all the prerequisites for this magus arcana.
Feat.Prereq: Magus arcana class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Arcane Pool
Feat.Description: You have learned how to draw more power from your arcane pool.
Feat.Benefit: Your arcane pool increases by 2.
Feat.Prereq: Arcane pool class feature.

Feat.Name: Extended Bane
Feat.Description: Your dedication knows no limit. Your wrath dies hard.
Feat.Benefit: Add your Wisdom bonus to the number of rounds per day that you can use your bane ability.
Feat.Prereq: Bane class feature.

Feat.Name: Extra Cantrips or Orisons
Feat.Description: You are a master of minor spells.
Feat.Benefit: Add two cantrips to your cantrips known or two orisons to your orisons known.
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast cantrips or orisons.

Feat.Name: Extra Evolution
Feat.Description: Your eidolon has more evolutions.
Feat.Benefit: Your eidolon's evolution pool increases by 1.
Feat.Prereq: Eidolon class feature.

Feat.Name: Greater Blighted Critical
Feat.Description: Your critical hit from a spell or spell-like ability aff licts the target with a major spellblight.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you confirm a critical hit with a touch spell, ranged touch spell, or spell-like ability against an opponent, the victim gains a random major spellblight (see page 96).
Feat.Prereq: Blighted Critical, caster level 12th.

Feat.Name: Greater Eldritch Heritage
Feat.Description: Your discovered bloodline power reaches its zenith.
Feat.Benefit: You gain an additional power from the bloodline you selected with the Eldritch Heritage feat. You gain a 15th-level (or lower) sorcerer bloodline power that you do not already have. For purposes of using that power, treat your character level as your sorc
Feat.Prereq: Cha 17, Eldritch Heritage, Improved Eldritch Heritage, character level 17th.

Feat.Name: Greater Mercy
Feat.Description: Your mercy has incredible recuperative properties.
Feat.Benefit: When you use your lay on hands ability and the target of that ability does not have any conditions your mercies can remove, it instead heals an additional +1d6 points of damage.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, lay on hands class feature, mercy class feature.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Specialization
Feat.Description: You can sacrifice a prepared spell in order to spontaneously cast your specialized spell.
Feat.Benefit: By sacrificing a prepared spell of the same or higher level than your specialized spell, you may spontaneously cast your specialized spell. The specialized spell is treated as its normal level, regardless of the spell slot used to cast it. You may add a m
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Spell Focus, Spell Specialization, able to prepare 5th-level spells.

Feat.Name: Greater Wild Empathy
Feat.Description: Your natural empathy stretches across the world of nature.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 insight bonus on wild empathy checks, and you may use wild empathy to duplicate an Intimidate check rather than a Diplomacy check. In addition, choose one of the following kinds of creatures: elementals, fey, lycanthropes, plants, or vermin.
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks, wild empathy class feature.

Feat.Name: Implant Bomb
Feat.Description: You can attach a bomb to a creature that explodes when the creature dies or after 24 hours.
Feat.Benefit: You may implant a bomb in a willing or helpless creature (a mindless creature under your control, such as a zombie, counts as willing for this purpose). This takes 1 hour and expends 1 use of your bomb ability for the day. When the implanted creature dies
Feat.Prereq: Heal 5 ranks, delayed bomb alchemist discovery.

Feat.Name: Improved Eldritch Heritage
Feat.Description: The power of your discovered bloodline continues to grow.
Feat.Benefit: You gain either the 3rd-level or the 9th-level power (your choice) of the bloodline you selected with the Eldritch Heritage feat. For purposes of using that power, treat your sorcerer level as equal to your character level - 2, even if you have levels in
Feat.Prereq: Cha 15, Eldritch Heritage, character level 11th.

Feat.Name: Improved Monster Lore
Feat.Description: You are obsessed with the abilities and weaknesses of monsters.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a sacred bonus on all skill checks to identify the abilities and weaknesses of creatures equal to 1/2 your level in classes that grant you the monster lore class feature.
Feat.Prereq: Monster lore class feature.

Feat.Name: Insightful Gaze
Feat.Description: In your personal interactions, you notice what others don't. It's hard to get anything past you.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you make a Sense Motive check to oppose someone's Bluff check, you can roll two dice and take the higher result.
Feat.Prereq: Stern gaze class feature, Sense Motive 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Intimidating Gaze
Feat.Description: There is something in your eyes that scares people.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, as a free action, when making an Intimidate skill check, you can roll two dice and take the higher result.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13+, stern gaze class feature, Intimidate 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Judgment Surge
Feat.Description: Once per day, the power of your faith surges, further empowering your judgments.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you can treat your class level for your judgment class feature as if it were 3 higher than normal. If you have multiple judgments active at the same time, this benefit applies to all of them.
Feat.Prereq: Judgment class feature.

Feat.Name: Ki Stand
Feat.Description: If an opponent knocks you down, you swiftly rebound with an attack.
Feat.Benefit: While you have at least 1 ki point in your ki pool, you can stand up as a swift action that provokes attacks of opportunity. You may spend 1 point of your ki pool to stand up as a swift action without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Feat.Prereq: Ki pool.

Feat.Name: Learn Ranger Trap
Feat.Description: You learn how to create one kind of ranger trap.
Feat.Benefit: Select one ranger trap (see page 64). You may use this trap a number of times per day equal to your Wisdom bonus (minimum 1). The DC for your trap is equal to 10 + 1/2 your character's level + your Wisdom bonus, and it lasts 1 day per two character levels
Feat.Prereq: Survival 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Life Lure
Feat.Description: Your channeled positive energy is irresistibly sweet to nearby undead.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can channel positive energy to fascinate all undead within 30 feet for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Undead that succeed at a Will save (DC 10 + 1/2 your cleric level + your Charisma modifier)
Feat.Prereq: Channel positive energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Moonlight Summons
Feat.Description: Your summoned minions are infused with the power of the moon.
Feat.Benefit: Creatures you summon shed light as a light spell. They are immune to confusion and sleep effects, and their natural weapons are treated as silver for the purposes of overcoming damage reduction.
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus (conjuration), able to cast summon nature's ally.

Feat.Name: Mystic Stride
Feat.Description: Enchanted vegetation does not bar your path.
Feat.Benefit: You can move at full speed even through thorns, briars, and overgrown areas that are enchanted or magically manipulated to impede motion, even if those areas confer the entangled condition.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, Nimble Moves, woodland stride class feature.

Feat.Name: Oracular Intuition
Feat.Description: You are highly sensitive to magic and changes in a person's demeanor.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on Sense Motive checks and Spellcraft checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
Feat.Prereq: Mystery class feature.

Feat.Name: Painful Anchor
Feat.Description: Evil outsiders take damage when they attempt to connect to other planes.
Feat.Benefit: When an evil outsider uses a calling, summoning, or teleportation effect, or any ability that physically transports a creature to or from another plane (such as blink or etherealness) within your anchoring aura, it takes damage equal to 4d8 + your Charism
Feat.Prereq: Anchoring aura class feature.

Feat.Name: Piercing Spell
Feat.Description: Your studies have helped you develop methods to overcome spell resistance.
Feat.Benefit: When you cast a piercing spell against a target with spell resistance, it treats the spell resistance of the target as 5 lower than its actual SR. A piercing spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

Feat.Name: Planar Preservationist
Feat.Description: You know how to preserve and reconstitute extraplanar monsters as well as normal animals.
Feat.Benefit: For every summon nature's ally extract you know, you learn the equivalent summon monster spell as an extract. If you later learn other summon nature's ally extracts, you automatically learn the equivalent summon monster spell as an extract.
Feat.Prereq: Preservationist alchemist archetype.

Feat.Name: Powerful Shape
Feat.Description: Your wild shapes are mighty and muscular.
Feat.Benefit: When in wild shape, treat your size as one category larger for the purpose of calculating CMB, CMD, carrying capacity, and any size-based special attacks you use or that are used against you (such as grab, swallow whole, and trample).
Feat.Prereq: Wild shape class feature, druid level 8th.

Feat.Name: Prodigy
Feat.Description: You are naturally skilled at arts, professions, and the acquisition of knowledge.
Feat.Benefit: Choose two Craft, Perform, or Profession skills in any combination (two Craft skills, a Craft skill and a Perform skill, and so on). You receive a +2 bonus on checks with these skills. If you have 10 or more ranks in any one of these skills, the bonus inc

Feat.Name: Prophetic Visionary
Feat.Description: Your oracular abilities give you a glimpse into the future.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you can enter a deep trance to receive a vision of the future. The trance lasts for 10 minutes, during which time you can take no other actions. If you are interrupted, you must begin again. When you come out of the trance, you know whether
Feat.Prereq: Mystery class feature.

Feat.Name: Pure Faith
Feat.Description: Not only are you immune to disease, like most paladins, but you also are highly resilient to poisons.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +4 sacred bonus to saving throws against poison.
Feat.Prereq: Divine health class feature.

Feat.Name: Quarterstaff Master
Feat.Description: You can wield a quarterstaff as either a two-handed or one-handed weapon.
Feat.Benefit: By employing a number of different stances and techniques, you can wield a quarterstaff as a one-handed weapon. At the start of your turn, you decide whether or not you are going to wield the quarterstaff as a one-handed or two-handed weapon. When you wie
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus (quarterstaff), base attack bonus +5.

Feat.Name: Quick Channel
Feat.Description: Your divine energies flash with dazzling speed.
Feat.Benefit: You may channel energy as a move action by spending 2 daily uses of that ability.
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (religion) 5 ranks, channel energy class feature.

Feat.Name: Quick Wild Shape
Feat.Description: You sacrifice power for speed in changing form.
Feat.Benefit: You can wild shape as a move action or a swift action. However, you are limited to forms available to a druid two levels lower when changing form as a move action, or four levels lower as a swift action.
Feat.Prereq: Wild shape class feature, caster level 8th.

Feat.Name: Radiant Charge
Feat.Description: When you charge, you do so with the power of faith.
Feat.Benefit: When you hit with a charge attack, you can expend all of your remaining uses of lay on hands to deal extra damage equal to 1d6 per use of lay on hands expended + your Charisma bonus. This damage comes from holy power and is not subject to damage reduction
Feat.Prereq: Lay on hands class feature.

Feat.Name: Remote Bomb
Feat.Description: You can set off your delayed bombs at great distances.
Feat.Benefit: The maximum delay for your delayed bombs increases to a number of minutes equal to your level. If you have line of effect to your delayed bomb, you may detonate it earlier than its preset time by making a DC 20 Intelligence check; the DC increases by +1 f
Feat.Prereq: Delayed bomb discovery.

Feat.Name: Resilient Eidolon
Feat.Description: Your link with your eidolon is strong enough that it can remain with you for a short time after you fall unconscious or are killed.
Feat.Benefit: If you are knocked unconscious, fall asleep, or are killed, your eidolon remains for a number of rounds equal to your summoner level before it is banished. If you are brought back to consciousness before this duration expires, your eidolon is not banished
Feat.Prereq: Eidolon class feature.

Feat.Name: Reward of Grace
Feat.Description: When you lay on hands, divine energy ripples through you, granting you grace.
Feat.Benefit: Each time you use your lay on hands ability, you gain a +1 sacred bonus on all attack rolls for 1 round.
Feat.Prereq: Lay on hands class feature.

Feat.Name: Reward of Life
Feat.Description: When you lay on hands, you are also healed.
Feat.Benefit: Each time you use your lay on hands ability to heal a creature other than yourself, you heal a number of hit points equal to your Charisma bonus. This ability has no effect if you use lay on hands to harm undead.
Feat.Prereq: Lay on hands class feature.

Feat.Name: Ricochet Splash Weapon
Feat.Description: Even when your thrown splash weapons miss, they are especially dangerous.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever your splash weapon misses and the misdirection roll indicates it lands in a square occupied by a creature, you may make an attack roll (at a -5 penalty) as if you had thrown the splash weapon at that creature. If this attack roll succeeds, the sp
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Throw Anything.

Feat.Name: Rime Spell
Feat.Description: Creatures damaged by your spells with the cold descriptor become entangled.
Feat.Benefit: The frost of your cold spell clings to the target, impeding it for a short time. A rime spell causes creatures that takes cold damage from the spell to become entangled for a number of rounds equal to the original level of the spell. This feat only affect

Feat.Name: Sacred Summons
Feat.Description: The minions of your divine patrons stand ready to answer your call.
Feat.Benefit: When using summon monster to summon creatures whose alignment subtype or subtypes exactly match your aura, you may cast the spell as a standard action instead of with a casting time of 1 round.
Feat.Prereq: Aura class feature, ability to cast summon monster.

Feat.Name: Sense Link
Feat.Description: When you and your eidolon share senses, your combined minds grant you exceptional powers of observation.
Feat.Benefit: When sharing the senses of your eidolon, you gain a +4 competence bonus on Perception checks for the duration of your bond senses ability.
Feat.Prereq: Bond senses class feature.

Feat.Name: Shaping Focus
Feat.Description: Your powers of shapeshifting outstrip your dabbling in the druidic faith.
Feat.Benefit: If you are a multiclassed druid, your wild shape ability is calculated as though your druid level were four higher, to a maximum level equal to your character level.
Feat.Prereq: Wild shape class feature, Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Sin Seer
Feat.Description: Unlike others who have taken the oath against undeath (see page 60), your preoccupation with the undead does not cloud your view of good and evil.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the detect evil class feature. You may use it or the detect undead class feature, but not at the same time.
Feat.Prereq: Detect undead paladin class feature.

Feat.Name: Skeleton Summoner
Feat.Description: The walking dead respond to your call.
Feat.Benefit: Add human and skeleton to the list of creatures you can summon with summon monster I and human skeletal champion to the list of creatures you can summon with summon monster III. Once per day, when you cast summon monster, you may summon a skeletal version
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus (necromancy), ability to cast summon monster.

Feat.Name: Sorcerous Bloodstrike
Feat.Description: You can regain power when you kill a creature.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, as an immediate action upon reducing a creature to 0 or fewer hit points with one of your sorcerer spells, you can regain one usage of a sorcerer bloodline power that has a limited number of uses per day. The slain creature must have at leas
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, sorcerer bloodline class feature.

Feat.Name: Spell Bluff
Feat.Description: You know the principles of arcane dueling, and when fighting other spellcasters, you have learned to hide the true nature of your spells until the last possible moment.
Feat.Benefit: If another spellcaster tries to counterspell your casting, she adds +4 to her Spellcraft DC when trying to determine your spell. Because you have studied how to mask the recognizable elements of your spellcasting, you gain a +2 bonus on your Spellcraft ch
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 5 ranks, Spellcraft 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Spell Hex
Feat.Description: You can transform a 1st-level spell into a hex.
Feat.Benefit: Select one 1st-level spell in the class that grants you the major hex class feature. You can learn that spell as a hex, and can use that hex three times per day. This is a spell-like ability. You use your class level in the major-hex-granting class as you
Feat.Prereq: Major hex class feature.

Feat.Name: Spell Specialization
Feat.Description: Select one spell. You cast that spell with greater than normal power.
Feat.Benefit: Select one spell of a school for which you have taken the Spell Focus feat. Treat your caster level as being two higher for all level-variable effects of the spell. Every time you gain an even level in the spellcasting class you chose your spell from, you
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Spell Focus.

Feat.Name: Spellsong
Feat.Description: You can blend the power of your performance and spellcasting.
Feat.Benefit: You can combine your bardic performance and your spellcasting in two ways. First, you can conceal the activity of casting a bard spell by masking it in a performance. As a swift action, you may combine your casting time of a spell with a Perform check. Ob
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, bardic performance class ability, able to cast 1st-level spells.

Feat.Name: Split Hex
Feat.Description: You can split the effect of one of your targeted hexes, affecting another creature you can see.
Feat.Benefit: When you use one of your hexes (not a major hex or a grand hex) that targets a single creature, you can choose another creature within 30 feet of the first target to also be targeted by the hex.
Feat.Prereq: Witch level 10th.

Feat.Name: Split Major Hex
Feat.Description: You can split the effect of one of your targeted hexes, affecting another creature you can see.
Feat.Benefit: When you use one of your major hexes (not a grand hex) that targets a creature, you can choose another creature within 30 feet of the first target to also be targeted by the major hex.
Feat.Prereq: Split hex, caster level 18th.

Feat.Name: Spontaneous Metafocus
Feat.Description: You can focus to combine one of your known spells and metamagic feats.
Feat.Benefit: Pick a single spell that you are able to cast spontaneously. When you apply metamagic feats to that spell, you can cast the spell using the normal casting time instead of at the slower casting time.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, one metamagic feat, able to spontaneously cast spells.

Feat.Name: Starlight Summons
Feat.Description: Your summoned minions slink along under the shadows of the stars.
Feat.Benefit: Creatures you summon gain the Blind-Fight feat, a +5 bonus to Perception and Stealth checks in dim light or darkness, and their natural weapons are treated as cold iron for overcoming damage reduction.
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus (conjuration), able to cast summon nature's ally.

Feat.Name: Sunlight Summons
Feat.Description: Your summoned minions shine with the power of the sun.
Feat.Benefit: Creatures that you summon shed light as a light spell. They are immune to blinding or dazzling effects, and their natural weapons are treated as magical for overcoming damage reduction.
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus (conjuration), able to cast summon nature's ally.

Feat.Name: Superior Summoning
Feat.Description: You can summon more creatures.
Feat.Benefit: Each time you cast a summoning spell that conjures more than one creature, add one to the total number of creatures summoned.
Feat.Prereq: Augment Summoning, caster level 3rd.

Feat.Name: Thanatopic Spell
Feat.Description: Your spells can pierce wards against negative energy and even affect undead targets.
Feat.Benefit: A thanatopic spell pierces defenses and immunities that protect against death effects, negative levels, and energy drain, affecting the target as if the protective barrier did not exist. For example, you could cast a thanatopic vampiric touch or enervatio
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (religion) 6 ranks, Spell Focus (necromancy).

Feat.Name: Theurgy
Feat.Description: You can blend the power of arcane and divine magic.
Feat.Benefit: You can augment the power of your divine spells with arcane energy and augment your arcane spells with divine energy. When casting a divine spell, you may sacrifice an arcane spell slot or arcane prepared spell of that spell's level or higher as a swift a
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13, Int or Cha 13, able to cast 1st-level arcane spells, able to cast 1st-level divine spells.

Feat.Name: Thoughtful Discernment
Feat.Description: Thinking back, you discover a lie in what you once thought to be words of truth.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day as a free action, you can think back about a single statement you heard in the last day and determine if it was a lie. This acts like the discern lies spell, but instead of affecting a creature, it affects a single statement a creature has ma
Feat.Prereq: Discern lies class feature.

Feat.Name: Threnodic Spell
Feat.Description: You can convert mind-affecting magic to necromantic power capable of controlling undead.
Feat.Benefit: This feat only works on mind-affecting spells. A threnodic spell affects undead creatures (even mindless undead) as if they weren't immune to mind-affecting effects, but has no effect on living creatures. A threnodic spell uses up a spell slot two level h
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (religion) 6 ranks, Spell Focus (necromancy).

Feat.Name: Toppling Spell
Feat.Description: Your spells with the force descriptor knock the affected creatures prone.
Feat.Benefit: The impact of your force spell is strong enough to knock the target prone. If the target takes damage, fails its saving throw, or is moved by your force spell, make a trip check against the target, using your caster level plus your casting ability score b

Feat.Name: Tripping Staff
Feat.Description: You can make a trip attack with your quarterstaff.
Feat.Benefit: You treat quarterstaves as if they had the trip special feature.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, Weapon Focus (quarterstaff), base attack bonus +6.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, Weapon Focus (quarterstaff)

Feat.Name: Tripping Twirl
Feat.Description: You can make a trip attack with a quarterstaff on all adjacent enemies.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, while wielding a quarterstaff two-handed, you can attempt a trip combat maneuver against each enemy adjacent to you.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, Tripping Staff, Weapon Focus (quarterstaff), Weapon Specialization (quarterstaff), base attack bonus +12.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, Tripping Staff, Weapon Focus (quarterstaff), Weapon Specialization (quarterstaff)

Feat.Name: Ultimate Mercy
Feat.Description: By using lay on hands, you can bring the dead back to life.
Feat.Benefit: You can expend 10 uses of lay on hands to bring a single dead creature you touch back to life as a raise dead spell with a caster level equal to your paladin level. You must provide the material component for raise dead or choose to accept 1 temporary neg
Feat.Prereq: Cha 19, Greater Mercy, lay on hands, mercy class feature.

Feat.Name: Ultimate Resolve
Feat.Description: Your aura of resolve does not fall with you.
Feat.Benefit: Your aura of resolve is a 20-foot emanation, and does not end if you fall unconscious.
Feat.Prereq: Aura of resolve class feature.

Feat.Name: Uncanny Alertness
Feat.Description: Your research into arcana and the nature of reality has given you heightened senses.
Feat.Benefit: This feat gives you an additional +1 bonus on Perception and Sense Motive checks, and you gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against sleep and charm effects.

Feat.Name: Uncanny Concentration
Feat.Description: You have learned to enter a deeper state when casting spells, allowing you to shrug off distractions, damage, weather effects, and even the effects of other spells.
Feat.Benefit: You do not need to make concentration checks when affected by vigorous or violent motion or by violent weather. You gain a +2 bonus on all other concentration checks.
Feat.Prereq: Combat Casting.

Feat.Name: Undead Master
Feat.Description: You can marshal vast armies of the undead to serve you.
Feat.Benefit: When you cast animate dead or use the Command Undead feat, you are considered to be four levels higher when determining the number of Hit Dice you animate. When you cast command undead, your duration is doubled.
Feat.Prereq: Spell focus (necromancy), the ability to cast animate dead or command undead.

Feat.Name: Unsanctioned Detection
Feat.Description: You can focus your ability to detect evil for more practical or mundane purposes
Feat.Benefit: As a swift action, you can focus the clarity granted by your detect evil ability to heighten your awareness of other things. This gives you a +10 sacred bonus on Perception and Sense Motive checks for one round. This expends your use of the detect evil cl
Feat.Prereq: Detect evil class feature.

Feat.Name: Unsanctioned Knowledge
Feat.Description: You have searched though forbidden texts and are privy to powerful but proscribed magic.
Feat.Benefit: Pick one 1st-level spell, one 2nd-level spell, one 3rd-level spell, and one 4th-level spell from the bard, cleric, inquisitor, or oracle spell lists. Add these spells to your paladin spell list as paladin spells of the appropriate level. Once chosen, thes
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, ability to cast 1st-level paladin spells.

Feat.Name: Versatile Channeler
Feat.Description: You can choose to channel positive and negative energy.
Feat.Benefit: You may make a choice whenever you use your channel energy class feature. If you normally channel positive energy, you may choose to channel negative energy as if your effective cleric level were 2 levels lower than normal. If you normally channel negativ
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy class feature, necromancer or neutrally aligned cleric (see below).

Feat.Name: Vigilant Eidolon
Feat.Description: Your eidolon is highly observant, and its link with you increases your own watchfulness.
Feat.Benefit: While your eidolon is within your reach, you gain a +4 bonus on Perception checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in Perception, this bonus increases to +8. This does not apply if your eidolon is helpless or unconscious.
Feat.Prereq: Eidolon class feature.

Feat.Name: Voice of the Sibyl
Feat.Description: Your voice is strangely compelling.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +1 bonus on all Bluff, Diplomacy, and Perform (oratory) skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +3 for that skill. You do not get these bonuses if you do not use your voice when using the skill (
Feat.Prereq: Cha 15.

Feat.Name: Warrior Priest
Feat.Description: Your religion is both a shield and a weapon in battle.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on initiative checks and a +2 bonus on concentration checks made to cast a spell or use a spell-like ability when casting defensively or while grappled.
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast divine spells, domain or mystery class feature.

Feat.Name: Wild Speech
Feat.Description: You speak with the tongue of men and beasts.
Feat.Benefit: When using wild shape to take the form in which you cannot speak (such as an animal), you are able to speak normally in any language you know. This allows you to cast spells with verbal components, speak command words, and activate spell completion and sp
Feat.Prereq: Druid level 6th, wild shape class feature.

Feat.Name: Witch Knife
Feat.Description: You empower your witch spells by incorporating the use of a special ceremonial knife during your castings.
Feat.Benefit: Each day, when you prepare your spells, you can select a masterwork or magical dagger, transforming it into a witch knife, which serves as an additional focus component for witch patron spells. Add +1 to the DC of all your patron spells.
Feat.Prereq: Witch class.

Feat.Name: Word of Healing
Feat.Description: Using the same divine energy as your lay on hands ability, you can heal others at a distance.
Feat.Benefit: You may use your lay on hands to heal another creature at a range of 30 feet as a standard action that does not provoke an attack of opportunity. You must be able to speak and have a free hand to use this ability. The target heals half the amount they wou
Feat.Prereq: Lay on hands class feature.

Feat.Name: Brewmaster
Feat.Description: You can concoct potent brews.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Craft (alchemy) and Profession (brewer) checks, and you add +1 to the DC of any ingested poison you create.
Feat.Prereq: Craft (alchemy) 1 rank, Profession (brewer) 1 rank, dwarf.

Feat.Name: Cleave Through
Feat.Description: You are ferocious at hewing smaller opponents.
Feat.Benefit: When using Cleave or Great Cleave, if your initial attack hits, you may take a single 5-foot step as a free action before making your additional attacks. If doing so places a creature within your threatened area, that creature becomes a legal target for y
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Power Attack, base attack bonus +11, dwarf.

Feat.Name: Cloven Helm
Feat.Description: Your helm turns aside lethal blows.
Feat.Benefit: When wearing a helmet, you add +1 to your AC against critical hit confirmation rolls; this benefit stacks with Dented Helm. When you use Dented Helm to def lect a critical hit, you may apply all damage from the critical hit to your helmet before applying
Feat.Prereq: Dented Helm, Hard-Headed, base attack bonus +11, dwarf.

Feat.Name: Dented Helm
Feat.Description: Your helm protects you from hard hits.
Feat.Benefit: When wearing a helmet, you add +1 to your AC against critical hit confirmation rolls. When a critical hit is confirmed against you, as an immediate action, you can apply half of the damage from the attack to your helmet rather than yourself, applying hard
Feat.Prereq: Hard-Headed, base attack bonus +6, dwarf.

Feat.Name: Giant Killer
Feat.Description: Your cleaving strokes menace giants and larger foes.
Feat.Benefit: This functions as Goblin Cleaver, but your additional attacks can be made against creatures one size category larger than you or smaller. In addition, any such attacks made against humanoids (giant) gain a +2 circumstance bonus on attack rolls.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Goblin Cleaver, Orc Hewer, Power Attack, Strike Back, base attack bonus +11, dwarf.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Cleave, Goblin Cleaver, Orc Hewer, Power Attack, Strike Back

Feat.Name: Goblin Cleaver
Feat.Description: You are ferocious at hewing smaller opponents.
Feat.Benefit: When using Cleave or Great Cleave, if your initial attack hits, you may take your additional attacks against any creature smaller than you that you threaten; your targets need not be adjacent to one another. Additional attacks you make against humanoids (
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Power Attack, dwarf.

Feat.Name: Hard-Headed
Feat.Description: Your thick skull is almost a weapon unto itself.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls and combat maneuver checks made using a helmet. You receive a +2 bonus on saves against spells and special abilities that cause you to become staggered or stunned.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, dwarf.

Feat.Name: Ledge Walker
Feat.Description: You negotiate tiny ledges like a mountain goat.
Feat.Benefit: You can move at full speed while using Acrobatics to balance on narrow surfaces, and you gain a +4 bonus on Climb checks to catch yourself or another creature while falling. You also gain a +4 bonus on saving throws against effects that would cause you to
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, dwarf, mountaineer or stability racial trait.

Feat.Name: Orc Hewer
Feat.Description: You are ferocious at hewing your enemies, especially orcs.
Feat.Benefit: This feat functions as Goblin Cleaver, but your additional attacks can be made against creatures your size or smaller. In addition, any such attacks that you make against humanoids (orc) gain a +2 circumstance bonus on attack rolls.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Goblin Cleaver, Power Attack, dwarf.

Feat.Name: Shatterspell
Feat.Description: Your mighty blows shatter your enemy's magic.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can attempt to sunder an ongoing spell effect as if you had the spell sunder rage power (Ultimate Combat 28). You may use this feat once per day, plus one additional time per day for every 5 points by which your base attack bonus
Feat.Prereq: Disruptive, Spellbreaker, dwarf, 10th-level fighter.

Feat.Name: Toxic Recovery
Feat.Description: Your system recuperates from the effects of poisons with astonishing speed.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you succeed at a saving throw against poison, you heal 1 point of ability damage of the type dealt by the poison. Whenever you heal ability damage naturally or magically, you heal 1 additional point of ability damage. This feat has no effect on p
Feat.Prereq: Dwarf, hardy racial trait.

Feat.Name: Attuned to the Wild
Feat.Description: You share a strong mystic connection with one type of wilderness terrain.
Feat.Benefit: Select one type of terrain from the ranger class's favored terrain class feature (except urban). While you are in your selected terrain type, your natural healing rate (the amount of hit points and ability damage you heal from a full night's rest) doubles

Feat.Name: Elven Battle Training
Feat.Description: You have been specially trained to wield a variety of traditional elven weapons.
Feat.Benefit: You have received special training with traditional elven weapons (longbows, composite longbows, longswords, rapiers, shortbows, composite shortbows, and any weapon with the word elven in its name). You receive a +2 bonus to your CMD against disarm and su
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, elf.

Feat.Name: Guardian of the Wild
Feat.Description: Your mystic connection with the wilderness enhances your ability to react to threats.
Feat.Benefit: When you are in a terrain type you have selected the Attuned to the Wild feat for, you gain a +2 dodge bonus to Armor Class. If you are in an area that qualifies as more than one kind of terrain, these bonuses do not stack; you receive the bonus for only
Feat.Prereq: Attuned to the Wild, elf.

Feat.Name: Mage of the Wild
Feat.Description: Your mystic connection with the wilderness enhances your spellcasting.
Feat.Benefit: When you are in a terrain type you have selected the Attuned to the Wild feat for, you gain a +2 bonus on caster level checks, concentration checks, and, Knowledge (arcana) and Spellcraft checks. If you are in an area that qualifies as more than one kind
Feat.Prereq: Attuned to the Wild, elf.

Feat.Name: Spirit of the Wild
Feat.Description: Your mystic connection with one type of wilderness has grown even stronger.
Feat.Benefit: When you are in a terrain type you have selected the Attuned to the Wild feat for, you gain a +4 bonus on Perception checks made to act in the surprise round of combat. If you act in the surprise round, you gain blindsense out to a range of 30 feet during
Feat.Prereq: Attuned to the Wild, Guardian of the Wild, elf.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Attuned to the Wild, Guardian of the Wild

Feat.Name: Casual Illusionist
Feat.Description: You can use your innate magic to create minor illusions that augment your efforts at trickery and deceit.
Feat.Benefit: As long as you have at least one spell-like ability unused from your gnome magic racial trait, you gain a +2 racial bonus on all Bluff, Disguise, and Sleight of Hand checks you make. At 10th level, these bonuses increase to +4.
Feat.Prereq: Gnome, gnome magic racial trait.

Feat.Name: Expanded Resistance
Feat.Description: You have expanded your natural resistance to magic to encompass different kinds of magic.
Feat.Benefit: Select one school of magic other than illusion. You gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against spells or effects from the selected school.
Feat.Prereq: Gnome, illusion resistance racial trait.

Feat.Name: Gnome Weapon Focus
Feat.Description: Your extensive training with traditional gnome weapons gives you an advantage.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls with gnome weapons (weapons with gnome in the title).
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, gnome, proficient with all martial weapons.

Feat.Name: Great Hatred
Feat.Description: Your rage burns with vast intensity.
Feat.Benefit: You gain an additional +1 bonus on melee and thrown weapon attacks against targets of your hatred racial trait.
Feat.Prereq: Gnome, hatred racial trait.

Feat.Name: Vast Hatred
Feat.Description: Your rage stretches beyond normal bounds.
Feat.Benefit: Select two creature types (and subtypes where appropriate) from the list of potential favored enemies from the ranger class ability. Your +1 attack bonus from the hatred racial trait applies to creatures of the selected types (and subtypes).
Feat.Prereq: Gnome, hatred racial trait.

Feat.Name: Discerning Eye
Feat.Description: You are not easily fooled by illusions and forgeries.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against illusion spells and effects and a +2 bonus on Linguistic checks to detect forgeries. You can use the Linguistic skill to detect forgeries untrained.
Feat.Prereq: Elf or half-elf, keen senses racial trait.

Feat.Name: Elven Spirit
Feat.Description: Although you are of mixed heritage, you are closer to your elven relatives and the magic in their blood flows freely in your veins.
Feat.Benefit: You possess the elven magic racial trait of the elves, granting you a +2 racial bonus on caster level checks made to overcome spell resistance. In addition, you receive a +2 racial bonus on Spellcraft checks made to identify the properties of magic items.

Feat.Name: Exile's Path
Feat.Description: A lifetime spent shunned by others and eschewing your heritage makes you resistant to efforts to pry inside of your mind.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, when you fail a Will save against an enchantment spell or effect, you may reroll that saving throw, but must take the reroll result even if it's worse.

Feat.Name: Half-Drow Paragon
Feat.Description: Your drow blood is particularly strong.
Feat.Benefit: You count as a drow for any effects that relate to race. Furthermore, the spell-like abilities granted to you by your drow magic racial trait count as drow spell-like abilities for the purposes of any feat prerequisites.
Feat.Prereq: Drow-blooded and drow magic racial traits, half-elf.

Feat.Name: Human Spirit
Feat.Description: Your blood burns with the passion and unyielding quest for self-improvement displayed so prominently by your human relatives.
Feat.Benefit: You receive 1 bonus skill rank. Whenever you gain another Hit Die, you gain an additional skill rank. You cannot gain more than four skill ranks in this way.

Feat.Name: Multitalented Mastery
Feat.Description: You are adept at numerous disciplines.
Feat.Benefit: All of your classes are considered favored classes. You gain either +1 hit point or +1 skill point whenever you take a level in any class. Apply these bonuses retroactively for all class levels that have not yet gained one of these bonuses.
Feat.Prereq: Character level 5th, half-elf, multitalented racial trait.

Feat.Name: Neither Elf nor Human
Feat.Description: You have removed yourself from your heritage so thoroughly that even magic does not recognize you.
Feat.Benefit: You are not considered elven or human for the purpose of harmful spells or effects based on your type, like a bane weapon or a ranger's favored enemy class feature.
Feat.Prereq: Exile's Path, Seen and Unseen, character level 11th, half-elf.

Feat.Name: Seen and Unseen
Feat.Description: Your anonymity makes you difficult to find through magical or mundane means, and you have learned how to combat both of your progenitor races.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all saving throws against scrying or divination effects. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus on all Stealth checks, and elves, half-elves, and humans take a -4 penalty on all efforts to track you through the Survival skill.
Feat.Prereq: Exile's Path, character level 5th, half-elf.

Feat.Name: Shared Manipulation
Feat.Description: You can subtly bolster allies' ability to misdirect and infuriate their enemies.
Feat.Benefit: As a move action, you can grant all friendly creatures within 30 feet who can see or hear you a +2 bonus on Bluff or Intimidate checks (choose which skill to affect each time you use this ability) for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (mi
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, half-elf.

Feat.Name: Beast Rider
Feat.Description: You gain the service of a monstrous companion or mount.
Feat.Benefit: Select one of the following creature types: elephant, pteranodon, rhinoceros, stegosaurus, or triceratops. Add this creature type to your list of possible animal companions or mounts. When summoning a creature of the selected type to serve as a mount or c
Feat.Prereq: Animal companion or mount class feature, character level 7th, half-orc or orc.

Feat.Name: Blood Vengeance
Feat.Description: Seeing an ally fall in combat fills you with a raging and murderous fury.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever one of your allies is reduced to negative hit points or killed, you may enter a state similar to but less powerful than a barbarian's rage as a free action on your next turn. If you have the rage class feature and are already raging, your morale
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, nonlawful.

Feat.Name: Destroyer's Blessing
Feat.Description: Breaking things adds to your power.
Feat.Benefit: When you are raging and you succeed at a sunder combat maneuver, you regain 1 round of rage. If the sunder attempt causes the object to gain the broken condition, you heal 1 hit point. You can only gain these benefits once per round.
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Ferocious Resolve
Feat.Description: Your orc heritage allows you to fight on.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the ferocity universal monster ability, allowing you to continue fighting at negative hit points. When using this ability, you gain a +2 bonus on Intimidate checks.
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, half-orc, orc ferocity racial trait.

Feat.Name: Ferocious Summons
Feat.Description: Your summoned creatures gain your ferocity.
Feat.Benefit: Creatures you summon gain the ferocity universal monster ability.
Feat.Prereq: Augment Summoning, Spell Focus (conjuration), half-orc or orc.

Feat.Name: Ferocious Tenacity
Feat.Description: You spit in the face of death.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day when raging, if you are hit by an attack that would deal enough hit points of damage to kill you (negative hit points equal to your Constitution score), as an immediate action you may expend 1 or more rounds of rage to negate some of this dam
Feat.Prereq: Ferocity racial trait, half-orc or orc, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Gore Fiend
Feat.Description: Horrible wounds, whether on yourself or your enemies, make your blood sing.
