Feat.Benefit: When you are raging and you confirm a critical hit with a melee weapon or a critical hit is confirmed on you (whether by a melee weapon, spell, or ranged weapon), you regain 1 round of rage (up to your maximum for the day). You can only gain this benefit
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Horde Charge
Feat.Description: When you charge with an ally, you are more deadly.
Feat.Benefit: When charging during the same round as an ally with this feat, you gain a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls in addition to the normal bonus for charging. If you can make multiple attacks on a charge, this bonus only applies to the first attack.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, half-orc or orc.

Feat.Name: Improved Surprise Follow-Through
Feat.Description: You follow up an attack with a surprising series of sweeping blows.
Feat.Benefit: When using Great Cleave, each opponent you attack on your turn (other than the first) is denied his Dexterity bonus against you.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Great Cleave, Power Attack, Surprise Follow Through, base attack bonus +8.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Cleave, Great Cleave, Power Attack, Surprise Follow Through

Feat.Name: Resilient Brute
Feat.Description: You absorb punishment others find deadly.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, when a creature confirms a critical hit against you, you may treat half the damage as nonlethal damage. You cannot use this ability if you are immune to nonlethal damage. When your base attack bonus reaches +10, you may use this ability an a
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc.

Feat.Name: Surprise Follow-Through
Feat.Description: When striking one opponent, you catch its ally off guard.
Feat.Benefit: When using Cleave or Great Cleave, the second foe you attack on your turn is denied its Dexterity bonus against you.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Cleave, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Sympathetic Rage
Feat.Description: Seeing an ally rage fills you with your own fury.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who is raging, you may choose to enter a similar but less powerful rage as a free action on your turn. This weaker rage gives you all the benefits and penalties of a barbarian's rage, except your morale bonus to Streng
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, nonlawful.

Feat.Name: Tenacious Survivor
Feat.Description: Your spirit lingers long after any other's would have passed on.
Feat.Benefit: When you are killed by hit point damage, your soul lingers in your body for a number of rounds equal to your Constitution bonus. You are still dead, but a creature can make a DC 10 Heal check as a standard action to realize that you can still be saved. Yo
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Diehard, Endurance, half-orc or orc.

Feat.Name: Thrill of the Kill
Feat.Description: Killing fuels your rage.
Feat.Benefit: When you are raging and your attack reduces an enemy to negative hit points or kills it, you regain 1 round of rage. You may only use this feat if the fallen enemy had at least as many Hit Dice as you. You can only gain this benefit once per round.
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Adaptive Fortune
Feat.Description: Your luck takes on almost legendary proportions.
Feat.Benefit: Increase the number of times per day you can use the adaptable luck racial trait by 1. Furthermore, when you use adaptable luck, increase the luck bonus for each type of use by 2.
Feat.Prereq: Fortunate One, adaptable luck racial trait, character level 10th, halfling.

Feat.Name: Blundering Defense
Feat.Description: Your feverish and sometimes comical defensive techniques offer enough distraction to aid allies.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you fight defensively or use the total defense action, allies gain a luck bonus to AC and CMD equal to 1/2 the dodge bonus you gain from the action you are taking. Allies only gain this bonus while they are adjacent to you.
Feat.Prereq: Cautious Fighter, halfling.

Feat.Name: Cautious Fighter
Feat.Description: You care more about survival than victory.
Feat.Benefit: When fighting defensively or using total defense, your dodge bonus to AC increases by 2.

Feat.Name: Courageous Resolve
Feat.Description: Even when others run, you tend to stand your ground.
Feat.Benefit: If you have the fearless racial trait, your racial bonus on saving throws against fear effects increases to +4. If you have the craven racial trait, you still take the -2 penalty on fear saves, but you can gain the benefit of morale bonuses on saving thro
Feat.Prereq: Craven racial trait or fearless racial trait, halfling.

Feat.Name: Desperate Swing
Feat.Description: You land your most telling blows in desperate situations.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you can make a single melee attack while taking the total defense action. You take a -4 penalty on attack rolls when making this attack. You also gain a +4 bonus on critical confirmation rolls made while fighting defensively or making an att
Feat.Prereq: Cautious Fighter, base attack bonus +1, halfling.

Feat.Name: Fortunate One
Feat.Description: You have an even greater knack than most halflings for adaptable luck.
Feat.Benefit: The number of times per day you can use the adaptable luck racial trait increases by 1.
Feat.Prereq: Adaptable luck racial trait, halfling.

Feat.Name: Improved Low Blow
Feat.Description: You are adept at hitting larger opponents where it hurts.
Feat.Benefit: Your bonus to conf irm critical hits against opponents larger than yourself improves to +2. Furthermore, once per day, after you fail to hit with a critical hit conf irmation roll, you can reroll the conf irmation roll, but must take the new result even i
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +4, halfling, low-blow racial trait.

Feat.Name: Lucky Healer
Feat.Description: Your luck allows you to draw from magical healing far more efficiently than most.
Feat.Benefit: Spend a use of your adaptive luck racial trait to reroll the damage healed from a single magical healing effect (such as a spell with cure in the title or channel energy). You regain a number of hit points equal to the new roll or the original roll, which
Feat.Prereq: Adaptive luck racial trait, halfling.

Feat.Name: Lucky Strike
Feat.Description: Your luck increases the potency of your weapon attacks.
Feat.Benefit: Spend a use of your adaptive luck racial trait to reroll the damage from a single weapon attack. You deal damage equal to the new damage roll, or the original roll, whichever is greater.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +5, adaptive luck racial trait, halfling.

Feat.Name: Risky Striker
Feat.Description: You can make yourself a little more vulnerable to larger creatures in order to land a devastating blow.
Feat.Benefit: You can choose to take a -1 penalty to AC to gain a +2 bonus on melee damage rolls against creatures two or more size categories larger than you. When your base attack bonus reaches +4 and every four levels thereafter, the damage increases by 2. The bonus
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, halfling.

Feat.Name: Sure and Fleet
Feat.Description: You are both fast and careful.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 racial bonus on Acrobatics and Climb checks.
Feat.Prereq: Fleet of foot racial trait, halfling.

Feat.Name: Surprise Strike
Feat.Description: You actually seem to do more damage when frantically trying to avoid your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, when fighting defensively or making an attack of opportunity while taking the total defense action with the Desperate Swing feat, you take no penalty on the attack roll.
Feat.Prereq: Cautious Fighter, Desperate Swing, base attack bonus +6, halfling.

Feat.Name: Uncanny Defense
Feat.Description: Your instinct for self-preservation gives you many advantages.
Feat.Benefit: While fighting defensively or taking the total defense action, you gain a bonus on your Ref lex saving throws and to your CMD equal to 1/2 of the dodge bonus to AC you gained from taking that action.
Feat.Prereq: Cautious Fighter, base attack bonus +3, halfling.

Feat.Name: Bestow Luck
Feat.Description: You are extremely lucky and sometimes your allies are as well.
Feat.Benefit: You gain an extra use per day of your Defiant Luck ability. You can also use your Inexplicable Luck ability to grant an ally that can see and hear its benefit as an immediate action.
Feat.Prereq: Defiant Luck, Inexplicable Luck, human.

Feat.Name: Critical Versatility
Feat.Description: An open mind and combat training grant versatility to your critical hits.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you can spend 1 hour practicing maneuvers to gain one single critical feat that you meet the prerequisites for. You gain the benefits of the chosen critical feat until you choose to practice a different critical feat.
Feat.Prereq: Fighter level 11th, human.

Feat.Name: Dauntless Destiny
Feat.Description: Your ability to avert disaster is impressive.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on saving throws against effects with the emotion descriptor; this bonus stacks with those granted by Fearless Curiosity and Intimidating Confidence. In addition, once per day you may reroll a natural 1 on a saving throw or an attack r
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Fearless Curiosity, Intimidate 10 ranks, human.

Feat.Name: Defiant Luck
Feat.Description: You can sometimes defiantly shrug off spells and attacks that would kill a lesser creature.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, after you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw or a critical hit is confirmed against you, you can either reroll that saving throw, or force the creature that confirmed the critical hit against you to reroll the critical confirmation roll. Thi

Feat.Name: Fast Learner
Feat.Description: You progress gain extra versatility.
Feat.Benefit: When you gain a level in a favored class, you gain both +1 hit point and +1 skill rank instead of choosing either one or the other benefit or you can choose an alternate class reward.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, human.

Feat.Name: Fearless Curiosity
Feat.Description: Your desire to see and experience the world overrides healthy caution.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on saving throws against effects with the emotion descriptor. In addition, for any round in which you begin your turn affected by a fear effect, you gain a new save at the beginning of your turn to reduce the severity of the fear effec
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, human.

Feat.Name: Heroic Will
Feat.Description: Your indomitable will breaks free from mental shackles.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day as a standard action, you may attempt a new saving throw against a harmful condition requiring a Will save that is affecting you. If you are dominated, controlled, or cannot take an action because of the effect against which you are trying to
Feat.Prereq: Iron Will, base Will save +4, human.

Feat.Name: Huntmaster
Feat.Description: You are an expert trainer of horses, hounds, falcons, or hunting cats.
Feat.Benefit: If you have the animal companion class feature, pick one of the following types of animal companions that this feat affects: bird, dog, small cat, or horse. If you have the divine bond (mount) or mount class feature, this feat always affects horses. You g
Feat.Prereq: Handle Animal 1 rank; either the animal companion, divine bond (mount), or mount class feature; human.

Feat.Name: Improved Improvisation
Feat.Description: You are masterful in your improvisation.
Feat.Benefit: Your nonprof iciency penalty with weapons, armor, and shields is halved. In addition, the bonus on all skill checks for skills you have no ranks in increases to +4 instead of +2.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Fast Learner, Improvisation, human.

Feat.Name: Improvisation
Feat.Description: You can figure out how to do almost anything.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all skill checks for skills you have no ranks in. Furthermore, you can use all trained skills untrained.
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Fast Learner, human.

Feat.Name: Inexplicable Luck
Feat.Description: Others are often dumfounded by your luck.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, as a free action before a roll is made, you gain a +8 bonus on any single d20 roll. You can also use this ability after the roll is made, but if you do, this bonus is reduced to +4.
Feat.Prereq: Defiant Luck, human.

Feat.Name: Intimidating Confidence
Feat.Description: You have boundless faith in your success.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on saving throws against effects with the emotion descriptor; this bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Fearless Curiosity. When you confirm a critical hit, as a free action you can make an Intimidate check to demoralize one creature
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Fearless Curiosity, Intimidate 5 ranks, human.

Feat.Name: Martial Mastery
Feat.Description: You broaden your study of weapons to encompass multiple similar weapons.
Feat.Benefit: Each combat feat you have that applies to a specific weapon (e.g., Weapon Focus) can be used with all weapons in the same weapon group (Ultimate Combat 45).
Feat.Prereq: Martial Versatility, fighter level 16th, human.

Feat.Name: Martial Versatility
Feat.Description: You further broaden your study of weapons to encompass multiple similar weapons.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one combat feat you know that applies to a specific weapon (e.g., Weapon Focus). You can use that feat with any weapon within the same weapon group.
Feat.Prereq: Fighter level 4th, human.

Feat.Name: Surge of Success
Feat.Description: Your success drives your further actions.
Feat.Benefit: When you confirm a critical hit or roll a natural 20 on a saving throw, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on a single attack roll, saving throw, skill check, or ability check of your choice before the end of your next turn. You must choose to use this bonu

Feat.Name: Angel Wings
Feat.Description: Feathered wings sprout from your back.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a pair of gleaming feathered wings that grant a fly speed of 30 feet (average maneuverability) if wearing light armor or unencumbered, or 20 feet (poor maneuverability) with a medium or heavy load or medium or heavy armor. Fly is a class skill fo
Feat.Prereq: Angelic Blood, aasimar, character level 10th.

Feat.Name: Angelic Blood
Feat.Description: Your blood is infused with holy power.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against effects with the evil descriptor and on Constitution checks to stabilize when you are reduced to negative hit points (but not dead). Furthermore, each time you take bleed or blood drain damage, each undead crea
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, aasimar.

Feat.Name: Angelic Flesh
Feat.Description: Your skin shines like burnished metal.
Feat.Benefit: You take a -2 penalty on Disguise and Stealth checks but gain one of the following benefits, depending on the metallic affinity of your flesh (choose one). Brazen: You gain fire resistance 5 and a +2 bonus on saves against fire effects. Golden: You gain a
Feat.Prereq: Angelic Blood, aasimar.

Feat.Name: Celestial Servant
Feat.Description: Rather than being a normal animal or beast, your companion or familiar hails from the heavenly realms.
Feat.Benefit: Your animal companion, familiar, or mount gains the celestial template and becomes a magical beast, though you may still treat it as an animal when using Handle Animal, wild empathy, or any other spells or class abilities that specifically affect animals.
Feat.Prereq: Aasimar, animal companion, familiar, or mount class feature.

Feat.Name: Channel Force
Feat.Description: Your channel is bolstered by your faith, allowing you to move and damage your foes.
Feat.Benefit: When you channel energy to deal damage, you may choose to affect only a single target within 30 feet. In addition to dealing damage, if that single target fails its saving throw, you may pull or push (Pathfinder RPG Bestiary 303) the target up to 5 feet f
Feat.Prereq: Aasimar, channel energy 2d6.

Feat.Name: Greater Channel Force
Feat.Description: Your eruptions of divine power move your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: When using Improved Channel Force, you can affect all creatures in a 30-foot-radius burst.
Feat.Prereq: Channel Force, Improved Channel Force, aasimar, channel energy 6d6.

Feat.Name: Heavenly Radiance
Feat.Description: Your heavenly light can be used in a variety of ways.
Feat.Benefit: You gain one additional use per day of daylight. Choose one spell from the table below; by expending a use of daylight, you may use this spell as a spell-like ability. To select a spell, you must meet the minimum character level for its listing in the tab
Feat.Prereq: Aasimar, daylight spell-like ability, sufficiently high level (see below).

Feat.Name: Improved Channel Force
Feat.Description: You move your enemies within a beam of righteous energy.
Feat.Benefit: When using Channel Force, you can affect all creatures in a 60-foot line or a 30-foot cone-shaped burst. You must choose to either push or pull all creatures within the affected area that fail their saves.
Feat.Prereq: Channel Force, aasimar, channel energy 4d6.

Feat.Name: Metallic Wings
Feat.Description: Your wing feathers are made of gleaming metal.
Feat.Benefit: You gain two wing attacks. These are secondary natural attacks that deal 1d4 points of slashing damage (or 1d3 if you are Small).
Feat.Prereq: Angelic Blood, Angelic Flesh, Angel Wings, aasimar, character level 11th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Angelic Blood, Angelic Flesh, Angel Wings

Feat.Name: Black Cat
Feat.Description: Bad luck befalls those who dare to cross you.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day as an immediate action, when you are hit by a melee attack, you can force the opponent who made the attack to reroll it with a -4 penalty. The opponent must take the result of the second attack roll. This is a supernatural ability.

Feat.Name: Catfolk Exemplar
Feat.Description: Your feline traits are more defined and prominent than those of other members of your race.
Feat.Benefit: You can take the Aspect of the Beast feat (Advanced Player's Guide 151) even if you do not meet the normal prerequisites. Furthermore, your catlike nature manifests in one of the following ways. You choose the manifestation when you take this feat, and ca

Feat.Name: Claw Pounce
Feat.Description: You can charge and make an attack with your paws.
Feat.Benefit: When you make a charge, you can make a full attack with your claws.
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Dex 15, Nimble Striker, base attack bonus +10, catfolk, cat's claws racial trait or Aspect of the Beast (claws of the beast manifestation).

Feat.Name: Feline Grace
Feat.Description: Your innate grace allows you to get out of the stickiest situations.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to your CMD against bull rush, grapple, overrun, repositioning, and trip combat maneuvers.
Feat.Prereq: Dexterity 13, catfolk.

Feat.Name: Nimble Striker
Feat.Description: You were born to charge your enemies and nobody does it better.
Feat.Benefit: You do not take a -2 penalty to AC when you use the Cleave feat, Lunge feat, or when you charge.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, base attack bonus +1, catfolk, sprinter racial trait.

Feat.Name: Blood Drinker
Feat.Description: Consuming blood reinvigorates you.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one humanoid subtype, such as goblinoid (this subtype cannot be dhampir). You have acquired a taste for the blood of creatures with this subtype. Whenever you drink fresh blood from such a creature, you gain 5 temporary hit points and a +1 bonus on

Feat.Name: Blood Feaster
Feat.Description: Consuming blood gives you superhuman strength.
Feat.Benefit: If you use your Blood Drinker feat to drain 4 or more points of Constitution from a living creature, you gain a +2 bonus on damage rolls and a +1 bonus on Strength-based skill checks. This bonus lasts for a number of rounds equal to 1/2 your HitDiceRoll.
Feat.Prereq: Blood Drinker, base attack bonus +6, dhampir.

Feat.Name: Blood Salvage
Feat.Description: You do not need to drink blood from a living creature to gain healing benefits.
Feat.Benefit: You can use your Blood Drinker feat on a dead creature of the appropriate humanoid subtype. The creature must have died less than 6 hours beforehand.
Feat.Prereq: Blood Drinker, dhampir.

Feat.Name: Diverse Palate
Feat.Description: Your taste for blood is broader than that of other dhampirs.
Feat.Benefit: Choose a humanoid subtype or the monstrous humanoid type. You may use your Blood Drinker feat on creatures of this subtype or type.
Feat.Prereq: Blood Drinker, dhampir.

Feat.Name: Natural Charmer
Feat.Description: You possess some of the dominating powers of your vampire progenitor.
Feat.Benefit: You can take 20 on any Charisma-based skills to charm, convince, persuade, or seduce humanoids whose attitude is at least friendly to you. Taking 20 still requires 20 times the normal time to perform the skill.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 17, dhampir.

Feat.Name: Drow Nobility
Feat.Description: Your blood courses with power, granting you greater spell-like abilities.
Feat.Benefit: You may use detect magic as a spell-like ability at will, and add feather fall and levitate to the spell-like abilities that you may use once each per day. Your caster level is equal to your character level.
Feat.Prereq: Able to use drow spell-like abilities, drow.

Feat.Name: Greater Drow Nobility
Feat.Description: You have mastered the lesser spell-like abilities of the drow, demonstrating true nobility.
Feat.Benefit: Your detect magic spell-like ability is now constant. You may use your dancing lights, deeper darkness, faerie fire, feather fall, and levitate spell-like abilities at will.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Drow Nobility, Improved Drow Nobility, able to use drow spell-like abilities, drow.

Feat.Name: Improved Drow Nobility
Feat.Description: Your magical heritage is more potent than that of your peers, as demonstrated by your superior spell-like abilities.
Feat.Benefit: You may use your dancing lights, faerie fire, feather fall, and levitate spell-like abilities twice per day. Your darkness spell-like ability instead becomes deeper darkness, which you may use twice per day.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Drow Nobility, able to use drow spell-like abilities, drow.

Feat.Name: Improved Umbral Scion
Feat.Description: You are a master of drow noble magic.
Feat.Benefit: You may use dispel magic, divine favor, and suggestion once per day as spell-like abilities. Your caster level is equal to your character level.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Wis 13, Drow Nobility, Greater Drow Nobility, Improved Drow Nobility, Umbral Scion, able to use drow spell-like abilities, drow.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Drow Nobility, Greater Drow Nobility, Improved Drow Nobility, Umbral Scion

Feat.Name: Noble Spell Resistance
Feat.Description: Your ascension is complete; you have the spell resistance approaching that of a demon.
Feat.Benefit: Your spell resistance is equal to 11 + your character level.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Wis 13, Greater Drow Nobility, character level 13th, drow.

Feat.Name: Shadow Caster
Feat.Description: Your command over shadow and darkness create longer-lasting spell effects.
Feat.Benefit: When you cast spells of the shadow subschool or spells with the darkness descriptor, you are considered two levels higher when determining the duration of those spells.
Feat.Prereq: Caster level 1st, drow.

Feat.Name: Spider Step
Feat.Description: You tread where only arachnids dare.
Feat.Benefit: You can cast spider climb once per day as a spell-like ability, using your character level as the caster level. Furthermore, you gain a +4 bonus on saving throws against the web special attacks of spiders and the effects of web and other similar spells (s
Feat.Prereq: Character level 3rd, drow.

Feat.Name: Spider Summoner
Feat.Description: You gain the ability to summon powerful spiders.
Feat.Benefit: When casting either a summon monster spell or a summon nature's ally spell, your options increase. Depending on the level of the spell, you can summon the spiders listed below. Summon Monster: 1st level-giant crab spider* (Bestiary 3 254); 4th level-giant
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast summon monster or summon nature's ally spells, drow.

Feat.Name: Umbral Scion
Feat.Description: New spell-like abilities are unlocked for you as you rise to ascendency among the drow people.
Feat.Benefit: Select one of the following: dispel magic, divine favor, or suggestion. You may use this spell once per day as a spell-like ability. Your caster level is equal to your character level.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Wis 13, Drow Nobility, Greater Drow Nobility, Improved Drow Nobility, able to use drow spell-like abilities, drow.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Drow Nobility, Greater Drow Nobility, Improved Drow Nobility

Feat.Name: Natural Jouster
Feat.Benefit: You gain proficiency with the lance. You can wield a lance one-handed as if you were mounted, and you deal double damage with a lance while charging.
Feat.Prereq: Centaur (or any tauric creature at the GM's discretion)

Feat.Name: Lastwall Phalanx
Feat.Description: When battling the terrifying hordes of Belkzen, you find strength in your shield brothers and sisters.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a sacred bonus to your AC against the attacks of evil creatures and a sacred bonus to saves against the spells and abilities of evil creatures equal to the number of adjacent allies who also have this feat.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +3, good alignment.

Feat.Name: LastwallPhalanx
Feat.Description: When battling the terrifying hordes of Belkzen, you find strength in your shield brothers and sisters.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a sacred bonus to your AC against the attacks of evil creatures and a sacred bonus to saves against the spells and abilities of evil creatures equal to the number of adjacent allies who also have this feat.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +3, good alignment.

Feat.Name: Legacy of Ozem
Feat.Description: Your purity is so great that the blades and bows of long-forgotten heroes sing to you as if they had been made for your righteous hands.
Feat.Benefit: When using good-aligned weapons, including those under the effects of a bless weapon spell, you gain a +1 sacred bonus on damage rolls.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +5, good alignment.

Feat.Name: Peacemaker
Feat.Description: Your words of peace ring true and are much more difficult for others to resist.
Feat.Benefit: The DC to resist spells you cast to ensure peace or force aggressive creatures to become peaceful increases by +2. This affects spells that dissuade creatures from aggressive actions without exerting long-term or absolute control over them, and without le
Feat.Prereq: Charisma 13, good alignment.

Feat.Name: Siphon Poison
Feat.Description: You can remove poison from afflicted creatures.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, you can remove an injury poison from a helpless or willing creature's bloodstream with a successful Heal check. The DC of this check is equal to the poison's DC. You can only draw out poison in this way within the first 2 rounds of

Feat.Name: Worldwound Walker
Feat.Description: Your purity always remains a blessing, even when you're surrounded by creatures that despise it.
Feat.Benefit: You can alter the essence of your being to lessen the effects of spells designed to harm good creatures. When affected by spells and effects that behave differently according to alignment (such as unholy word or protection from good), you can choose wheth
Feat.Prereq: 5 or more Hit Dice, good alignment.

Feat.Name: Dark Sight
Feat.Description: With further modification, your eyes can pierce the gloom of even magical darkness.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the ability to see up to 15 feet clearly in magical darkness, such as that created by the deeper darkness spell.
Feat.Prereq: Gloom Sight, fetchling.

Feat.Name: Gloom Sight
Feat.Description: With a combination of strange shadow magic and chirurgery, your eyes are permanently modified to see farther in darkness.
Feat.Benefit: You gain darkvision 90 ft., but gain the light sensitivity weakness (Bestiary 301).

Feat.Name: Gloom Strike
Feat.Description: Few creatures are as accustomed to fighting in the shadows as you.
Feat.Benefit: When you are within an area of dim light or darkness, you gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls against enemies that are also within dim light or darkness.
Feat.Prereq: Blind-Fight, fetchling.

Feat.Name: Improved Dark Sight
Feat.Description: With further modification, your eyes see clearly in not only normal darkness, but in magical darkness as well.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the see in darkness ability (Bestiary 2 301) and lose the light sensitivity weakness, but gain the light blindness weakness (Bestiary 301).
Feat.Prereq: Dark Sight, Gloom Sight, fetchling.

Feat.Name: Shadow Ghost
Feat.Description: You can move between the Shadow Plane and the Material Plane more often.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the ability to use shadow walk an additional time each day.
Feat.Prereq: Fetchling, shadow walk spell-like ability.

Feat.Name: Shadow Walker
Feat.Description: You can pierce the veil between the Shadow Plane and the Material Plane more often, and to greater effect.
Feat.Benefit: You can expend one use of your shadow walk spell-like ability to use dimension door as a spell-like ability. Your start and end locations for this ability must be in dim light or darkness.
Feat.Prereq: Fetchling, shadow walk spell-like ability.

Feat.Name: Burn! Burn! Burn!
Feat.Description: You take the goblin love of arson and fire play to a whole new level.
Feat.Benefit: You deal an extra 1d4 points of fire damage when you attack with fire from an alchemical or nonmagical source (such as with alchemical fire or torches) and gain a +4 competence bonus on Ref lex saving throws made to avoid catching on fire or to put yourse
Feat.Prereq: Disable Device 1 rank, goblin.

Feat.Name: Fire Hand
Feat.Description: Born with a torch in your hand, you have a gift with anything that burns.
Feat.Benefit: You can wield a torch as a weapon without taking the nonproficient penalty and gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls with melee weapons that deal fire damage.

Feat.Name: Fire Tamer
Feat.Description: You know your way around even magical fire.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on saves against spells with the fire descriptor. Additionally, your scars mark you as a talented fire tamer, granting you a +2 circumstance bonus on Diplomacy and Intimidate checks when dealing with other goblins.

Feat.Name: Flame Heart
Feat.Description: You have mastered fire magic and alchemy.
Feat.Benefit: You gain fire resistance 5. When casting spells with the fire descriptor or throwing alchemist bombs that deal fire damage, treat your caster level or alchemist level as if you were 1 level higher.
Feat.Prereq: Fire Tamer, character level 5th, goblin.

Feat.Name: Goblin Gunslinger
Feat.Description: You have learned how to fire the big guns.
Feat.Benefit: You can wield Medium firearms without taking the penalty for an inappropriately sized weapon.

Feat.Name: Tangle Feet
Feat.Description: Creatures who cross your path find themselves tripping over their own feet.
Feat.Benefit: When you successfully make an Acrobatics check to avoid provoking an attack of opportunity from a larger opponent when you move through its threatened area or its space, you can make that opponent lose its balance until the end of its next turn as a free
Feat.Prereq: Dodge, Mobility, Underfoot (Advanced Player's Guide 173), goblin, Small size or smaller.

Feat.Name: Deafening Explosion
Feat.Description: Your bombs explode with deafening force.
Feat.Benefit: You may reduce your bomb damage by one die to give it the ability to deafen the creature struck by it. The bomb must deal fire, force, or sonic damage. If a creature takes a direct hit from your bomb, it must make a saving throw against the bomb's DC or b
Feat.Prereq: Bomb class feature, hobgoblin.

Feat.Name: Demoralizing Lash
Feat.Description: You cow your enemies with the lash of a whip.
Feat.Benefit: To use this feat, you must use a whip (or another weapon in the flails fighter weapon group) to attack a foe demoralized by an Intimidate check. If the attack hits, you extend the duration the creature is shaken by 1 round. This feat has no effect on crea
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, Intimidate 1 rank, hobgoblin.

Feat.Name: Focusing Blow
Feat.Description: You and your allies work together to shake off mental effects.
Feat.Benefit: An ally who also has this feat can deal damage to you in order to break an ongoing mind-affecting effect that allows a saving throw. The ally must cause at least 5 points of damage to you with an attack, spell, or other ability. You then reroll your savin
Feat.Prereq: Hobgoblin Discipline, hobgoblin.

Feat.Name: Hobgoblin Discipline
Feat.Description: The presence of other hobgoblins bolsters your resolve.
Feat.Benefit: While you are within 30 feet of at least two other hobgoblins, you gain a +1 morale bonus on saving throws.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, hobgoblin.

Feat.Name: Taskmaster
Feat.Description: You intimidate weaker allies into reckless ferocity.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you spur an ally, who must have fewer Hit Dice than yourself, to reckless effort. For 1 minute, the ally gains a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls, weapon damage rolls, and Will saves against mind-affecting effects. However, the ally a
Feat.Prereq: Demoralizing Lash, Intimidate 5 ranks, hobgoblin.

Feat.Name: Terrorizing Display
Feat.Description: Your battle prowess frightens friend and foe alike.
Feat.Benefit: When you use Dazzling Display, in addition to its normal effects, you can use it to spur allies within 30 feet as if you had used the Taskmaster feat. Use the same Intimidate check to determine the effects of Dazzling Display and this feat.
Feat.Prereq: Dazzling Display, Demoralizing Lash, Taskmaster, Weapon Focus, Intimidate 10 ranks, hobgoblin, proficiency with selected weapon.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Dazzling Display, Demoralizing Lash, Taskmaster, Weapon Focus

Feat.Name: Blazing Aura
Feat.Description: An inferno rages inside you, causing your body to radiate intense heat.
Feat.Benefit: When you use Scorching Weapons, on your turn as a free action, you may create an aura of heat that lasts for 1 round. This aura deals 1d6 points of fire damage to any creature that begins its turn adjacent to you.
Feat.Prereq: Inner Flame, Scorching Weapons, character level 13th, ifrit.

Feat.Name: Blistering Feint
Feat.Description: Your foes flinch from the heat of your weapon, giving you an opportunity to slip past their defenses.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on feint checks made while wielding a weapon that deals fire damage. Anytime you successfully feint a creature while using such a weapon, you may deal its fire damage to the enemy.
Feat.Prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Feint, ifrit.

Feat.Name: Elemental Jaunt
Feat.Description: The spirits of your ancestral home call to you, beckoning you to return.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you can cast plane shift as a spell-like ability with a caster level equal to your level to transport yourself and willing targets to an elemental plane that is appropriate to your race (ifrits to the Plane of Fire, oreads to the Plane of Ea
Feat.Prereq: Character level 15th, ifrit, oread, sylph, or undine.

Feat.Name: Firesight
Feat.Description: Fire no longer blinds you, and smoke conceals nothing from your gaze.
Feat.Benefit: You can see through fire and smoke without penalty, ignoring any cover or concealment bonuses from fire and smoke. This does not allow you to see anything you could not otherwise see (for example, invisible creatures are still invisible). You are immune t

Feat.Name: Inner Flame
Feat.Description: Your body generates so much heat that your mere touch scorches your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: Your bonus on saves against fire attacks and spells with the fire descriptor or light descriptor increases to +4. When you use Scorching Weapons, the affected weapons deal an additional 1d6 points of fire damage instead of 1, and when you are grappling, y
Feat.Prereq: Scorching Weapons, character level 7th, ifrit.

Feat.Name: Scorching Weapons
Feat.Description: Elemental fire stirs within your body, boiling your blood and rendering you resistant to flame.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against fire attacks and spells with the fire descriptor or light descriptor. As a swift action, you can make up to two held manufactured metallic weapons become red-hot for 1 round, dealing 1 additional point of fire

Feat.Name: Draconic Aspect
Feat.Description: You possess some of the qualities of your dragon ancestors.
Feat.Benefit: Your scales take on the color and some of the resistances of one of the chromatic dragons. Choose one of the following chromatic dragon types: black (acid), blue (electricity), green (acid), red (fire), or white (cold). Your scales take on the color of th

Feat.Name: Draconic Breath
Feat.Description: You possess draconic defenses and a draconic breath weapon.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus against sleep and paralysis effects. You gain a breath weapon that is determined by your scale coloration by either the Draconic Aspect feat or the dragon-scaled racial trait. Using a breath weapon is a standard action that does not pr
Feat.Prereq: Draconic Aspect, kobold.

Feat.Name: Draconic Glide
Feat.Description: You possess draconic defenses and wings that allow you to glide.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus against sleep and paralysis effects. You grow a pair of wings that you can use to fall and glide at a safe pace. You can make a DC 15 Fly check to fall safely from any height without taking falling damage, as if using feather fall. Whe
Feat.Prereq: Draconic Aspect, kobold.

Feat.Name: Draconic Paragon
Feat.Description: You can shrug off sleep and paralysis effects as well as any dragon, and your draconic aspects improve.
Feat.Benefit: You gain an additional +2 bonus against sleep and paralysis effects. You can use your breath weapon twice per day and your breath weapon damage increases to 4d6 points of energy damage. Your wings from the Draconic Glide feat grow stronger, granting you a
Feat.Prereq: Draconic Aspect, either Draconic Breath or Draconic Glide, character level 10th, kobold.

Feat.Name: Kobold Ambusher
Feat.Description: You are adept at moving fast and staying hidden.
Feat.Benefit: You take no penalty on Stealth checks when you move up to your full speed. You can use the run or charge action and remain hidden, taking a -10 penalty on the check to do so.
Feat.Prereq: Stealth 4 ranks, kobold.

Feat.Name: Kobold Sniper
Feat.Description: You snipe quickly, making it harder for others to find the location of your attack.
Feat.Benefit: When you are sniping, you only take a -10 penalty on your Stealth checks to stay hidden.
Feat.Prereq: Stealth 1 rank, kobold.

Feat.Name: Tail Terror
Feat.Description: You have strengthened your tail enough to make slap attacks with it.
Feat.Benefit: You can make a tail slap attack with your tail. This is a secondary natural attack that deals 1d4 points of bludgeoning damage. Furthermore, you can augment your tail slap attack with a kobold tail attachment. For the purpose of weapon feats, you are cons
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, kobold.

Feat.Name: Born Alone
Feat.Description: You are so tough and vicious that you killed and ate the rest of your litter while still in the womb.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you kill or knock unconscious an opponent with a melee attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution bonus (minimum 1) until your next turn. These temporary hit points do not stack. You do not gain this bonus if the opponent is

Feat.Name: Bullying Blow
Feat.Description: With a simple hit, you more easily intimidate an opponent.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you may make a melee attack with a -2 penalty on the attack roll. If the attack damages your opponent, you may make an Intimidate check to demoralize that opponent as a free action.
Feat.Prereq: Intimidate 1 rank, orc.

Feat.Name: Ferocious Action
Feat.Description: You ferocity is quick but shorter lived.
Feat.Benefit: When you fall to 0 hit points or fewer, you lose 2 hit points each round, but you are not staggered. If you are in a rage (such as that caused by the barbarian rage class feature), you instead only lose 1 hit point per round.
Feat.Prereq: Ferocity racial trait, orc.

Feat.Name: Foment the Blood
Feat.Description: You can unleash a wave of energy that drives orcs into a frenzy.
Feat.Benefit: When you channel energy, instead of creating its normal effect, you can give orcs a bonus on weapon damage and critical hit conf irmation rolls until your next turn. This bonus is equal to the number of dice your channeled energy normally heals or harms.
Feat.Prereq: Channel energy class feature, orc.

Feat.Name: Grudge Fighter
Feat.Description: You feel great anger at anyone who dares to attack you, and this fury makes your own attacks that much stronger.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 morale bonus on attack and damage rolls made against any creature that attacked you in the current combat.

Feat.Name: Orc Weapon Expertise
Feat.Description: You can do more with the weapons orcs favor the most.
Feat.Benefit: When you take this feat, choose one of the benefits below. Whenever you wield a weapon that has orc in its name, you gain the benefit you chose so long as you are actually proficient with that weapon. Bully: Gain a +1 bonus on damage rolls against creatur
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1, orc.

Feat.Name: Resolute Rager
Feat.Description: Fear passes quickly while you are raging.
Feat.Benefit: While raging, when under the effect of a fear effect that allows a saving throw, you can make a new saving throw against that fear effect at the start of each of your turns before acting. If you make the new save, the fear effect ends.
Feat.Prereq: Orc, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Reverse-Feint
Feat.Description: You can goad an opponent into attacking you in order to make your counter attack all the more powerful.
Feat.Benefit: As a move action, you can leave a gap in your defenses for one adjacent opponent to use. If the opponent attacks you on its next turn, it gains a +4 bonus on its attack roll. Whether or not the opponent successfully hits, you may attack it as an immediate
Feat.Prereq: Toughness, base attack bonus +1, orc.

Feat.Name: Trap Wrecker
Feat.Description: You can smash traps instead of disarming them.
Feat.Benefit: You can attempt to disarm a trap by striking it with a melee weapon instead of making a Disable Device check. As a full-round action, make a melee attack against an Armor Class equal to the trap's Disable Device DC. If you miss, the trap activates. If you
Feat.Prereq: Power Attack, Disable Device 1 rank, orc.

Feat.Name: Dwarf Blooded
Feat.Description: You have dwarven blood coursing through your veins.
Feat.Benefit: Your dwarven heritage manifests in two ways. First, your speed is never modified by armor or encumbrance, as the dwarf slow and steady racial trait. Second, you gain the stonecunning dwarf racial trait.

Feat.Name: Echoes of Stone
Feat.Description: Your senses are keener among the rocks and stones.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +4 racial bonus on Perception checks underground, and on Survival checks to avoid becoming lost in caverns and rocky areas.

Feat.Name: Murmurs of Earth
Feat.Description: The earth opens up her secrets to your perceptions.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a limited form of tremorsense. As a move action, you become aware of all creatures within 15 feet that are in contact with the ground at that moment.
Feat.Prereq: Echoes of Stone, character level 9th, oread.

Feat.Name: Oread Burrower
Feat.Description: The ground parts for you at the slightest touch, allowing you to dig with great speed.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a burrow speed equal to 1/2 your base speed. You can burrow through sand, dirt, clay, gravel, or similar materials, but not solid stone. You do not leave a hole behind, nor is your passage marked on the surface.
Feat.Prereq: Stony Step, character level 9th, oread.

Feat.Name: Oread Earth Glider
Feat.Description: The earth welcomes you, showing you the secret paths through sand and soil.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the earth glide universal monster ability and can use it to travel at your full base speed through sand, dirt, clay, gravel, or similar materials. If protected against fire damage, you can even burrow through lava. You can burrow through solid st
Feat.Prereq: Oread Burrower, Stony Step, character level 13th, oread.

Feat.Name: Stony Step
Feat.Description: The earth recognizes its kinship with you and does not impede your movement.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you move, you may move through 5 feet of earth- or stone-based difficult terrain (rubble, stone stairs, and so on) each round as if it were normal terrain. The effects of this feat stack with similar feats such as Acrobatic Steps and Nimble Moves

Feat.Name: Burrowing Teeth
Feat.Description: You have teeth and claws that suit you well to digging.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a burrow speed equal to 1/2 your base speed. You can burrow through sand, dirt, clay, gravel, or similar materials, but not solid stone. You do not leave a hole behind, nor is your passage marked on the surface.
Feat.Prereq: Sharpclaw, Tunnel Rat, ratfolk.

Feat.Name: Sharpclaw
Feat.Description: Your nails are large and strong.
Feat.Benefit: You gain two claw attacks. These are primary natural attacks that deal 1d4 points of damage.

Feat.Name: Tunnel Rat
Feat.Description: You are a master of fighting in confined spaces.
Feat.Benefit: You count as one size smaller than normal for the purpose of squeezing.
Feat.Prereq: Ratfolk, swarming racial trait.

Feat.Name: Airy Step
Feat.Description: The air responds to your innate elemental nature, protecting you from harm and cushioning your falls.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against effects with the air or electricity descriptors and effects that deal electricity damage. You may ignore the first 30 feet of any fall when determining falling damage.

Feat.Name: Cloud Gazer
Feat.Description: Your insight into your elemental heritage gives you a clarity of sight few humans possess.
Feat.Benefit: You can see through fog, mist, and clouds, without penalty, ignoring any cover or concealment bonuses from such effects. If the effect is created by magic, this feat instead triples the distance you can see without penalty.

Feat.Name: Inner Breath
Feat.Description: Your body is suffused with elemental air that provides for all your respiratory needs.
Feat.Benefit: You no longer need to breathe. You are immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poison). This does not give you immunity to cloud or gas attacks that do not require breathing, such as cloudkill.
Feat.Prereq: Character level 11th, sylph.

Feat.Name: Wings of Air
Feat.Description: The winds lift you, carrying you where you want to go.
Feat.Benefit: Your bonus on saves against effects with the air or electricity descriptors and effects that deal electricity damage increases to +4. In addition, you gain a supernatural fly speed equal to your base speed (good maneuverability). You may only fly with thi
Feat.Prereq: Airy Step, character level 9th, sylph.

Feat.Name: Blood Beak
Feat.Description: Your bleed attack is bloody and dangerous.
Feat.Benefit: Increase the damage of your beak attack to 1d6. Furthermore, when you confirm a critical hit with your beak attack, you also deal 1 point of bleed damage.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +5, natural weapon racial trait, tengu.

Feat.Name: Carrion Feeder
Feat.Description: Like many scavengers, you can stomach foods that would make weaker creatures ill.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against diseases and ingested poisons (but not other poisons). You receive a +2 bonus on Survival skill checks to find food for yourself (and only yourself ).

Feat.Name: Long-Nose Form
Feat.Description: You can shift into the form of a human with an unusually long nose.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you can assume the form of a human whose nose is the length of your beak. This spell-like ability functions as alter self with a caster level equal to your level. While in this form you gain the scent ability and a +2 bonus to your Strength
Feat.Prereq: Character level 3rd, tengu.

Feat.Name: Scavenger's Eye
Feat.Description: Your gaze is naturally drawn to valuable glittering objects.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Appraise checks. You may determine the most valuable item in a hoard as a standard action and gain an additional +2 bonus on the Appraise check to do so. In addition, if you fail an Appraise check by 5 or more, you treat the check a

Feat.Name: Tengu Raven Form
Feat.Description: You can shift into the form of a giant black raven.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you can take the form of a Large black bird resembling a raven, granting you a fly speed of 60 feet (good maneuverability), a +4 size bonus to your Strength, a -2 penalty to your Dexterity, and a +4 natural armor bonus. This spell-like abili
Feat.Prereq: Tengu Wings, character level 7th, tengu.

Feat.Name: Tengu Wings
Feat.Description: You can grow wings that allow you to fly.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you can sprout a pair of giant black crow's wings, granting you a fly speed of 30 feet (average maneuverability). This spell-like ability otherwise functions as beast shape I (though you do not gain any other benefits of that spell) with a c
Feat.Prereq: Character level 5th, tengu.

Feat.Name: Armor of the Pit
Feat.Description: Your fiendish traits take the form of a protective scaly skin.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 natural armor bonus.

Feat.Name: Expanded Fiendish Resistance
Feat.Description: You gain extra fiendish resistances.
Feat.Benefit: Pick one of the following energy types that you do not already have resistance to: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. You gain resistance 5 to that energy type.

Feat.Name: Fiend Sight
Feat.Description: Your eyes develop keener sight in dim light and darkness.
Feat.Benefit: You gain low-light vision and your darkvision improves to 120 ft.
Feat.Prereq: Darkvision 60 ft., tiefling.

Feat.Name: Grasping Tail
Feat.Description: Your tail becomes more useful.
Feat.Benefit: You can use your tail to grab stowed items. While you cannot wield weapons with your tail, you can use it to retrieve small, stowed objects carried on your person as a swift action.

Feat.Name: Aquatic Ancestry
Feat.Description: You favor your outsider ancestry and are better adapted to life in the water.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the amphibious special quality. Your swim speed increases by +10 feet.

Feat.Name: Hydraulic Maneuver
Feat.Description: You can use your hydraulic push to disarm or trip.
Feat.Benefit: You may use hydraulic push to attempt a bull rush, disarm, dirty trick (blind or dazzle, see Advanced Player's Guide), or trip combat maneuver. Each time you use hydraulic push, you must decide which of the allowed combat maneuvers you want to perform. Yo
Feat.Prereq: Hydraulic push spell-like ability, undine.

Feat.Name: Steam Caster
Feat.Description: You imbue your fire spells with elemental water, transforming them into powerful gouts of steam.
Feat.Benefit: You may increase the casting time of a fire spell to a full-round action, infusing it with elemental power (spells with a casting time of 1 full-round action or longer do not have an increased casting time). The spell is treated as if it had the water des

Feat.Name: Triton Portal
Feat.Description: You can channel your inner magic to summon allies.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you may expend your racial hydraulic push ability to instead cast summon nature's ally III as a spell-like ability with a caster level equal to your character level. This use of the ability can only summon a Small water elemental or 1d3 dolp
Feat.Prereq: Character level 5th, hydraulic push spell-like ability, undine.

Feat.Name: Water Skinned
Feat.Description: Your touch extinguishes small flames.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can extinguish a small nonmagical fire with a touch, affecting anything up to the size of a large campfire. This ability does not affect fires with a total area greater than 5 square feet. Touching the fire in this way does not h

Feat.Name: Mother's Gift
Feat.Description: You inherit a special boon from your hag parent.
Feat.Benefit: Your dark legacy manifests in one of the following ways. You choose the manifestation when you choose the feat, and once selected it cannot be changed. Hag Claws (Ex): You gain a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with your claws. Surprisingly Tough (Ex)

Feat.Name: Giant Steps
Feat.Description: When enlarged, your speed increases.
Feat.Benefit: When your size increases to Large or larger, your base speed increases by 20 feet. This increase applies only if the effect that changed your size does not alter your speed.
Feat.Prereq: Duergar, slow and steady racial trait.

Feat.Name: Lingering Invisibility
Feat.Description: You remain brief ly translucent after losing invisibility.
Feat.Benefit: When your invisibility ends, you gain concealment for 1 round per minute of duration the invisibility effect had remaining (minimum 1 round). This only occurs if the invisibility is from your racial spell-like ability or a spell you cast. Effects that neg

Feat.Name: Agile Tongue
Feat.Description: Your long pink tongue is capable of manipulating small items and even stealing objects.
Feat.Benefit: You have a prehensile tongue with a range of 10 feet. You can pick up items weighing no more than 5 pounds, make Sleight of Hand checks, perform the steal or disarm combat maneuvers, or make melee touch attacks with your tongue.

Feat.Name: Magical Tail
Feat.Description: You grow an extra tail that represents your growing magical powers.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a new spell-like ability, each usable twice per day, from the following list, in order: disguise self, charm person, misdirection, invisibility, suggestion, displacement, confusion, dominate person. For example, the first time you select this fea

Feat.Name: Realistic Likeness
Feat.Description: When you are in human form, you can take the shape of a specific individual.
Feat.Benefit: You can precisely mimic the physical features of any individual you have encountered. When you use your racial change shape ability, you can attempt to take the form of an individual, granting you a +10 circumstance bonus on Disguise checks made to fool o

Feat.Name: Sea Hunter
Feat.Description: Your blows knock swimming opponents off balance.
Feat.Benefit: When you make a successful melee attack against a swimming target, as a free action you can attempt to knock the target off balance. Treat this as a trip combat maneuver. If you succeed, the target is considered off balance (see Table 13-7: Combat Adjustm
Feat.Prereq: Combat Expertise, merfolk.

Feat.Name: Spit Venom
Feat.Description: You have mastered the nagaji warrior technique of spitting venom into your opponent's eyes.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, you can spit poison up to 10 feet as a ranged touch attack. If you hit, the target must make a successful Fortitude save or be blinded for 1d6 rounds. The DC of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your total Hit Dice + your Constitution

Feat.Name: Life's Blood
Feat.Description: Your blood flows with eternal life, and its healing powers allow you use your blood to heal others.
Feat.Benefit: At will as a full-round action, you may perform a special bloodletting ritual through which you sacrifice some of your own vitality to heal another creature. When using this feat, you take 1d4 points of damage and apply your blood to the wounds of a livin

Feat.Name: Fury's Fall
Feat.Description: You can use strength and agility to send foes crashing to the ground.
Feat.Benefit: When making a trip attack, add your Dexterity bonus to your CMB.
Feat.Prereq: Improved Trip.

Feat.Name: Fury's Snare
Feat.Description: You entangle your foe in your weapon.
Feat.Benefit: If you successfully use a whip to trip a foe, you can choose to drop your whip. Your tripped target gains the entangled condition. The target can break free of the whip by making a DC 10 Strength check or a DC 15 Escape Artist check (add the enhancement b
Feat.Prereq: Fury's Fall, Improved Trip.

Feat.Name: Hamatula Grasp
Feat.Description: You deal terrible damage to impaled foes.
Feat.Benefit: When attacking an impaled opponent (see Hamatula Strike) with the weapon that impales them, you only suffer a -2 penalty to your grapple check. If the check succeeds, you deal an extra 1d6 damage.
Feat.Prereq: Hamatula Strike, Improved Grapple, Strength 13, base attack bonus +9.

Feat.Name: Hamatula Strike
Feat.Description: You can catch your opponents on your weapon and hold them in place.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you damage an opponent with a piercing weapon, you can immediately make a grapple check; success means the opponent is impaled on your weapon and you both gain the grappled condition. While the opponent is impaled, as an attack action you may mak
Feat.Prereq: Improved Grapple, Strength 13, Base Attack Bonus +7.

Feat.Name: Hellcat Pounce
Feat.Description: You attack unsuspecting foes twice.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you attack and damage an opponent in the surprise round, you may immediately make a second attack against the same opponent using the same attack bonus. The target is not considered flat-footed against this second attack.
Feat.Prereq: Hellcat Stealth, Skill Focus (Stealth), sneak attack +2d6.

Feat.Name: Hellcat Stealth
Feat.Description: You are difficult to see in the light.
Feat.Benefit: You may make Stealth checks in normal or bright light even when observed, but at a -10 penalty.
Feat.Prereq: Skill Focus (Stealth), Stealth 6 ranks.

Feat.Name: Osyluth Guile
Feat.Description: You are skilled at misdirecting an opponent's attacks.
Feat.Benefit: While you are fighting defensively or using the total defense action, select one opponent. Add your Charisma bonus to your AC as a dodge bonus against that opponent's melee attacks until your next turn. You cannot use this feat if you cannot see the selec
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 8 ranks, Dodge.

Feat.Name: Bounding Hammer
Feat.Description: You can throw a hammer so it rebounds near you.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you may throw a hammer at an opponent within 20 feet. If you hit (whether or not the attack damages the target), the hammer rebounds off of the creature and lands in your square. If you have the Snatch Arrows feat, you may choose to
Feat.Prereq: Proficiency with hammer, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Darting Viper
Feat.Description: When using a dorn-dergar, you can quickly attack both near and distant foes.
Feat.Benefit: You may change whether you're using the dorndergar as a normal or reach weapon as a swift action.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +4, proficiency with the dwarven dorn-dergar.

Feat.Name: Dorn-Dergar Master
Feat.Description: You can use a dorn-dergar with only one hand.
Feat.Benefit: You can use a dorn-dergar as a one-handed weapon. When using it one-handed, changing whether it's a normal or reach weapon is a full-round action. If you have the Darting Viper feat, changing its reach is a move action.
Feat.Prereq: Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +4, proficiency with the dwarven dorn-dergar.

Feat.Name: Sliding Axe Throw
Feat.Description: You may aim your thrown axe to avoid an enemy's shield and even trip your opponent.
Feat.Benefit: You can choose to take a -2 penalty on a ranged attack roll with an axe, bouncing it or sliding it along the ground. If the target is flat-footed, running, or charging, this attack ignores any bonuses to the target's AC from its shield. If the attack hits
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Stance of the Xorn
Feat.Description: You have heightened awareness of enemies on all sides.
Feat.Benefit: Flanking creatures do not gain a +2 bonus to attack you (this does not prevent you from being sneak attacked or denied your Dexterity bonus). A condition that makes you lose your Dex bonus to AC also makes you lose the benefits of this feat.
Feat.Prereq: Wis 15, base attack bonus +3.

Feat.Name: Arcane School Spirit
Feat.Description: You can talk up the power of your own school of magic to such an extent that creatures find it more difficult to resist your spells.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, you extol the virtues of your school of magic to one creature within 30 feet. Make a Bluff check opposed by a target's Sense Motive check; if you win the check, the target takes a -2 penalty on saving throws made to resist the next
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank, arcane school class feature, gnome.

Feat.Name: Bewildering Koan
Feat.Description: You can pose unanswerable questions that leave creatures momentarily dumbfounded as they dwell on their significance.
Feat.Benefit: As a swift action, spend 1 point from your ki pool and make a Bluff check by asking a creature one of the impossible questions you ponder when meditating. If the creature fails its check, you choose whether it loses its next action or you gain a +2 bonus
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank, ki pool class feature, gnome.

Feat.Name: Blood Ties
Feat.Description: Pointing out your shared kinship with someone gives you the chance to win over creatures associated with your bloodline.
Feat.Benefit: When attempting a Diplomacy check to influence a creature with a plausible connection to your sorcerous bloodline, you may instead make a Bluff check. For example, a gnome sorcerer with the draconic bloodline may use this feat against dragons and their ki
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank, bloodline class feature, gnome.

Feat.Name: Babble-Peddler
Feat.Description: Your talent for flimflam allows you to trick creatures into exchanging valuable objects for whatever junk you happen to offer.
Feat.Benefit: Make a Bluff check to praise the value and worth of an object in your hand while denigrating an object held by a nearby creature; this takes anywhere from 1 round to 1 minute depending on the appearance and nature of the items. If the creature fails its c
Feat.Prereq: Appraise 5 ranks, Bluff 5 ranks, gnome.

Feat.Name: Caustic Slur
Feat.Description: You know exactly how to insult your favored enemies in order to make them lose their heads.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can make a Bluff check against one sort of favored enemy. Any creature of that type within 60 feet of you must make a Will saving throw or become angered. If an affected creature attacks you, it's treated as if it were using Powe
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank, favored enemy class feature, gnome.

Feat.Name: Helpless Prisoner
Feat.Description: You can talk your way out of most restraints.
Feat.Benefit: When you are restrained or imprisoned, you can make a Bluff check against any one creature within 30 feet in which you emphasize both your own harmlessness and the pain or inconvenience of your current condition. If the creature knows you are dangerous, i
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 5 ranks, Escape Artist 1 rank, gnome.

Feat.Name: Invoke Primal Instinct
Feat.Description: You can use your ability to take the shape of an animal to enhance your Bluff skill, giving yourself an aura of danger or meekness that influences nearby creatures into doing what you want.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can pantomime or describe predator- or prey-like behavior, expend one of your uses of wild shape, and make a Bluff check. All creatures within 30 feet that fail a Will save against your Bluff check DC regard you as a figure of ei
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank, wild shape class feature, gnome.

Feat.Name: Tantrum
Feat.Description: Your crying, sputtering, and even frothing at the mouth makes you so laughably incoherent that opponents are apt to dismiss you as a threat.
Feat.Benefit: You may use the Bluff skill to feint while raging. The effect of the feint lasts only until the first time you hit the target.
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank, rage class feature, gnome.

Feat.Name: Witty Feint
Feat.Description: Your blending of conversation and martial prowess makes it difficult for opponents to slip past your guard.
Feat.Benefit: When you successfully feint against an opponent in combat, instead of denying the opponent his Dexterity bonus, you may gain a dodge bonus to your AC against his attacks. This bonus is equal to your weapon training bonus for your current weapon. The bonus
Feat.Prereq: Bluff 1 rank, weapon training class feature, gnome.

Feat.Name: Mounted Blade
Feat.Description: You have learned to use the momentum of your mount to carry your weapon through one foe and into another.
Feat.Benefit: When you use the Ride-By Attack feat, if your attack hits, you may also make an attack against a target adjacent to your original target. This additional attack has a -5 penalty to the attack roll. You may use this feat whether riding a mount or using a f
Feat.Prereq: Ride 3 ranks, Mounted Combat, Ride-By Attack, base attack bonus +1, Qadira affinity

Feat.Name: Elephant Stomp
Feat.Description: You deliver a crushing blow to downed enemies.
Feat.Benefit: When you overrun an opponent and your maneuver check exceeds your opponent's CMD by 5 or more, instead of moving through your opponent's space and knocking her prone, you may stop in the space directly in front of the opponent (or the nearest adjacent spa
Feat.Prereq: Str 13, Power Attack, Improved Overrun, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Jaguar Pounce
Feat.Description: Your ambushes are especially lethal.
Feat.Benefit: When making a charge or using Spring Attack against an opponent who is flat-footed or helpless, you treat your first melee attack against that target as if you had the Improved Critical feat.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +4.

Feat.Name: Monkey Lunge
Feat.Description: You can quickly recover from your lunges, helping you to avoid counterattacks.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can use the Lunge feat to increase the reach of your melee attacks by 5 feet until the end of your turn, without suffering a penalty to your AC. You cannot use this feat if you carry a medium or heavy load.
Feat.Prereq: Lunge, Acrobatics 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Piranha Strike
Feat.Description: You make a combination of quick strikes, sacrificing accuracy for multiple, minor wounds that prove exceptionally deadly.
Feat.Benefit: When wielding a light weapon, you can choose to take a -1 penalty on all melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to gain a +2 bonus on all melee damage rolls. This bonus to damage is halved (-50%) if you are making an attack with an off-hand weapon
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Finesse, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Rhino Charge
Feat.Description: Your charges are both violent and unpredictable.
Feat.Benefit: You may ready a charge, though you may only move up to your speed on the charge.
Feat.Prereq: Power Attack, Improved Bull Rush, base attack bonus +5.

Feat.Name: Critical Conduit
Feat.Description: You are deadly when delivering your master's magic.
Feat.Benefit: When delivering a touch spell for your master, the critical threat range of your touch attack is doubled. This feat does not stack with Improved Critical or other effects that increase critical threat range.
Feat.Prereq: Deliver touch spells ability, familiar.

Feat.Name: Extra Item Slot
Feat.Description: You are able to wear magic items more easily than other creatures of your kind.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one magic item slot not normally available to creatures with your shape. You can now use magic items in that slot.
Feat.Prereq: Non-humanoid body shape.

Feat.Name: Familiar Focus
Feat.Description: You are closely connected to your master's powers.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever your master targets you with a harmless spell or spell-like ability, your master's effective caster level for the effect is increased by 1.

Feat.Name: Familiar Spell
Feat.Description: You can imbue your familiar with a spell.
Feat.Benefit: You can transfer a prepared spell to your familiar, allowing the familiar to cast that spell at a later time. Variables that rely on caster level function according to your caster level, not your familiar's Hit Dice, though your familiar's Intelligence ma
Feat.Prereq: Spellcaster with familiar class feature.

Feat.Name: Jumper
Feat.Description: You are a natural leaper.
Feat.Benefit: You always count as having a running start when making jump checks using Acrobatics. Acrobatics becomes a class skill for you.
Feat.Prereq: Acrobatics 1 rank, creature type other than humanoid or outsider.

Feat.Name: Lithe Attacker
Feat.Description: Your unmatched grace allows you to strike even from the tightest crevices.
Feat.Benefit: You can attack from nooks and crannies, even while using Escape Artist to squeeze through or into a narrow space less than half as wide as your normal space, and you do not lose your Dexterity bonus to AC while using Escape Artist to squeeze through or in
Feat.Prereq: Narrow Frame, Escape Artist 5 ranks, animal or magical beast.

Feat.Name: Master ofYour Kind
Feat.Description: When you speak to other animals of your kind, you can influence them to act according to your wishes and those of your master.
Feat.Benefit: Your master gains a +2 bonus on Handle Animal checks with animals of your kind. In addition, once per day you can use animal messenger, animal trance, or charm animal as a spell-like ability, using your master's caster level but your own Charisma modifier
Feat.Prereq: Familiar, speak with animals of its kind ability.

Feat.Name: Narrow Frame
Feat.Description: Your excellent coordination allows you to maneuver better in close quarters.
Feat.Benefit: You do not take penalties on your attack rolls or to your AC for squeezing through a narrow space that is at least half as wide as your normal space, though each move into or through a narrow space still counts as if it were 2 squares.
Feat.Prereq: Escape Artist 1 rank, animal or magical beast.

Feat.Name: Spell Sponge
Feat.Description: Your mystical connection with your spellcasting master attunes you to helpful magical effects.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever your master targets you with a harmless spell with a target of you the spell's duration is doubled as if modified by the Extend Spell metamagic feat. This does not affect spells with a duration of concentration, instantaneous, or permanent, or sp
Feat.Prereq: Animal companion or familiar, share spells ability.

Feat.Name: Stable Gallop
Feat.Description: You run with a smooth and steady gait.
Feat.Benefit: Your AC penalty when charging is halved. The penalties on ranged attacks made by your rider are reduced by 1 when you take a double move and by 2 when you run (minimum penalty of 0). Your rider gains a +4 bonus on concentration checks caused by your motio
Feat.Prereq: Animal or magical beast.

Feat.Name: Sure-Footed
Feat.Description: Your footing is secure in unstable terrain.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Acrobatics checks to keep your balance and Reflex saves to avoid falling. You can move at a normal speed on steep slopes and stairs and do not risk falling when running or charging downhill.
Feat.Prereq: Quadruped animal or magical beast.

Feat.Name: Valiant Steed
Feat.Description: Your courage is unnaturally strong.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +4 morale bonus on saves against fear and emotion effects. If you can serve as a mount, your rider gains a +4 morale bonus on Handle Animal, Ride, and wild empathy checks to force you within range of a creature with the unnatural aura universal
Feat.Prereq: Animal or magical beast.

Feat.Name: Archon Diversion
Feat.Description: You are able to throw yourself in front of danger to protect your friends.
Feat.Benefit: The penalty to AC for using Archon Style to grant nearby allies a bonus to AC against a single opponent decreases to -1, and you can spend a move action instead of a standard action to use this ability. Once per round while using Archon Style, when you ha
Feat.Prereq: Archon Style, Combat Expertise, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +4 or monk level 4th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Archon Style, Combat Expertise, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Archon Justice
Feat.Description: Your righteous indignation knows no bounds, and foes that attack your companions soon learn the error of their foolish ways.
Feat.Benefit: You no longer take a penalty to AC for using Archon Style to grant nearby allies a bonus to AC against a single opponent, and you can spend a swift action instead of a move action to use this ability. Whenever you take damage from using Archon Diversion t
Feat.Prereq: Archon Diversion, Archon Style, Combat Expertise, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8 or monk level 7th.
Feat.PrereqFeat: Archon Diversion, Archon Style, Combat Expertise, Improved Unarmed Strike

Feat.Name: Archon Style
Feat.Description: You have trained thoroughly to protect your allies from harm, even if it means temporarily sacrificing your own safety in the process.
Feat.Benefit: While using this style, as a standard action, you can actively protect adjacent allies from a single opponent that you are currently adjacent to. This grants any adjacent allies a +2 dodge bonus to AC against that opponent's next melee attack (as long as
Feat.Prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +2 or monk level 2nd.

Feat.Name: Banishing Critical
Feat.Description: With your combination of combat and spellcasting prowess, you send otherworldly monsters back to their place of origin.
Feat.Benefit: When you confirm a critical hit with a slashing or bludgeoning weapon, you may cast dismissal or banishment on that target as an immediate action, and the target takes a -4 penalty on its Will save to resist the spell's effect. You must have dismissal or
Feat.Prereq: Critical Focus, ability to cast dismissal or banishment, caster level 9th.

Feat.Name: Blinding Light
Feat.Description: You use your impenetrable luminescence to disorient harbingers of darkness.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an enemy unsuccessfully attempts to counter or dispel your daylight spell-like ability, it must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Charisma modifier) or become blinded for 1 round as its mind is overwhelm
Feat.Prereq: Inner Light, aasimar, daylight spell-like ability.

Feat.Name: Consecrate Spell
Feat.Description: You infuse spells with heavenly power, drastically increasing their effectiveness against would-be heralds of evil.
Feat.Benefit: A consecrated spell is treated as a maximized spell against evil creatures and creatures with the evil subtype. Against all other creatures, this feat does not modify the spell in any way (for example, a consecrated fireball acts as a normal fireball agai
Feat.Prereq: Aasimar, able to prepare or cast consecrate.

Feat.Name: Inner Light
Feat.Description: Even when your innate powers over light fail you, you and your allies prove vigilant against dark forces, fighting until the end.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you cast your daylight spell-like ability, you do so as if your caster level were one higher. Whenever an enemy successfully counters or dispels your daylight spell-like ability, you and any allies within a 20-foot radius gain darkvision 60 feet
Feat.Prereq: Aasimar, daylight spell-like ability.

Feat.Name: Revered Guidance
Feat.Description: You were selected by your celestial ancestor to be a guide for a chosen people, and serve as a beacon of hope in times of despair.
Feat.Benefit: Select one of the following creature subtypes: dwarf, elf, gnome, halfling, human, or orc. You gain a +4 racial bonus on Diplomacy checks made to influence creatures of the selected subtype.
Feat.Prereq: Aasimar, must be taken at 1st level.

Feat.Name: Sunlit Strike
Feat.Description: Your melee blows deal extra damage to creatures sensitive to light, making you adept at hunting foul monsters of the night.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you successfully hit an enemy that is vulnerable to light (such as by the light blindness, light sensitivity, or sunlight powerlessness universal monster rules) with a melee weapon you've imbued with your Arcane Strike feat, you deal an additiona
Feat.Prereq: Arcane Strike, able to prepare or cast sunlight.

Feat.Name: Supernal Feast
Feat.Description: You sup on the blood of your ancestors to fuel your fury.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to a good outsider that takes bleed or blood drain damage, you gain 1 temporary hit point as you bathe in the celestial being's gore. Furthermore, as a full-round action, you can feast on the fallen body of a good outsider that h
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, aasimar.

Feat.Name: Ancestral Scorn
Feat.Description: The fury you harbor for your fiendish ancestors gives evil outsiders great reason to fear you.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you successfully demoralize an outsider of the evil subtype with an Intimidate check, it becomes sickened for 1 round in addition to being affected by the normal effects of being demoralized. If you beat the DC by 5 or more, the creature is nause
Feat.Prereq: Intimidate 5 ranks, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Banner of Doom
Feat.Description: The mere sight of your fiendish banner is enough to send ripples of fear through your enemies.
Feat.Benefit: As long your banner is clearly visible, all enemies within 60 feet take a -2 penalty on saving throws against fear. This penalty does not stack with other effects that provide enemies with penalties on saving throws against fear.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +8, banner class feature, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Blinding Sneak Attack
Feat.Description: When you strike from the cover of darkness, you inject foes with a fraction of your foul magic.
Feat.Benefit: When you successfully deal sneak attack damage to a foe while you are within an area of magical darkness, you temporarily blind your opponent for 1 round. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + the amount of sneak attack damage dealt) negates this effect.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +5, darkness spell-like ability, sneak attack class feature, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Fiendish Darkness
Feat.Description: You can use your darkness spell-like ability more often.
Feat.Benefit: You can use darkness three times per day as a spell-like ability.
Feat.Prereq: Darkness spell-like ability, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Fiendish Facade
Feat.Description: You are easily mistaken for a member of another race. Your fiendish physical traits are normally hidden by clothing or appear to be markings of another race.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +5 racial bonus on Disguise checks when attempting to impersonate a particular race. You must select the race you are able to impersonate when you select this feat, and thereafter you cannot change the race you have chosen. That race must be Me
Feat.Prereq: Must be taken at 1st level, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Fiendish Resilience
Feat.Description: You dodge energy attacks with amazing agility.
Feat.Benefit: Choose one of the following energy types that you have resistance to: cold, electricity, or fire. Anytime you make a Reflex saving throw against an attack that deals the selected type of energy damage and is subject to your evasion class feature, you gain
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, evasion class feature, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Fury of the Tainted
Feat.Description: The unstoppable anger you feel toward do-gooders and self-proclaimed saints makes you a force to be reckoned with.
Feat.Benefit: While raging, you gain a +4 competence bonus on saving throws made against spells and effects with the good descriptor.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, rage class feature, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Improved Fiendish Darkness
Feat.Description: Your innate ability to shroud others in darkness is further empowered.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to your effective caster level when using your darkness spell-like ability. In addition, whenever you cast a spell with the evil descriptor that targets another creature, you can spend a swift action to apply the effects of your darkne
