Feat.Prereq: Fiendish Darkness, darkness spell-like ability, caster level 3rd, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Improved Fiendish Sorcery
Feat.Description: Your skill with foul sorcery is even more potent than that of others of your race.
Feat.Benefit: If you are a sorcerer and possess the Rakshasa bloodline (Pathfinder RPG Ultimate Magic 68) or Shadow bloodline (Pathfinder RPG Advanced Player's Guide 140), treat your Charisma score as 2 points higher for all sorcerer class abilities.
Feat.Prereq: Fiendish sorcery racial trait, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Improved Fury of the Tainted
Feat.Description: Your hatred for goodness is rivaled only by your ability to repel it.
Feat.Benefit: While raging, you gain spell resistance equal to 10 + your class level against spells with the good descriptor.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Fury of the Tainted, base attack bonus +8, rage class feature, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Monstrous Mask
Feat.Description: Your fiendish physical traits give you a twisted and fearsome appearance that strikes fear into others' hearts.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +5 racial bonus on Intimidate checks made against all creatures of the humanoid type.
Feat.Prereq: Tiefling, must be taken at 1st level.

Feat.Name: Terrifying Mask
Feat.Description: Your fiendish visage has made you a truly terrifying spectacle to behold, and you can force others to betray their feelings with a single look.
Feat.Benefit: Anytime you can make a Sense Motive check to get a hunch or detect whether someone is trustworthy or not, you can choose to instead make an Intimidate check at a -2 penalty. This ability only works on creatures of the humanoid type.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Monstrous Mask, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Wicked Valor
Feat.Description: The fiendish blood that courses through your body causes your wounds to heal faster than usual.
Feat.Benefit: When you regain hit points by resting, you heal double the normal amount of damage. This feat does not stack with items or effects that also affect the amount of damage you recover from while resting. This feat only functions with a full night's rest; com
Feat.Prereq: Con 15, Diehard, Endurance, tiefling.

Feat.Name: Reckless Aim
Feat.Description: Your lack of regard for others proves a boon when you fire projectiles into melee.
Feat.Benefit: When you shoot or throw ranged weapons at an opponent engaged in melee, you can choose to take a -1 penalty to your AC and gain a +2 competence bonus on your attack roll. However, when you roll a natural 1 on a ranged attack roll made with this bonus, you
Feat.Prereq: Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot.

Feat.Name: Conviction
Feat.Description: Your actions are bolstered by divine determination.
Feat.Benefit: When you present to a vampire a holy symbol or other object it is averse to, the DC for the creature to overcome such an aversion increases by 2.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13.

Feat.Name: Hymn Singer
Feat.Description: Your music is infused with your faith.
Feat.Benefit: When using bardic performance, you may choose to play, recite, or sing a religious song or piece of scripture of your faith. Each round of bardic performance you spend in this way, you count as presenting a holy symbol, chanting prayers, or ringing a hand
Feat.Prereq: Bardic performance, good alignment, worshiper of a good deity.

Feat.Name: Life-Dominant Soul
Feat.Description: You gain unusual resiliency from your mortal heritage.
Feat.Benefit: You are healed by channeled positive energy used to heal living creatures and channeled negative energy used to heal undead, but both only heal half the normal amount. You still take damage from positive energy used to harm undead, such as that from chann

Feat.Name: Potent HolySymbol
Feat.Description: In your pious hands, your holy symbol is a shining light of faith.
Feat.Benefit: Any round in which you use your holy symbol as a divine focus for the casting of a spell or to channel positive energy, you count as presenting a holy symbol, chanting prayers, or ringing a hand bell for the purpose of keeping vampires at bay.
Feat.Prereq: Good alignment, worshiper of a good deity.

Feat.Name: SchooledResolve
Feat.Description: Your intensive combat training to fight vampiric forces allows you to fight off their mental spells and effects using your resistance to fear.
Feat.Benefit: You add your bravery bonus on Will saves against mind-affecting spells and effects from vampires. This does not stack with the normal bravery bonus on saves against fear effects.
Feat.Prereq: Bravery class feature.

Feat.Name: Aversion Tolerance
Feat.Description: You have been hunted for so long that you have developed resistances to slayers' usual scare tactics.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on saves made to resist aversions to objects, sounds, and materials appropriate to your vampire type (such as garlic, holy symbols, and mirrors for a moroi). When confronted with such things, you may immediately make a saving throw ins

Feat.Name: Famine Tolerance
Feat.Description: You can abide much longer periods without feeding, and enjoy increased benefits from a meal.
Feat.Benefit: You can go without feeding for a number of days equal to twice your Hit Dice before having to make hunger saves. When you use your blood drain ability, you gain twice the normal amount of temporary hit points for each feeding.
Feat.Prereq: Moroi or nosferatu.

Feat.Name: VampiricCompanion
Feat.Description: Just as your undead existence mocks nature, so too are you granted a twisted companion that reflects the vile nature of vampirism.
Feat.Benefit: Your animal companion or familiar's type changes to undead. The creature gains your vampire or dhampir weaknesses and fast healing 5. If you are a vampire, the creature also gains the following abilities, depending on what type of vampire you are. Jiang-S
Feat.Prereq: Dhampir or vampire, nongood alignment, 10 levels in a class that grants a familiar or animal companion.

Feat.Name: Variant Prayer Scroll
Feat.Description: You have learned the secret to changing the powers granted by your prayer scroll.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the ability to create a different type of prayer scroll. You may create a prayer scroll with this ability by using any strip of parchment and a writing instrument, but doing so requires 10 minutes of uninterrupted work. Swapping your current pray

Feat.Name: Blinding Flash
Feat.Description: You can temporarily blind your opponent by using your weapon or shield to flash sunlight into its eyes.
Feat.Benefit: As a move action, you can expertly angle the blade of your weapon or shield to reflect light into an opponent's eyes, dazzling your foe for 1 round. This feat functions as a gaze attack, and the target must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 your characte
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Disorienting Blow
Feat.Description: When you successfully strike your opponent with your Stunning Fist, you leave it in a state of confusion.
Feat.Benefit: You must choose to use this ability before making an attack roll with your Stunning Fist, and this effect replaces other effects or conditions that would be caused by Stunning Fist. If you successfully hit your opponent and it fails its Fortitude save, it
Feat.Prereq: Stunning Fist, base attack bonus +11.

Feat.Name: Enhanced Ki Throw
Feat.Description: You enhance the force of your ki throws, enabling you to devastate your opponents as you slam them to the ground.
Feat.Benefit: When using the Ki Throw feat, you can expend 1 ki point to amplify the force of your attack. If your ki throw succeeds, when the target hits the ground, it takes damage as if you had hit it with an unarmed strike.
Feat.Prereq: Ki pool class feature, Ki Throw (see the Pathfinder RPG Advanced Player's Guide).

Feat.Name: Feinting Flurry
Feat.Description: Your subtle flourishes mislead your enemy, tricking it into changing its footing.
Feat.Benefit: While using flurry of blows to make melee attacks, you can forgo your first attack to make a Bluff check to feint.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 15, flurry of blows class feature, Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Hold the Blade
Feat.Description: You can take your opponent's weapon after being stabbed in the back.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever an enemy deals damage to you with a melee weapon as part of a flanking attack or sneak attack, you can make a combat maneuver check to disarm against that opponent as an immediate action. You must have at least one hand free when you use this fea
Feat.Prereq: Improved Disarm, base attack bonus +10.

Feat.Name: Improved Feinting Flurry
Feat.Description: Your first melee attack throws your opponent completely off guard.
Feat.Benefit: While using Feinting Flurry, if you successfully feint, your opponent is denied its Dexterity bonus to AC until the end of your turn.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 17, flurry of blows class feature, Combat Expertise, Feinting Flurry, base attack bonus +6.

Feat.Name: Quivering Palm Adept
Feat.Description: Your quivering palm strikes are more potent than most.
Feat.Benefit: Add +2 to the saving throw DC against your quivering palm attacks.
Feat.Prereq: Quivering palm class feature.

Feat.Name: Quivering Palm Versatility
Feat.Description: You can alter the way you apply a quivering palm's vibrations to an opponent's body to cause extreme pain, put it in a coma, or destroy its memories.
Feat.Benefit: After successfully using your quivering palm attack on a creature, you can produce one of the following effects instead of killing the creature, as long as you do so within a number of days equal to your monk level. Coma: The subject falls unconscious and
Feat.Prereq: Quivering palm class feature, base attack bonus +13.

Feat.Name: Sleeper Hold
Feat.Description: By maintaining a grapple hold on your opponent, you can cause it to lose consciousness.
Feat.Benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make a combat maneuver check to maintain a grapple (thus a failed check to maintain the grapple ruins the attempt). If you maintain a grapple for a number of consecutive rounds equal to your opponen
Feat.Prereq: Greater Grapple, base attack bonus +8.

Feat.Name: Stunning Fist Adept
Feat.Description: Your Stunning Fist strikes become even deadlier.
Feat.Benefit: Add +1 to the saving throw DC against your Stunning Fist attacks. This bonus does not stack with feats that grant you bonuses to the DC for saving throws against your Stunning Fist attacks, such as Mantis Style (see Pathfinder RPG Ultimate Combat).
Feat.Prereq: Stunning Fist, base attack bonus +3.

Feat.Name: Arcane Trap Suppressor
Feat.Description: Your magic can suppress magic traps longer than usual.
Feat.Benefit: When you target a magic trap with dispel magic or greater dispel magic, if your caster level check exceeds the Disable Device DC of the trap, the trap is disabled for 1d4 minutes.
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast dispel magic or greater dispel magic as a spell or spell-like ability.

Feat.Name: Close Call
Feat.Description: Your nimble fingers are able to catch small slips before they become big disasters.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day, you may reroll either a Disable Device or Sleight of Hand check. You must decide to use this ability after the first attempt but before the results are revealed by the GM. You must take the second roll, even if it's worse.
Feat.Prereq: Deft Hands.

Feat.Name: Tactical Reposition
Feat.Description: You excel at moving foes right where you want them.
Feat.Benefit: When making a reposition combat maneuver (Pathfinder RPG Advanced Player's Guide 322), you can move an enemy into a trap or other hazardous area, such as a pit, wall scythe, or blade barrier. When you do so, the moved enemy is treated as though it had act
Feat.Prereq: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved RepositionAPG.

Feat.Name: Coaxing Spell
Feat.Description: Your charms and enchantments reach the minds of even the lowliest dungeon denizens.
Feat.Benefit: This feat only works with mind-affecting effects. A coaxing spell affects mindless oozes and vermin as if they weren't mindless, but has no effect on other creature types. A coaxing spell uses a spell slot 2 levels higher than the spell's actual level.
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus (enchantment), Knowledge (dungeoneering) 6 ranks.

Feat.Name: Dampen Presence
Feat.Description: Your habitual stillness makes you difficult to perceive for creatures that use blindsight or blindsense.
Feat.Benefit: You may use the Stealth skill to hide from any creature attempting to perceive you using blindsight or blindsense, even if you are clearly in that creature's perceptual field. This feat does not confer any advantages against other forms of perception, suc
Feat.Prereq: Skill Focus (Stealth), Stealth 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Cursed Item Detection
Feat.Description: Your arcane prowess is so great that even cursed items fail to befuddle you.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on checks made to identify the properties of magic items. In addition, you need only exceed the DC of these checks by 5 in order to determine whether or not an item is cursed.
Feat.Prereq: Spellcraft 5 ranks, ability to cast detect magic as a spell or spell-like ability.

Feat.Name: Ostentatious Display
Feat.Description: Your extravagant jewelry and accessories give you an air of importance you can use to your advantage in many social situations.
Feat.Benefit: As long as you are wearing a valuable nonmagical item in a magic item slot, you gain a +1 bonus on skill checks with a corresponding skill. Bonuses from wearing items in multiple slots that affect the same skill do not stack. Each item must be worth at le

Feat.Name: Torch Handling
Feat.Description: In your grasp, a simple torch becomes a beacon.
Feat.Benefit: You gain three benefits upon taking this feat. First, you treat torches as simple weapons. Second, the radius of normal and increased illumination shed by any torch or mundane light source you carry increases by 10 feet. Finally, once per day you may rero

Feat.Name: Arcane Insight
Feat.Description: Magical insight helps you evade attacks.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you use the Arcane Shield feat, you also gain a +1 insight bonus to your Armor Class for 1 round.
Feat.Prereq: Worshiper of Nethys, Arcane Shield (see the Advanced Player's Guide).

Feat.Name: Bloody Vengeance
Feat.Description: Your retaliatory strikes have long-lasting effects.
Feat.Benefit: If an opponent has damaged you within the past minute, you may study that opponent as a standard action. Thereafter, if you hit that creature with a melee attack, the target takes 1 point of bleed damage each round at the start of its turn. The bleeding c
Feat.Prereq: Worshiper of Calistria, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Measured Response
Feat.Description: You believe that a conservative but consistent response guarantees success.
Feat.Benefit: When you hit an opponent with a melee or ranged attack, you may choose to deal average damage (rounded down), as if you had rolled exactly the average amount on the damage die or dice. You add your damage bonuses and penalties as normal.
Feat.Prereq: Worshiper of Abadar, base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Riptide Attack
Feat.Description: You can follow up a successful trip attempt with a drag maneuver.
Feat.Benefit: When you succeed at a trip combat maneuver, you may automatically make a drag combat maneuver against your tripped target as a swift action. Your base attack bonus for the drag check is the same as the base attack bonus you used for the trip check. The dr
Feat.Prereq: Worshiper of Gozreh, Improved Drag, Improved Trip.

Feat.Name: Spiked Destroyer
Feat.Description: You can attack with your armor spikes while using bull rush or overrun.
Feat.Benefit: When you succeed at a bull rush or overrun combat maneuver, you may automatically make an attack roll with your armor spikes against the target of the maneuver as a swift action. This attack is made using your highest attack bonus.
Feat.Prereq: Worshiper of Gorum, proficient in spiked armor.

Feat.Name: Bloodletting
Feat.Description: When you attack with a piercing or slashing weapon, the wounds you cause bleed profusely.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you threaten a creature with a critical hit with a piercing or slashing weapon (regardless of whether you confirm the critical hit or not), you cause that creature to bleed, making it take 1 point of bleed damage at the beginning of each round th
Feat.Prereq: Worshiper of Zon-Kuthon.

Feat.Name: Aldori Dueling Mastery
Feat.Description: You have mastered the grueling fighting style perfected by the Aldori Swordlords.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Initiative checks as long as you start combat with an Aldori dueling sword in your hand. As long as you wield only a single Aldori dueling sword in one hand, you gain a +2 shield bonus to your AC-if you wield the sword in two hands,
Feat.Prereq: Exotic Weapon Proficiency (Aldori dueling sword), Quick Draw, Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus (Aldori dueling sword).
Feat.PrereqFeat: Exotic Weapon Proficiency (Aldori dueling sword), Quick Draw, Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus (Aldori dueling sword)

Feat.Name: Altitude Affinity
Feat.Description: You have hardened your body against the grueling rigors of surviving at high altitudes.
Feat.Benefit: You are automatically acclimated at high altitudes (Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook 430). In addition, you gain a +2 competence bonus on all Survival checks made at altitudes of 5,000 feet or higher.

Feat.Name: Andoren Falconry
Feat.Description: You know the secret Andoren arts of falconry developed by the Novotnian family of Darkmoon Vale.
Feat.Benefit: You improve your affinity with birds of prey, such as eagles, falcons, hawks, and owls. You gain a +2 bonus on Animal Handling checks made to train or control birds of prey. In addition, if you have a bird of prey as an animal companion, your animal compa
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, Animal Affinity, animal companion class feature.

Feat.Name: Arcane Vendetta
Feat.Description: The mistreatment of your people by an arcane society (such as Numeria's Technic League or the White Witches of Irrisen) has made you particularly eager to inf lict harm on those who use arcane magic.
Feat.Benefit: You deal +2 damage with weapon attacks made against any target you have witnessed casting an arcane spell (not using a spell-like ability) in the last 5 rounds. You must have successfully identified the spell with a Spellcraft check to know without a doub
Feat.Prereq: Spellcraft 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Careful Speaker
Feat.Description: The paranoid terror that comes from living in a region with a dangerous government (such as Cheliax or Galt) has made you unusually aware of what you say.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all Bluff checks made to fool someone or pass secret messages (but not to feint in combat), and a +2 bonus on all Will saves against attempts to scry upon you or read your mind.
Feat.Prereq: Wis 13.

Feat.Name: Cypher Magic
Feat.Description: Your intimacy with runes and the mysteries of ancient arcana has taught you secret ways to draw greater power from magical writings. These unusual methods were initially devised by the Cyphermages of Riddleport, but they have since spread far and wide thr
Feat.Benefit: You cast spells from scrolls at +1 caster level higher than the scroll's caster level. This benefit extends to scrolls that you have created. In addition, you gain a +2 bonus on caster level checks made to activate a scroll with a higher caster level than
Feat.Prereq: Int 15, Scribe Scroll.

Feat.Name: Cypher Script
Feat.Description: Through researching lengthy, ancient, arcane scripts, you have discovered a more efficient method of recording spells. As with the Cypher Magic feat, Cypher Script was originally developed by the Cyphermages of Riddleport, but has been spreading through t
Feat.Benefit: Any spell you scribe in your spellbook costs half as much as normal and takes up only half the room it normally would (round all fractions up). It only takes you 10 minutes per spell level to scribe a spell into your spellbook (5 minutes for cantrips).
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (arcana) 1 rank, Linguistics 1 rank, Spellcraft 1 rank, spellbook class feature.

Feat.Name: Demon Hunter
Feat.Description: You are well-versed in demonic lore.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on Knowledge (planes) checks to know the powers and abilities of demons. You gain a +2 morale bonus on all attack rolls and a +2 morale bonus on caster level checks to penetrate spell resistance made against creatures with the demon su
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (planes) 6 ranks.

Feat.Name: Dervish Dance
Feat.Description: You have learned to turn your speed into power, even with a heavier blade.
Feat.Benefit: When wielding a scimitar with one hand, you can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on melee attack and damage rolls. You treat the scimitar as a one-handed piercing weapon for all feats and class abilities that require such a we
Feat.Prereq: Dexterity 13, Weapon Finesse, Perform (dance) 2 ranks, proficient with scimitar.

Feat.Name: Desert Dweller
Feat.Description: Your time spent living in merciless deserts has granted you resistance to extreme heat, starvation, and thirst.
Feat.Benefit: You treat extreme heat conditions (Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook 444) as severe heat, and severe heat as very hot conditions. You are not impacted at all by very hot conditions. In addition, you gain a +4 bonus on all Constitution checks made to resist the
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Survival 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Desperate Battler
Feat.Description: Your experiences fighting against numerous foes that have already overwhelmed your allies, friends, and family have forced you to excel at fighting on your own.
Feat.Benefit: When no ally is within 10 feet of you and you are not receiving benefits from the aid another action, you gain a +1 morale bonus on melee attack and damage rolls.

Feat.Name: Eye of the Arclord
Feat.Description: Your understanding of the esoteric teachings of the Arclords of Nex allows you to open an eldritch eye that grants you superior perception of the magical world.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day as a standard action, you can open an incandescent third eye upon your forehead. The eye can remain open for 1 minute, during which time you cast all divination spells at +1 caster level (as long as you begin casting the spell before the eye
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (arcana) 4 ranks, ability to cast arcane spells.

Feat.Name: Fey Foundling
Feat.Description: You were found in the wilds as a child, bearing a mark of the First World.
Feat.Benefit: Your strange connection to the First World and the fey infuses you with life, and whenever you receive magical healing, you heal an additional 2 points per die rolled. You gain a +2 bonus on all saving throws against death effects. Unfortunately, you also
Feat.Prereq: You may only select this feat at 1st level.

Feat.Name: Flagbearer
Feat.Description: When brandishing a flag adorned with the standard of an organization you owe allegiance to, you inspire nearby members of the same allegiance.
Feat.Benefit: As long as you hold your clan, house, or party's f lag (see page 293), members of that allegiance within 30 feet who can see the flag (including yourself ) gain a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls, weapon damage rolls, and saving throws against fear and cha
Feat.Prereq: Cha 15.

Feat.Name: Focused Discipline
Feat.Description: Familiarity with the military traditions of your homeland inspires uncommon valor in you.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all saving throws against fear effects. Whenever a fear effect targets you and fails to affect you (either because of a successful saving throw or because of immunity to fear), you gain a +2 morale bonus on attack rolls, weapon dama

Feat.Name: Fortune Teller
Feat.Description: As a result of being raised in a land steeped in tradition and superstition (such as Varisia or Ustalav), you are skilled at communicating with the spirit world.
Feat.Benefit: Upon taking this feat, choose a focus item for your divination magic-a crystal ball, runes, a Harrow deck, or some such item. Whenever you cast a spell from the divination school, you may use this focus item instead of the spell's material component, as l
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast divination spells.

Feat.Name: Free Spirit
Feat.Description: Your strong belief in the value of freedom protects you from mental and physical shackles.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 morale bonus on saving throws made against mind-affecting effects and on all Escape Artist or grapple checks made to escape a grapple or to escape from bonds.
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, any chaotic alignment.

Feat.Name: Godless Healing
Feat.Description: You have mastered a specialized and complex technique to ignore pain by focusing your belief on the self rather than relying on faith.
Feat.Benefit: Once per day when you have half your total hit points or fewer, you may heal yourself of an amount of damage equal to 1d8 plus your total Hit Dice as a move action. This is a supernatural ability.
Feat.Prereq: Cannot have a patron deity.

Feat.Name: Green Faith Acolyte
Feat.Description: You have trained to channel your magical energies in ways that do not harm the natural world around you.
Feat.Benefit: Spells you cast that deal damage, channel negative energy, or otherwise harm life do not hurt normal or magical plants. In addition, whenever you cast a spell that utilizes, heals, or enhances normal or magical plants (such as entangle or plant growth), y
Feat.Prereq: Follower of the Green Faith.

Feat.Name: Hamatulatsu
Feat.Description: You have mastered a deadly fighting form inspired by the hideous attacks of the barbed devil.
Feat.Benefit: Your unarmed attacks can deal either bludgeoning or piercing damage. You decide which type of damage you deal whenever you attack a foe, but you may only choose one type at a time. If you critically hit a foe with your unarmed strike while doing piercing
Feat.Prereq: Improved Unarmed Strike, Weapon Focus (unarmed strike).
Feat.PrereqFeat: Improved Unarmed Strike, Weapon Focus (unarmed strike)

Feat.Name: Harmonic Spell
Feat.Description: You can weave bardic music effects into your spellcasting in such a way that your spellcasting and bardic performance become indistinguishable.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you cast a spell while you are maintaining a bardic performance, you can maintain the bardic performance for that round without expending one of your rounds of performance for the day. In addition, you can switch from one bardic performance to an
Feat.Prereq: Bardic music ability.

Feat.Name: Harrowed
Feat.Description: Numerous Harrow readings early in your life seem to have hit the mark precisely, increasing your belief that you are destined for a specific purpose in life.
Feat.Benefit: You get a +1 bonus on all Will saves made to resist enchantment effects. Once per day, you may draw a card from a Harrow deck you own. At any one time for the rest of that day, you may apply a +2 bonus on any d20 roll modified by the card's suit. For exam

Feat.Name: Hermean Blood
Feat.Description: You are the descendant of someone recruited to Hermea or the bastard result of a Hermean's illicit pairing with someone foreign to that land.
Feat.Benefit: Though you may not know it, the blood of greatness flows in your veins. Pick two skills that share the same associated ability score. Those skills are always considered class skills for you. It's possible that Hermean agents may come looking for you, eith
Feat.Prereq: You may only gain this feat at 1st level.

Feat.Name: Necromantic Affinity
Feat.Description: Long exposure to necromantic energies has granted you a small measure of resistance against them.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on saving throws made to resist spells and effects that utilize negative energy, cause negative levels, or cause ability damage, ability drain, or ability penalties. In addition, damage caused by inf lict spells heals you as if you wer
Feat.Prereq: Con 15.

Feat.Name: Noble Scion
Feat.Description: You are a member of a proud noble family, whether or not you remain in good standing with your family.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all Knowledge (nobility) checks, and that chosen Knowledge skill is always considered a class skill for you. When you select this feat, choose one of the benefits listed below that matches the flavor of your noble family. Work with
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, must be taken at 1st level.

Feat.Name: Rapid Reload
Feat.Description: Choose a type of crossbow (hand, light, heavy) or a single type of one-handed or two-handed firearm that you are proficient with. You can reload such a weapon quickly.
Feat.Benefit: The time required for you to reload your chosen type of weapon is reduced to a free action (for a hand or light crossbow), a move action (for heavy crossbow or onehanded firearm), or a standard action (two-handed firearm). Reloading a crossbow or firearm
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Proficiency (crossbow type chosen) or Exotic Weapon Proficiency (firearm).

Feat.Name: Rugged Northerner
Feat.Description: You live a hard life in a cold climate and gain some benefit from it.
Feat.Benefit: You treat extreme cold conditions (Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook 442) as severe cold, and severe cold as cold weather conditions. You are not impacted at all by normal cold weather conditions. In addition, you do not become fatigued by frostbite or hypothe
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Survival 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Scholar
Feat.Description: You have graduated from one of the many colleges, universities, and specialty schools of higher learning scattered throughout the Inner Sea region.
Feat.Benefit: Pick any two Knowledge skills. You gain a +2 bonus on these two skills. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these Knowledge skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.

Feat.Name: Secret Signs
Feat.Description: You are particularly adept at communicating with others via innuendo, gestures, and secret hand signs.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +4 bonus on Bluff checks made to pass secret messages. In addition, you are adept at hiding the somatic components of spellcasting. If you cast a spell that has only somatic components, an observer must make a Perception check opposed by your S
Feat.Prereq: Int 13.

Feat.Name: Shade of the Uskwood
Feat.Description: Ordained as one of the sinister albino druids who dwell within the heart of the Uskwood, you carry with you into the wider world a powerful effigy of hair, twigs, and blood that crawls with the deepening cold of the Midnight Lord's hallowed hunting ground
Feat.Benefit: Add the following spells to your druid spell list. 0-disrupt undead, ray of frost; 1st-ghost sound, touch of fatigue; 2nd-chill touch, spectral hand; 3rd-ghoul touch, invisibility; 4th-displacement, ray of exhaustion; 5th-animate dead, phantasmal killer;
Feat.Prereq: Neutral evil, patron deity Zon-Kuthon.

Feat.Name: Shrewd Tactician
Feat.Description: Your dealings with pirates, thieves, and assassins have taught you to be exceedingly careful.
Feat.Benefit: Opponents do not gain a +2 bonus on attack rolls for flanking you, although they can still sneak attack you. You also gain a +3 bonus on Sense Motive checks made to resist a foe's Bluff checks to feint in combat.
Feat.Prereq: Alertness, Combat Reflexes.

Feat.Name: Stoic
Feat.Description: You know from firsthand experience that life is a series of unforgiving trials, and that fear itself is something that can be conquered.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on all saving throws against fear effects. If you successfully save against any fear effect, you are immune to further fear effects from that source for 24 hours.
Feat.Prereq: Iron Will.

Feat.Name: Storm-Lashed
Feat.Description: A life spent enduring gales and storms has hardened your body to the elements.
Feat.Benefit: You can ignore many of the effects of severe weather. In rainy conditions, your visibility is only reduced by one-quarter (not by half ) and you only take a -2 penalty on Perception checks. You are treated as if you were one size category larger for the p

Feat.Name: Survivor
Feat.Description: Only the strong thrive in your homeland, and you are no weakling, even among your kin.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +5 bonus on all Constitution checks made to stabilize while dying. Once per day, if you are struck by a critical hit or sneak attack, you can spend an immediate action to negate the critical or the sneak attack damage, making the attack a norma
Feat.Prereq: Con 13, Diehard, Endurance.

Feat.Name: Taldan Duelist
Feat.Description: You trained at one of Taldor's elite fighting schools and are skilled at rondelero, the art of fighting with the falcata (see the Advanced Player's Guide) and buckler.
Feat.Benefit: When fighting with the falcata and buckler, your shield bonus to AC increases by +1 and you gain a +2 bonus on Acrobatics checks.
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Exotic Weapon Proficiency (falcata), Shield Proficiency (buckler), Weapon Focus (falcata).
Feat.PrereqFeat: Exotic Weapon Proficiency (falcata), Shield Proficiency (buckler), Weapon Focus (falcata)

Feat.Name: Totem Spirit
Feat.Description: You are mystically tied to your tribe's sacred totem.
Feat.Benefit: The benefit granted by this feat depends on which Shoanti tribe you belong to: Lyrune-Quah (Moon Clan): You gain a +1 bonus on Will saves and a +2 bonus on Perception checks. Shadde-Quah (Axe Clan): If you have the rage ability, you can rage for 3 additio
Feat.Prereq: Member of a Shoanti tribe.

Feat.Name: Varisian Tattoo
Feat.Description: You bear intricate tattoos that inspire and empower your natural magic ability. These tattoos mark you as a worker of the ancient traditions of Varisian magic. A Varisian tattoo typically consists of a long string of complex characters from the Thassiloni
Feat.Benefit: Select a school of magic (other than divination) in which you have Spell Focus-you cast spells from this school at +1 caster level. Additionally, you gain a single spell-like ability usable up to three times per day. The spelllike ability gained (and its
Feat.Prereq: Spell Focus.

Feat.Name: Wand Dancer
Feat.Description: You are trained in a tradition of Garundi courtesans and court mages that melds dance with the use of magic wands.
Feat.Benefit: When using a spell trigger item, you can move both before and after triggering the item, as long as the total distance moved is not greater than your speed. Choose one creature potentially affected by your spell trigger item. Your movement does not provok
Feat.Prereq: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility, Perform (dance) 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Slaying Sprint
Feat.Description: With swift feet and deadly intent, you finish off your target before anyone sees your blade.
Feat.Benefit: You can move up to half your speed instead of taking a 5-foot step when taking a full-round action to perform a coup de grace. Performing a coup de grace does not provoke attacks of opportunity. You can use this feat only when wielding a light or onehande
Feat.Prereq: Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack, base attack bonus +13

Feat.Name: Greater Serpent Lash
Feat.Description: Your ability to disarm and pull foes off balance with your whip is impressive.
Feat.Benefit: When you make a successful disarm or trip maneuver using the Serpent Lash feat, you can make your additional disarm or trip attempt against any target within your whip's reach. With a reposition maneuver, you can move the target creature to any point with
Feat.Prereq: Serpent Lash, base attack bonus +4

Feat.Name: Serpent Lash
Feat.Description: You are adept at vexing multiple foes with your whip.
Feat.Benefit: As a standard action, you can make a disarm or trip maneuver with your whip. If it succeeds, you can make an additional disarm or trip maneuver with the same bonus against a target adjacent to the first and also within your whip's reach. In addition, you
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Finesse, proficient in whip.

Feat.Name: Circling Offense
Feat.Description: You are skilled at approaching large foes with an ally in a way that makes it difficult for your foes to find an advantage against you or your ally.
Feat.Benefit: You receive a +1 dodge bonus to your Armor Class against attacks of opportunity provoked by moving through a creature's reach, provided the creature is of a larger size category than you and provided at least one other ally with Circling Offense is within
Feat.Prereq: Dodge, Mobility, base attack bonus +3.

Feat.Name: Footslasher
Feat.Description: You are trained to strike at a large foe's feet to impede its movement and cause great pain.
Feat.Benefit: If you damage a foe that is of a larger size category than you with a weapon that does piercing or slashing damage, you can attempt to damage the creature's feet in a way that impedes its movement. Attacking a foe in this way is a standard action-you cann

Feat.Name: Topple Foe
Feat.Description: You and your allies can work together to trip larger foes.
Feat.Benefit: If you attempt to trip a foe that is larger than you, you gain a +1 bonus on your CMB check to trip the foe as long as an ally with Topple Foe is flanking the foe with you. If multiple allies with Topple Foe are flanking the foe with you, you gain an addi
Feat.Prereq: Combat Expertise, Improved Trip.

Feat.Name: Jackal Heritage
Feat.Description: A jackalwere crouches somewhere in your family tree.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against mind-affecting effects, and a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.
Feat.Prereq: Humanoid, must be taken at 1st level.

Feat.Name: Drunken Brawler
Feat.Description: You have learned how to fight effectively while drunk.
Feat.Benefit: When you drink a tankard of ale or strong alcohol, you take a -2 penalty on Reflex saving throws, but gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your level, and gain a +2 alchemical bonus on Fortitude and Will saving throws. These bonuses lasts an hou

Feat.Name: Butterfly's Sting
Feat.Description: You can forgo a critical hit in order to pass it on to an ally.
Feat.Benefit: When you confirm a critical hit against a creature, you can choose to forgo the effect of the critical hit and grant a critical hit to the next ally who hits the creature with a melee attack before the start of your next turn. Your attack only deals norma
Feat.Prereq: Combat Expertise.

Feat.Name: Divination Guide
Feat.Description: Consulting the agents of your deity, you gain more guidance than most would.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you cast augury or divination, you receive further guidance by your deity's agents. You gain a +1 sacred bonus on all saving throws for 10 minutes per your caster level in the class you used to cast the augury or divination spell.
Feat.Prereq: The ability to cast augury or divination, caster level 3rd.

Feat.Name: Bullseye Shot
Feat.Description: You slow your breath, calm yourself, and hit the bullseye, just as you were trained to.
Feat.Benefit: You can spend a move action to steady your shot. When you do, you gain a +4 bonus on the next ranged attack roll you make before the end of your turn.
Feat.Prereq: Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +5.

Feat.Name: Nimble Natural Summons
Feat.Description: Your summoned natural allies ignore difficult terrain in undergrowth.
Feat.Benefit: Creatures you summon with summon nature's ally can move through any sort of undergrowth (such as natural thorns, briars, and similar terrain) at their normal speeds without taking damage or suffering other impairment. Thorns, briars, and undergrowth areas
Feat.Prereq: Augmented Summoning, Spell Focus (conjuration), caster level 6th.

Feat.Name: Charge of the Righteous
Feat.Description: You charge undead and fiends with confidence in your righteous cause.
Feat.Benefit: When you charge an undead creature or an evil outsider, you do not take the -2 penalty for charging.
Feat.Prereq: Base attack bonus +1.

Feat.Name: Protector's Strike
Feat.Description: When you smite evil, your divine power protects a creature within line of sight.
Feat.Benefit: When you choose the target of your smite evil ability, you also choose one creature other than you within line of sight. While your smite is in effect, the additional creature you chose gains a deflection bonus to AC equal to your Charisma modifier agains
Feat.Prereq: Smite evil class feature, base attack bonus +5.

Feat.Name: Bestow Hope
Feat.Description: Upon healing a creature with positive energy, you also give it hope.
Feat.Benefit: When you heal a creature by channeling positive energy, you also relieve its fear. If a creature you heal is shaken, that condition ends. If the creature is frightened, it becomes shaken instead. If the creature is panicked, it becomes frightened instead.
Feat.Prereq: Channel positive energy class feature, Improved Channel.

Feat.Name: Glorious Heat
Feat.Description: When you cast divine fire spells, their heat empowers nearby allies.
Feat.Benefit: When you cast a divine spell with the fire descriptor, choose a single ally within 30 feet that you can see. That ally heals half your level in hit points, and gains a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
Feat.Prereq: ability to cast divine spells, caster level 5th.

Feat.Name: Spear Dancer
Feat.Description: You incorporate a two-handed reach weapon into a dizzying martial dance.
Feat.Benefit: Each time you hit a creature with a two-handed reach weapon that you have Weapon Focus in, the creature is dazzled for 1 round.
Feat.Prereq: Weapon Focus (any twohanded reach weapon), Perform 4 ranks.

Feat.Name: Stone Read
Feat.Description: Even the faint movement and vibrations of stone can alert you to trouble.
Feat.Benefit: While within a primarily underground or mountainous environment, you gain a +2 bonus on Perception checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in Knowledge (dungeoneering), the bonus increases to +4.
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (dungeoneering) 4 ranks.

Feat.Name: Undermining Exploit
Feat.Description: Your familiarity with earth and stone gives you a distinct advantage on rocky battlefields.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +4 insight bonus on combat maneuvers against opponents that are located in rocky, difficult terrain.
Feat.Prereq: Knowledge (dungeoneering) 4 ranks.

Feat.Name: Ankle Biter
Feat.Description: You know how take a mouthful out of anyone who tries to overpower you.
Feat.Benefit: If you are the target of a combat maneuver you can, as an immediate action, attempt to bite your opponent in addition to any attacks of opportunity or other consequences your opponent might incur from attacking you. This bonus natural attack does not prov
Feat.Prereq: Goblin, Escape Artist 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Battle Singer
Feat.Description: Your battle songs can drive your fellow goblins to new heights of frenzy.
Feat.Benefit: When using bardic performance to inspire courage in allies, you can choose to sing in Goblin-allies who do not speak Goblin gain no benefits from this performance. Allied goblins who hear your battle songs become more energetic and brave, and thus add the
Feat.Prereq: Goblin, bardic performance class feature.

Feat.Name: Dog Killer, Horse Hunter
Feat.Description: Embracing fear and hatred of your ancestral foes allows you to make particularly telling blows.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 morale bonus on all attack and damage rolls made against dogs and horses (including doglike and horse-like targets such a nightmares or worgs). Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus on rolls to confirm critical hits against these foes.
Feat.Prereq: Goblin, Handle Animal 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Lead from the Back
Feat.Description: You allies depend far too much on your leadership and encouraging words for you to actually put yourself in harms' way.
Feat.Benefit: During any round in which you gain the benefit of cover or concealment against at least one opponent, and you are not threatened by any opponent, you can bark orders and encouragement to your allies as a standard action. Doing so grants all allies within
Feat.Prereq: Goblin, Intimidate 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Letter Fury
Feat.Description: You go wild when someone tries to steal the words from your head.
Feat.Benefit: If someone reads or writes in your presence (including casting spells like glyph of warding or symbol) you can, as an immediate action, choose to activate your rage class ability for 1 round. This round of rage does not count toward the total number of ro
Feat.Prereq: Goblin, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Roll With It
Feat.Description: You know how to take a hit, even if your reaction sends you bouncing and flying out of battle while shrieking at the top of your lungs.
Feat.Benefit: If you are struck by a melee weapon you can try to convert some or all of that damage into movement that sends you off in an uncontrolled bouncing roll. To do so, you must make an Acrobatics check (DC = 5 + the damage dealt from the attack) as an immediat
Feat.Prereq: Goblin, Acrobatics 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Saddle Shrieker
Feat.Description: You sometimes get carried away when encouraging your mount to fight.
Feat.Benefit: You can choose to take a -1 penalty on all attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to grant your mount a +1 bonus on all attack rolls and damage rolls made with natural weapons. These effects affect you and your mount for 1 round. When your base attack bo
Feat.Prereq: Goblin, Ride 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Combat Distraction
Feat.Description: Anyone who attacks you while you act like a lunatic exposes themselves to brutal counterattacks from your allies.
Feat.Benefit: As a full-round action, you can choose to do something that seems to serve no useful purpose. Example actions could include laughing at another creature's misfortune, rooting in your pockets for a snack, bending over to pick up what looks like a weird bug
Feat.Prereq: Goblin, Acrobatics 1 rank, Escape Artist 1 rank.

Feat.Name: Vandal
Feat.Description: Even other goblins admire your talent for mindless destruction.
Feat.Benefit: You treat unattended objects as if they were vulnerable to your sneak attack, but you only deal half as much damage as you would against an actual creature. For instance, if you rolled 12 extra damage from the sneak attack you would deal an extra 6 damage
Feat.Prereq: Goblin, sneak attack class feature.

Feat.Name: Ammo Drop
Feat.Description: Your coordination is so perfect that you can simply drop ammunition from your hand at the exact moment required for it to fall into an open sling as your twirl it around.
Feat.Benefit: You can load a sling or one end of a double sling with one hand as a swift action or move action. This does not provoke an attack of opportunity.
Feat.Prereq: Sleight of Hand 1 rank, proficient with sling.

Feat.Name: Halfling Slinger
Feat.Description: You have honed your racial talent for slingcraft.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls made using a sling.

Feat.Name: Juggle Load
Feat.Description: Your fingers are so nimble that reloading your sling is almost effortless for you.
Feat.Benefit: You can load a sling or double sling as a free action. This does not provoke attacks of opportunity. This feat allows you to fire your sling as many times in a fullattack action as you could attack if you were using a bow.
Feat.Prereq: Ammo Drop, Sleight of Hand 1 rank, proficient with sling.

Feat.Name: Large Target
Feat.Description: The larger a creature is, the easier you find it to strike a vulnerable spot when attacking with a sling.
Feat.Benefit: Your attacks with all kinds of slings add a +1 bonus on damage rolls for every size category your opponent is larger than you. For example, if you are Small and your opponent Large (a difference of two sizes), you gain a +2 damage bonus. This is considere
Feat.Prereq: Proficient with sling.

Feat.Name: Whip-Slinger
Feat.Description: You can use your sling as a sap to make attacks of opportunity.
Feat.Benefit: When wielding a sling, double sling, or halfling sling staff, you threaten areas around you as normal and can make attacks of opportunity with the sling into these threatened areas. The sling deals 1d4 nonlethal bludgeoning damage (1d6 for a Medium wielde
Feat.Prereq: Proficient with sling.

Feat.Name: Amplified Rage
Feat.Description: When adjacent to other raging allies, your rages become even more powerful.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are raging and adjacent to a raging ally who also has this feat or flanking the same opponent as a raging ally with this feat, your morale bonuses to Strength and Constitution increase by +4. This feat does not stack with itself (you only gai
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Blood Vengeance
Feat.Description: Seeing an ally fall in combat fills you with a murderous fury.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever one of your worthy allies is brought to negative hit points or killed, you may enter a state similar to but less powerful than a barbarian's rage as a free action on your turn. If you have the rage class feature and are already raging, your moral
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, non-lawful.

Feat.Name: Brutal Grappler
Feat.Description: When helping an ally grapple, you can damage the target.
Feat.Benefit: When you and an ally with this feat have grappled the same creature, you may attempt to damage the opponent on your turn (whether you were the one who first initiated the grapple or were assisting your ally in doing so). You and the ally are treated as ai
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc.

Feat.Name: Destroyer's Blessing
Feat.Description: Breaking things adds to your power.
Feat.Benefit: When you are raging and you succeed at a sunder attempt, you regain 1 round of rage. If the sunder attempt causes the object to gain the broken condition, you heal 1 hit point.
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, rage class feature, worshiper of the Destroyer.

Feat.Name: Ferocious Tenacity
Feat.Description: You spit in the face of death.
Feat.Benefit: When raging, if you are hit by an attack that would deal enough hit points of damage to kill you (negative hit points equal to your Constitution score), as an immediate action you may expend 1 or more rounds of rage to negate some of this damage and keep
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, ferocity racial trait, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Ferocious Tenacity
Feat.Description: You spit in the face of death.
Feat.Benefit: When raging, if you are hit by an attack that would deal enough hit points of damage to kill you (negative hit points equal to your Constitution score), as an immediate action you may expend 1 or more rounds of rage to negate some of this damage and keep
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, ferocity racial trait, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Fire God's Blessing
Feat.Description: The Fire God rewards you for killing enemies with flame.
Feat.Benefit: When in combat, if you deal fire damage to an enemy, you heal 1 hit point. You can only benefit from this healing once per round. Attacks that cause a target to catch on fire heal you each round the target takes fire damage.
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, worshiper of the Fire God.

Feat.Name: Gore Fiend
Feat.Description: Horrible wounds, whether on yourself or your enemies, makes your blood sing.
Feat.Benefit: When you are raging and you confirm a critical hit with a melee weapon or suffer a critical hit yourself (whether by a melee weapon, spell, or ranged weapon), you regain 1 round of rage.
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Sympathetic Rage
Feat.Description: Seeing an ally enter a rage causes you to enter a rage-like state.
Feat.Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who is raging, you may choose to enter a similar but less powerful rage as a free action on your turn. This weaker rage gives you all the benefits and penalties of a rage, except your morale bonus to Strength and Const
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, non-lawful.

Feat.Name: Thrill of the Kill
Feat.Description: Killing fuels your rage.
Feat.Benefit: When you are raging and your attack brings an enemy to negative hit points or kills them, you regain 1 round of rage. You may only use this feat if the fallen enemy had at least as many Hit Dice as you.
Feat.Prereq: Half-orc or orc, rage class feature.

Feat.Name: Warleader's Rage
Feat.Description: Your rages are so inspiring to your allies that they don't have to remain adjacent to you to stay raging.
Feat.Benefit: Feats and abilities that allow an ally to rage or enhance a rage if adjacent to you (such as Amplified Rage and Sympathetic Rage) persist as long as your ally is within 30 feet of you and can see you. The conditions to activate the rage effect remain unch
Feat.Prereq: Cha 13, half-orc or orc, non-lawful.

Feat.Name: Adept Channel
Feat.Description: Some orc adepts enjoy a greater connection to their gods, and can channel their faith through their unholy symbols. You gain the ability to channel energy as a cleric.
Feat.Benefit: You gain the channel energy class feature, as a cleric, usable 2 times per day. This ability otherwise functions like the cleric's channel energy ability, except that your effective cleric level is equal to your divine spellcasting class level -3. Unlike
Feat.Prereq: Ability to cast divine spells, summon familiar class ability, caster level 4th, Cha 13.

Feat.Name: Cold Celerity
Feat.Description: You are a child of the frozen north, and you draw your strength from the biting cold and unforgiving conditions.
Feat.Benefit: When you are in conditions of severe cold (below 0° F), you gain a +2 bonus on initiative checks and a +1 bonus on attack rolls. In addition, you gain the same bonuses for 1 round after any round in which you take cold damage.

Feat.Name: Tribal Scars
Feat.Description: You endured the grueling coming-of-age rituals of your tribe or following, and proudly bear the scars that grant you the blessings of your tribe's ancestors or totem.
Feat.Benefit: You gain 6 hit points. In addition, you gain another benefit, depending on which Mammoth Lords following you belong to. Bearpelt: You gain a +1 bonus on Fortitude saves and a +2 bonus on Intimidate checks. Greattusk: You gain a +2 bonus on combat maneuver
Feat.Prereq: Member of a Mammoth Lords tribe or following.

Feat.Name: Witchbreaker
Feat.Description: Your training and skill in combating witches and hags have made you resistant to their magic, and you can disrupt their magical hatred.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against the hexes, spells, spell-like abilities, and supernatural abilities of witches and hags. In addition, whenever you score a critical hit against such a creature, any allies under the effects of a mind-affecting
Feat.Prereq: Iron Will.

Feat.Name: Deadly Dealer
Feat.Description: Your skill with handling cards and arcane talents allow you to turn mundane cards into deadly weapons.
Feat.Benefit: You can throw a card as though it were a dart, with the same damage, range, and other features. You must use the Arcane Strike feat when throwing a card in this way, or else the card lacks the magical force and precision to deal lethal damage. A card is d
Feat.Prereq: Arcane Strike, Sleight of Hand 5 ranks.

Feat.Name: Thunder And Fang
Feat.Description: You have mastered the ancient Shoanti Thunder and Fang fighting style, allowing you to fight with increased effectiveness when wielding an earth breaker and klar.
Feat.Benefit: You can use an earth breaker as though it were a one-handed weapon. When using an earth breaker in one hand and a klar in your off hand, you retain the shield bonus your klar grants to your Armor Class even when you use it to attack. Treat your klar as a
Feat.Prereq: Str 15, Two-Weapon Fighting, Weapon Focus (earth breaker), Weapon Focus (klar)
Feat.PrereqFeat: Two-Weapon Fighting, Weapon Focus (earth breaker), Weapon Focus (klar)

Feat.Name: Chainbreaker
Feat.Description: Nothing rouses your fury and makes you more deadly in battle than the sight of slaves cowering before their masters.
Feat.Benefit: When in combat with an opponent that you know owns or trades in slaves, once per round you may add a bonus to damage rolls for a melee attack, ranged attack, or targeted spell against that opponent. This bonus damage is +1 for every four Hit Dice you have
Feat.Prereq: Over the course of at least five different occasions, free a cumulative total of 50+ sentient beings held in unjust captivity.

Feat.Name: Devil's Foe
Feat.Description: Once you were just another helpless victim, but now even the deepest pits of Hell ring with the lamentations of your adversaries.
Feat.Benefit: Your attacks count as good-aligned for the purposes of bypassing the damage reduction of devils.
Feat.Prereq: Face 10 different devils in combat and take damage or suffer some other sort of injury from five or more attacks made by each one without falling unconscious, fleeing, or otherwise becoming unable to strike back at them.

Feat.Name: Grand Master Performer
Feat.Description: You grant your allies even greater bonuses when using your bardic performance abilities.
Feat.Benefit: When any of your bardic performance abilities grant your allies a bonus, that bonus increases by +1. This bonus stacks with the bonus from the Master Performer feat.
Feat.Prereq: Bardic performance class feature, Extra Performance, Master Performer, bard level 8th, Kitharodian Academy 20 TPA.

Feat.Name: Ki Diversity
Feat.Description: You have trained at the feet of the masters of the Kusari- Gama, a secret society of monk warriors. With their secrets you have mastered new ways to apply your ki.
Feat.Benefit: You learn how to channel your ki in a new ability. Choose one of the following ki powers: Bone Crusher: When you succeed at a trip or disarm combat maneuver, you may spend 1 point from your ki pool as a swift action to deal damage to your opponent as if y
Feat.Prereq: Ki pool class feature, Wis 13, Kusari-Gama 25 TPA.

Feat.Name: Let Them Come
Feat.Description: You have trained to fight onrushing enemy hordes. With a carefully timed strike you ensure that their reckless charge will be their undoing.
Feat.Benefit: You treat all one- or two-handed melee weapons as if they had the brace special feature.
Feat.Prereq: Dwarf, Ninth Battalion TPA 25.

Feat.Name: Master Performer
Feat.Description: When using your bardic performance abilities, you grant your allies greater bonuses.
Feat.Benefit: When any of your bardic performance abilities grant your allies a bonus, that bonus is increased by +1.
Feat.Prereq: Bardic performance class feature, Extra Performance, Kitharodian Academy 15 TPA.

Feat.Name: Nameless Servitor
Feat.Description: The fact that you have given up your real name makes you resistant to certain types of magic.
Feat.Benefit: Anyone who attempts to use magic in order to learn personal information about you, such as through divination, scrying, or similar magic, must make a caster level check with a DC equal to 10 plus your level to succeed. You are immune to spells that requir
Feat.Prereq: Risen Guard rank, Risen Guard 10 TPA.

Feat.Name: Old Cults Awakener
Feat.Description: You hear the voices of the Old Ones, and believe it is your destiny to awaken others to their ancient cause using bizarre and torturous rituals. Whether your work leaves these individuals mad or truly touched by alien sentience remains unproven.
Feat.Benefit: You can attempt a DC 25 Heal check upon an unconscious but stable intelligent creature. The ritual takes 1 hour to complete. If it's successful, the victim must make a DC 25 Will save or he gains a false memory of a vision that he has personally been chos
Feat.Prereq: Old Cults 20 TPA.

Feat.Description: Your walk, stance, and voice all amplify your status as a Hellknight when you cast spells or use spell-like abilities against opponents.

Feat.Name: Silent Performer
Feat.Description: You can use any bardic performance ability without making a sound.
Feat.Benefit: You can use your audible-component bardic performance as visual-component bardic performances. Any bardic ability used in this manner expends 4 times as many bardic performance rounds as normal.
Feat.Prereq: Bardic performance class feature, Extra Performance, Master Performer, bard level 12th, Kitharodian Academy 15 TPA.

Feat.Prereq: Endurance, Risen Guard rank, Risen Guard 15 TPA.

Feat.Name: Verbose Performer
Feat.Description: The range of your bardic performances increases.
Feat.Benefit: Double the range of any bardic performance ability that possesses a range in the ability description.
Feat.Prereq: Bardic performance class feature, Extra Performance, Master Performer, bard level 8th, Kitharodian Academy 15 TPA.

Feat.Name: Whispered Knowledge

Feat.Benefit: Whenever you gain a level, you gain 2 hero points instead of 1.

Feat.Description: Even at the start of your career, it was clear that you had a chance at greatness, and your legend continues to grow with every adventure.
Feat.Benefit: You gain a hero point. The maximum number of hero points you can have at any one time is increased to 5.

Feat.Description: You are an expert trainer of horses, hounds, falcons, or hunting cats.
Feat.Benefit: Animal Companion class feature: bird, dog, small cat, horse. Mount: horses; You gain a +2 bonus on Handle Animal and Nature checks with chosen animal type. +1 lvl to determine abilities of your animal companion or mount.
